I've never seen your father personally, May, but I've used his books as references for my research into the Hoenn creation story. His "The Coexistence of People and Pokémon" book in particular was of great help.
Doing field research, eh? I wonder what he could be researching out there... Could he be researching about new types of evolution, May?
Well, field work will yield more results than doing desk study... I suppose if there are types of evolutions that are yet to be discovered, he could be looking into that, May...
I came here by way of Sinnoh, so you could say I'm quite a bit away from home, May. Same could be said for Hoenn as well.
That's hardly the most intelligent of decisions, May! It's not forever that you will be able to maintain the standard needed to participate in prestigious contests!
Is that the case, May? Why would you pass that opportunity up?! You of all people should know how difficult it is to qualify for those contests!
I've looked at fashion magazines from time to time, but I've never subscribed to any of them, May. Nevertheless, it seems that I have a talent for classy fashion.
It would depend on your definition of a universe, but I've traveled to the Distortion World, a parallel world created by the legendary Giratina.
Due to a series of remarkable events, I was able to step into the Distortion World, a sort of "anti-world" created and maintained by Giratina, the shadow Pokémon.

In the stories my grandma used to tell me, touching a kitsune's tail will cause a person to be mentally and emotionally bound to the kitsune, turning them into a slave. I suppose you would tell me the truth, Senko.

It's always been said that a kitsune's tail is the most dangerous part, because merely touching it will cause a person to be utterly and permanently mesmerized by the kitsune's supernatural charms. Is that true, Senko?
I've read up on kitsune shrines, and offerings of various types of food seem to be the most common, Senko. For some reason, tofu seems to come up quite a lot too.
I've been meaning to ask... I've read that tofu is the most common offering to kitsune shrines: twice-fried tofu, tofu noodles, tofu sushi... You kitsune must be quite fond of tofu, Senko.
I have been wondering about that for quite a while now, Senko... I've read that a kitsune grows an additional tail every century, and conversely becomes more powerful.
I figured that you've been alive for less than 100 years based on the fact that you only have one tail, Senko. I always thought an older kitsune would have more tails, or more power.
There's nothing wrong with admiring ancient statues, Critical Darling. The best sculptors have quite an eye for anatomical details: muscles, skins, hair, and yes, penises also.
The amount of skill and effort required to create marble statues are impressive by themselves, Critical Darling. You can't cut corners, hence the pristine-looking penises.
New experiences are a vital part of the music creation process, isn't it? Well, what better way to do that than going on archaeological expeditions, Critical Darling?
Given that you've never explored ruins before, I would say it would be worth the time and effort, Critical Darling. After all, it might serve as inspiration for your next big hit!
Surely, there must be something, anything you can think of, Critical Darling? You couldn't possibly have shielded yourself from history your entire life.
I can't think of a reason why I would want to duel with the devil, Critical Darling. Sure, I've beaten Giratina before, but that was a different scenario.
I don't see the benefit of going for picking a fight like that, Critical Darling. I might have stood my ground against Giratina, but I suspect that's a whole different deal entirely.
If there's one ability that I wish I had, it would be the ability to speak and read all languages, Critical Darling. That would make my studies all the much easier.
I wouldn't exactly trade anything for it, but if I could, I would want the ability to understand all written and spoken languages, Critical Darling. That's perfect for my job.
I don't have an authoritative say about this, but I'm pretty sure they're still looking for performers for the Pokémon World Tournament Junior Cup, Critical Darling.
The Pokémon World Tournament Junior Cup can never seem to fill out their performers list, Critical Darling, so I would be looking in their direction if I were you.
I don't know how to play any instruments, Critical Darling, but when I was a child, a salesman sold me the Azure Flute, said to summon Arceus. It didn't work when I tried to play it.
My Pokémon are very effective at keeping away any stalkers, Miku. If I see any, I can get them to leave with a simple flick of my wrist.
I've anticipated that something like this would happen, Miku. That's why I brought my Pokémon with me. They should be more than enough to handle any intruder in this place.
This talk of vegetable juice reminds me of aojiru, which my grandma made me drink when I was a child, Miku. It was made of kale, was very bitter, and looks disgusting. Needless to say, I hated it.
No, I haven't heard of Europe either, Aoba. Would you say that it is geographically close to either Kalos or Unova?
Europe doesn't ring a bell either, Aoba. If you're familiar with the Alola region, would you say that Europe is close to it?
Oh, so "animal" is just another term for Pokémon, Aoba? If you describe what a "bear" is, I might be able to recognize it.
I get it now, Aoba. "Animal" is your region's terminology for a Pokémon. I suspect that "bear" refers to a Pokémon that I know by another name, so give me a description of a "bear".
Come to think of it, Charlie is a bit of a weird name for a woman, Charlie. I would much prefer to refer to you as Charlotte instead, if you don't mind.
When I first heard then name Charlie, I thought it would be a man's name. Charlotte is a lot less ambiguous, so I would go with that instead.
I get a lot of fan mails myself, Charlie, but I simply do not have the time to read any of them. So, I've left them at a rather tall stack at the side of my work desk.
I seem to receive a sack load of mail from my adoring fans every month, Charlie. I'm too busy to browse through them, so I just leave them at a stack at my work area.
Well, I suppose a painting in my image wouldn't hurt at all... Do any style of painting you want, Ignatz!
I've seen plenty of flowers from all over the world, but I have to say that the Rugosa Rose still remains my favorite, Sucrose. It's the symbolic flower of the Sinnoh region, I must add.
The Rugosa Rose is the regional flower of Sinnoh, so I will go with that, Sucrose. Besides, it looks pretty and is very fragrant, even when compared with flowers from other regions.
Getting a bit philosophical, Takatoshi? If my clone never became a Pokémon trainer or an archaeologist, then we can hardly be considered the same person. We would barely have anything in common.
I'm not one for philosophy, but if my clone is fundamentally different from me, then we can't be considered the same person, can we? We would be more similar to identical twins than clones.
Yakisoba Pan? Isn't that stir-fried noodles in a bun, Takatoshi? That's hardly my choice of noodles, but I know it's popular in certain sectors.
I'm not quite familiar with street food, but Yakisoba Pan is just a bun stuffed with stir-fried noodles, isn't it, Takatoshi? I've tried it before, but I wasn't too fond of it.
You mentioned that the devil got beaten by a kid with a fiddle, Critical Darling... How exactly do you defeat a devil with a fiddle? That's quite an odd detail to me.
I'm quite curious about that story you mentioned earlier, of the devil being defeated using a fiddle, Critical Darling. How exactly does that work?
Well, you can try for a sport anthem, or anything inspiring, Critical Darling. Since most of the contestant are still juniors, I would steer away from songs that are too risque or vulgar.
Language is something that most people take for granted, but it is a tool unique to humans, Critical Darling. Watashi wa watashitachi ga bokokugo o kyōyū suru koto ga okoru koto ni odoroiteimasuga.
Perhaps that's true for the real Azure Flute, but the one I received was undoubtedly fake. Besides, no salesman in the right mind would sell the real thing for such a low price.
Your guess is as good as mine, but the "Azure Flute" I received was made of plastic, so it couldn't have been the real artifact. It wasn't a particularly convincing fake to boot.
What are you doing in a place like this anyway, Dawn? I didn't know you like playing poker.
Truth be told, I would have never expected to meet you here of all places, Dawn. What brings you to a game like this?
That's an interesting development, Hilda. How is your family's reputation in the present day, considering that your ancestor was executed due to being in the wrong side of that war?
Well, things are currently peaceful from the sound of things, but if there's one thing I've learnt from history, it's that peace never last long when there's too many rulers, Hilda.
As the idiom would say, five rulers are four rulers too many, Hilda. If history repeats itself, then another succession crisis is bound to happen sooner rather than later.
I don't know anything about musical instruments, but I presume a fiddle of gold would be worth a lot for someone to bet their life on it, Critical Darling.
Is a fiddle of gold worth a lot, Critical Darling? I would think that it would have to be, otherwise betting your life for it is incredibly foolish.
"Japanese" and "English"? Is that what they're called where you're from? Anyway, "Japanese" as you call it is the native language in regions like Sinnoh, Kanto, Hoenn, and Johto.
I've never heard of these languages being referred to as "Japanese" and "English" before, but I can tell you that "Japanese" is the common tongue in regions like Sinnoh and Hoenn.
Well, the merchant had already slipped away by the time I realized that it was a fake flute. It did make for a good paperweight, at least up until it started falling apart by itself.
Dusk Magi, was it? I didn't know you were into role play, or psychic-types. Although it's been a long time since we met, it's nice to know that you never grew out of your quirky side.

Your alter-ego is Dusk Magi, right? I know it's been a handful of years since we've last met, but I've never figured your forte would be role-playing, or even psychic-types. At least I've always known you to have a wacky, fun-loving personality.

A Mismagius... a somewhat peculiar choice of outfit for you, but I can't deny the craftsmanship of your attire! I take it that you were allured by the prospect of a casual game while getting to play a persona.

I see that your costume is evocative of a Mismagius... Not at all what I would expect you to be dressed as if we ever got to meet at all, but you do you, and I suppose this would be as good as a place as any to act out an alter-ego.

...Yes, there's nothing wrong at all with growing old... Anyhow, given the craftsmanship of your attire, I ought to have dressed for the occasion. What would your counsel reckon to be a fitting Pokémon to serve as theme for my appearance?

... Nothing wrong with growing old... Speaking of your costume, the details and the effort poured into it... it makes my attire look drab in comparison. If you are willing to impart your counsel, what theme would be most fitting for my garb in this given event?

Those are excellent choices, Dusk Magi! After this game, you should help me pick out a fitting Halloween attire. It's not something I've done in a long time, but it sounds very exciting. What do you think?

You truly are wise, Dusk Magi! If you are willing to extend your assistance further, it would be most appreciated if you can assist me in choosing an attire fitting for the current event. I can't claim to be experienced in such a task.

Hmm, that's interesting... If the number of tails does indeed equal the power of a kitsune, I wonder if the kitsune back home are just stronger than yours, or if your kitsune just takes longer to mature.

That explains that part, but what about your level of power. If takes ten times as long for you to grow a tail, then you must be weaker than the kitsune back home... or perhaps you just age much more slowly?
Oral tradition has never truly been a reliable source. But, I do wonder still, what does touching a kitsune's tail entails, Senko? Sounds like it's more complicated than merely touching it.
Well, oral tradition has always been prone to bias and embellishment... You did mention that touching your tail is somewhat of a special event? Does it have a significance?

Would your blog happen to be focused on culture, Stocking? I could save myself the time if I can use details from your travel log to perform an assessment of the local culture of the places you visited?

If it is a travel blog, and you perform copious documentation of local traditions and rituals, then that could be quite helpful in my research, Stocking. At the very least, it can help me pinpoint which regions to visit next.
A goddess of destruction, intriguing... How does this goddess go about causing destruction, Noire? Are there tales about this goddess's previous acts?
What are the primary method used by this goddess to cause widespread destruction, Noire? I would presume some old folklore about her acts would have survived.

I'm quite fond of The Story of a Puppet, which is about a living puppet that keeps encountering misfortunes due to his penchant for lying. I felt it was a good way of teaching to children that honesty is the best policy, Fischl.

I always felt that fairy tales should teach good morals to children, so I would go with The Story of a Puppet. It teaches children that dishonesty will cause more trouble than simply telling the truth, no matter how difficult it might be.

I can hardly afford them, but my favorite jewels have to be diamond and pearl, Rouge. Additionally, I'm quite impartial to jewelry made of platinum as well. Just because I can't afford them doesn't mean I can't admire them.

I've heard folk tales of a Jewel of Life, which was a gift from the creator Pokémon Arceus, and is deemed indestructible. Using the Jewel of life, any piece of land can be rendered rich and self-sustaining .

It's just a bit of folklore, but the Jewel of Life deserves a mention. Created by Arceus himself, it has the power of making any land luscious and fertile no matter how desolate it was, and is even said to be indestructible.
You've got some juicy secrets to share with us, Rouge? I'm curious if you've got anything pertaining to historical lies, ones which would redefine how history would be interpreted.

Well, I don't know what your friend of yours is like, but I suppose if you want to get him off his negative energy, you can have him engage with nature. I think activities like tree-planting and cave exploration might help him a bit, Rouge.
From the sound of it, your friend has a bit of an antisocial streak, Rouge. Having him reconnect with nature might help him open up a bit. It can be a bit simple, like hiking or gardening.
Since she's your twin, I would presume she also has violet hair, Kyou. And given her propensity with cards and fortune telling, would it be reasonable to extrapolate that she's a Hex Maniac?

Let me do a bit of detective work, she's your twin, so she might have violet hair, and she has a fascination with predictions and cards. My only guess is that she must be a Hex Maniac, Kyou. Was my inference right?
I've never played strip poker before, and I've figured now would be as good as a time as any to try it out, Kumatora. There's always a first time for everything.
Well, I wanted to try out something new, and this is my first time playing a game like this, Kumatora. It's always nice to have new experiences.
I have a lot of friends in both the Sinnoh region and Unova region, Kumatora. I've made a handful of friends in other regions I've visited as well. Why do you ask?
I can't exactly count how many close friends I have, but I have plenty of them both in Sinnoh and Unova, as long as a handful of other regions I've visited before? Any reason you asked?
It's quite unfortunate how some people are willing to ruin nature just to fuel their greed, Kumatora. Fortunately, a large part of the Sinnoh region is considered a nature reserve.
If left unmitigated, greedy businessmen can cause irreparable damage to the environment, Kumatora. I'm so glad that there are laws that rendered a large part of the Sinnoh region as a nature reserve.
You know, Sinnoh is primarily known for its trumpets, but if I have a leitmotif, I would love it to be played on a piano, Kumatora. It can be both majestic and intimidating.
I've always been quite fond of pianos, Kumatora. If I were to create a personal musical theme, I would definitely choose a piano for it.
A bike is definitely a worthwhile investment, Kumatora. Not only is it a cheap and clean way of travel, but it's also a good form of exercise.
I would second the idea of getting a bike, Kumatora. It's both good for the environment, and also good for the body given the extra exercise you'll get.
I must admit that I have a bit of a sweet tooth, Kumatora, and my favorite is ice cream. My favorite ice cream flavor is... Well, I'll need some time to think about that...
I'll be lying if I said I didn't have a bit of a soft spot for ice cream, Kumatora. As for the specific flavor... what's my favorite flavor again? I might need some time to ponder this question...
My parents never really discussed that topic with me, Kumatora. It's something that I had to learn by myself... when I'm alone... at my bedroom...
It's nice that your parents where quite open about it and taught you a lot, Kumatora. My parents simply never taught it to me, and I had to do my own research... in my bedroom... at night...
I suppose my flaw is that I'm not too assertive when it comes it my romantic life, ~nagamimi~. I just... freeze up when I try to talk to men, in a romantic context.

This might not be what you're looking for, but I would say that my biggest fault is my lack of confidence in approaching men romantically. I simply can't get myself to be more straightforward, ~nagamimi~.
I feel like I need a bit of a coffee, but I think that might end up detrimental in a nervy game like this. Do you have some decaf coffee, ~nagamimi~?
I don't think I had coffee earlier this morning, and I need a bit of buzz. Caffeine would do a lot more harm in this context though... I would like a cup of decaf coffee, ~nagamimi~.

Well, Sinnoh is a very cold place, so having winter garb is a matter of practicality, ~nagamimi~. It must be said though, that my outfit is not at all unseasonably warm even in tropical climates, so I still use the same attire.

When you live in a very cold region like Sinnoh, winter clothing is more of a necessity than a fashion statement, ~nagamimi~. Despite common misconception, my attire holds up in warmer regions just fine, so I also wear this anywhere I go.
I don't know about marrying me... but if I were a wife, I have a good sense of responsibility, and a stable job, and I would spend a lot of time and attention to my partner...

I wouldn't say that it would be with you specifically... but if I were to be married, I would say that my best attributes are my adherence to my responsibilities, both in and out of home. I can't let my job consume my personal life, after all.
First thing, why would you ask a potential victim how to scam them? Second thing, why would you want to scam me? Why not trying to get a legitimate job, Reimu?

You know, if you're planning to scam someone, giving them a heads up first is a severe technical flaw in your plan, Reimu. Additionally, why are you even considering scamming me? A job should suffice for your measly needs.
Considering how important communication is in the present day, I always make sure to bring my Pokétch with me, Samus. Although, I've been thinking lately of replacing it with a Holo Caster.

One thing I can't afford to leave behind is my Pokétch, since it's essential when it comes to coordinating with other people, Samus. I must say, I'm thinking of buying a Holo Caster once prices go down a bit.
There was that one time that I forgot to take my change from an ice cream stand, and I had to went back and get it. It might not sound like much, but every Pokédollar matters, Samus.

When I was on a vacation trip once, I had to backtrack from my destination urgently so I can get my change from an ice cream stand that I had left behind. Those were a handful of Pokédollars that I almost lost, Samus.

Among all archaeologists, the greatest artifact there is has to be the Jewel of Life, Trixie. It's been said that it can make any piece of land fertile, and was a gift from Arceus. It's most likely just a myth though.

If there's one thing I would love to have, I would say the Jewel of Life, Trixie. It was made by Arceus, and can make any piece of land it touches productive. I doubt it actually exists, but it would be great to have.
As much as I like this outfit, I was thinking of trying out something more suitable for warm weather. Do you think I would look good in a blue blouse, Trixie?

I've been thinking something like that as well, Trixie. This outfit isn't exactly fashionable in summer settings, and there's this blue blouse I've always wanted to try on. Do you think such a blouse would suit me?

Not exactly a dungeon, but there was one time where I single-handedly cleared out a cave that was being used to stash stolen Pokémon, Trixie. Well, there was a young trainer that helped distract the guards.

It's probably doesn't actually fit your question, Trixie, but I once infiltrated a cave used as a storage for stolen Pokémon, and apprehended all the criminals involved. The only help I had was a young trainer serving as a decoy.
A blog about sweets sounds very interesting, Stocking. In your travels so far, which region would you say has the best sweets?
Your blog piques my interest, Stocking. If you could recommend one place to visit solely for its local sweets, what place would it be?
What would you say is the biggest difference between their cuisine and the cuisine in your homeland, Petra. Are there any culinary influences between the two?
Just how distinctive is the food in Fodlan compared to those where you're from, Petra. I would presume that both cuisines have their distinctive flavor profile.
Talk of your shamans and priestesses is of great interest to me, Petra. I'm curious about their roles and obligations in your religion and beliefs.
You seem knowledgeable about the practices and beliefs of your shamans and priestesses, Petra. What would you say are their biggest roles when it comes to the local beliefs?
Hmm, this could be a good way for me to learn more about the literature from Liyue... Sure, I would like you compose a poem for me, Hu Tao.
I can appreciate someone who is creative enough to compose a poem on the spot, Hu Tao. As an added bonus, I can also learn a bit about how poems from Liyue sound.

state.text: Since you were curious as to what my Garchomp looked like, here she is, Miku.
I have no problem with showing you my Garchomp, Miku. So, here she is!

case.state: I wouldn't know about that, ~zoe~... but I can't dispute the fact that I would make a great older sister figure... What do you think about all of these, ~laevatein~?
I've been thinking of taking a dip myself after this game, just to clean off some of these grime, but I'm not too sure about getting your fur all over the water...
Going for a quick bath doesn't sound like a bad idea at all, by I suspect that your fur might present a bit of a problem, especially if you're shedding...

I'm not sure what type of gossip you're looking for, ~kora~, but I've heard that there's a house in Canalave City that's apparently haunted. I've visited it before, but it was locked and appeared to have been abandoned for years.

If any gossips would do, there's this old abandoned mansion located deep in Eterna Forest, ~kora~. The locals claim that the mansion is haunted by at least three ghosts. I've been there, and didn't find anything out of the ordinary aside from a broken television.

I see... I've always heard that being a shrine maiden is merely a part-time job, even if the wage is relatively modest... I know that some of them make ends meet by being traveling fortune tellers, ~reimu~.
Hmm, that does match up with all the rumors I've heard about shrine maidens, given that your position is merely part-time... Since you already perform fortune telling, why not do so as a wanderer?

That's a bit too much to ask, don't you think? If you were to be part of a married couple, you both have to pull the burden of responsibility equally, ~reimu~. You just can't rely on your partner to do all the hard work!

Being married is a responsibility in itself, ~reimu~. It has its up and downs, and it is a pair effort to overcome every hurdle that comes in the way. It can't be that only one person is doing all the heavy lifting!
I'm stumped at how else you would go about making money, ~reimu~. The only other option you really have is selling souvenirs. You can make easy money selling religious amulets.
Aside from fortune telling, another popular business among shrines appear to be the sale of souvenirs. Selling the likes of religious amulets and spiritual talismans ought to attract some buyers.
This Flower Flower fruit - all one must do is consume this fruit and they'll have similar powers to you, ~nico_robin~? It's as simple as that?
Is there more to this Flower Flower fruit, ~nico_robin~? It can't be as easy as eating an entire fruit, can it?
Oh, are you checking your work schedule on your tablet, Meia? You don't happen to have any appointments after this game, do you?
A laser ring... I remember an artifact we found: a ring with a tiny knife hidden inside. Not particularly useful for actual use, but it's interesting that such a device was created.

That wouldn't be the first time I've seen a weapon disguised as a ring. We once received a gun fashioned into a ring, as a donated artifact, and it had allegedly blown off the user's fingers when used.
Some countries still have kings and queens, while others have abolished the monarchy. Does Sinnoh have a monarchy? Who knows? I certainly don't.
You mentioned something about your friend investigating a "Void Century", Nami. Can you elaborate on that?
Lucario is one of my Pokémon, Nami. I've had him since I was a teenager. This is the longest I've been separated from him, and it's making me worry.
You mentioned many different types of ruins dotting your homeland, Dust. Do you have any knowledge about the history behind them?
I'm afraid I have never heard of the Moonblood legend you are referring to, Dust. What does the legend say, and how does it connect to you?
Considering how exciting it is for me to learn about the more discreet side of history, I can't imagine how big of a revelation it must be for you, Meia.
Oh, there's definitely a lot of lewd artifacts on this planet, Meia. You can't excavate at an archaeological site without digging up one. Of course, we can't display them.
Meia, that colonization story of yours sounds like a modern version of a creation story. I'd be grateful if you can indulge some details of that story.
That's an intriguing offer, Meia. I was planning on returning to the Sinjoh Ruins, to study the Mystri Stage. It's said that the world will be reborn there.
Is that true, Meia? Is your version of history really that horribly altered? That's the ultimate nightmare for someone who studies history.
Does your planet's version of Earth history really omit men, Meia? How did they accomplish that? Regrettably, Earth's history is centered around male figures.
Hold on, Meia. Did you say that Earth has achieved galactic colonization? It seems that I was so focused on studying the past that I didn't notice the future arriving.
Sounds like that would be an interesting period of your planet's history to study, Meia. It's not at all different from studying Earth's history through archeology.
Your statement makes me wonder how many manuscripts and engravings I've read in the past also alter history like your planet did, Meia. Very intriguing.
Ah, yes, those types of rule have existed all throughout history, and there are some that still exists today. It says a lot about human nature, doesn't it, Meia?
I suppose that's a sensible move, Meia. I remember a similar situation in the past where communities on separate islands are connected solely by trading ships.
The manuscript was probably allegorical in nature, Meia. There was that one instance where a young trainer produced an egg with the help of an Arceus. Perhaps that's what reborn means.
Oh, that's a very interesting and well-written prophecy, Dust. From the sound of it, you were destined for greatness. Have you fulfilled the prophecy yet?
"Wars of Unification". So many great empires have risen and fallen through warfare. Sinnoh is fortunate to have been relatively peaceful in its history.
I somehow doubt we're fictional, Mary, because how can you explain our presence here? Besides, a competent writer would have made me easier to beat.
There are many archaeologists like you, Mary. I do think that part of the appeal of archeology is being able to travel the world as part of the studies.
History isn't always clean and pretty, and there are many details that people would rather not know. I'm interested in hearing more from you, Mary.
History is filled with examples of leaders choosing honor before reason, leading to unnecessary bloodshed. I'm happy it didn't go that way, Mary.
All of those things you listed are horrible, Mary. I do hope things have changed for the better.
That's great news, Jessie! I always say that explorations are more interesting with a traveling companion. What time are you available, and do you have a particular cave in mind?
That's good to hear, Jessie! I don't know about cabbage fields, but there's a couple of caves that I'm think of exploring. What date can you go?
Oh, you live near a cave system, Jessie? That just sounds perfect! I suppose I can spare some time later tonight and do some preliminary surveys.
You mentioned that your house is a short distance away from a cave system, Jessie? That's an opportunity. I can do some analysis on the cave entrance this evening.
That creation story you've mentioned might not be as far-fetched as you think, Jessie. I do remember reading a similar myth once. Want to hear it?
Your friend might be onto something there, Jessie. I do recall reading an ancient creation myth similar to that. I can tell the story if you're interested.

I must warn you that this a rather lengthy but gripping story, Jessie, but you can tell me to stop any time if you want. To preface, this came from an ancient manuscript that preceded all of the current political entities. Anyway, here's the story: Stewie already has a time machine built in which he uses to go back in time to get back and embarrass Brian. When Brian finds out, they fight in the time machine, pressing random buttons and switches which makes the machine glitch. It transports them outside of the space-time continuum; non-existence; no past, present, or future; no universe; a blank canvas. Stewie has his return pad that will bring them back to wherever they want to go by locking on to their coordinates. However, it operates on the laws of physics and since they are outside the space-time continuum, there are no laws of physics; they can create their own physics. The only way to get back home is taking a risk that could result in their deaths: overloading the return pad’s reactor to release enough energy to blow them back into the universe. The explosion is successful in propelling them back into reality. A few days later, Stewie brings Brian a diagram of the Big Bang Theory’s cosmic background radiation compared to the energy spectrum of the return pad and they match exactly. This means that the return pad’s explosion was the Big Bang. Stewie explains that time and space didn't exist before their explosion as they were outside the space-continuum. This is due to a temporal causality loop where the universe created Stewie so he could create the universe, so it could create him and on and on. We are then introduced to a character, Bertram, who finds out about Stewie's time machine and uses it to go back in time to kill Leonardo Da Vinci, Stewie's ancestor, essentially killing Stewie and erasing him from history. This creates ripples in time in the present that originated from the past. Although this wouldn't happen with an ordinary person ceasing to exist, Stewie was the one who created the universe. By erasing him from history, he wouldn't be there to create the universe, meaning it never existed. To stop this, Stewie and Brian travel back to before Bertram killed his ancestor. Stewie and Bertram's history goes far back, as they are both children of Peter. Therefore, Bertram couldn't just kill Peter or a recent ancestor on Peter's side as he too would cease to exist, so he had to go back enough generations to snuff Stewie's genus without snuffing out his own. Bertram finally arrives and him and Stewie begin to battle each other for Da Vinci's life. Bertram succeeds in killing Da Vinci where after Stewie also kills Bertram. However, Stewie and Brian are still alive, meaning there is still a chance of him being born. He must have done or will do something to save the universe. He figures since Da Vinci's DNA is inside of him, he himself can pass it on, taking Da Vinci's place. This is a large chance but the only way to find out is to send Brian back to the present. When Brian arrives, everything is still intact, meaning Stewie succeeded. Brian receives a letter from The Vatican that was left by “Da Vinci” 500 years ago. It reads that Stewie placed himself into a cryogenic stasis device and is buried in the basement of their home. Brian goes to dig him up and sure enough Stewie is there.
I agree that the Internet is very useful, Jessie. I can publish my findings on the internet, and read the studies of other archaeologists from around the world.
The Internet has been helpful in lightening my schedule, Jessie. I can now conduct meetings online instead of having to show up in person in another region.
Jessie, you mentioned a president that got impeached due to inappropriate sexual conduct. There has to be more to that story. That seems like a harsh sentence.
Jessie, you said that you portrayed a Cleopatra figure in a film. Can you elaborate about her story? I'm particularly interested in female historical figures.
Jessie, you mentioned a figure named Cleopatra. Details about female figures tend be particularly hazy, so I would be grateful if you can tell her story.
Hold on, Jessie. Was that a pornographic film you were talking about? That's not a reliable source at all!
Were you describing a pornographic film, Jessie?! I thought you would be talking about a documentary!
Jessie... I don't really think a 20 year old device would count as an artifact. Besides, that's not the type of information I needed to hear.
Comparing sexual trends between cultures could be interesting... Wait a minute, were you talking about one of your pornographic films, Jessie?
I suppose studying the historical shift... Hey, I remembered something. That movie you were describing, Jessie. Does it happen to be a porn film?
No thanks, Jessie. I would rather hear from more reliable sources.
A porn film isn't going to help my studies of history, Jessie.
Excuse me, Mary, but you described me using a word that I wasn't familiar with. "Milf"? Can you just explain to me what that means, if you please?
Twink is a term for boys, right? Are you saying that a genocide occurred because a boy who happened to be the friend of the leader got murdered, Mary?
I find that kind of hard to believe, Mary. Surely, I would be a more popular character if I was easier to beat. It's not like this game uses much skill at all.
History is filled with both heroes and monsters, Mary. It's just how history repeats itself. I must say though, "Angel of Death" is indeed a fearsome moniker.
I wouldn't be surprised at all if that's the case, Meia. History is written by the victors after all. Even today, this practice still exists.
Past and present, revisionism has always existed, Meia, and I expect it will continue to the future. This is why studying history is so important.
If the past is any indication, then I would say that is indeed human nature, Meia. You either learn to live together, or one of you gets wiped out.
That's just a regular pattern I've seen in history, Meia. The cycle only pauses when everyone learn to coexist, or if one gets assimilated by the other.
Speaking of self-sacrifice, Meia, it has been part of the tradition of many ancient cultures. It was believed that human sacrifices will bring good fortune for the survivors.
Self-sacrifice for the sake of the survivors has been a tradition all throughout history. It's remarkable that the practice apparently hasn't died out yet.
Ribbon Girl, you mentioned something about visiting a temple grounds. Can you elaborate on that temple ground for me? I want to know everything you can tell me.
Ribbon Girl, is this Spring Man that you mentioned a real person or just a fictional character? What are his qualities that you look up to?
A secret sub-faction, huh? The ideas of a secret organization is always frightening, since you can't keep track of their actions since... well, they're secret.
Are you saying that your mask was a recent invention, Ribbon Girl? How exactly do people with your powers function before their invention?
I think it goes without saying that it's more of an obsession than love by that point, Mary. Anyhow, it's not something that's unheard of in history.
...Mom, I'd like to... friend? Was that correct, Mary? People have said that I get along well with young trainers, so you might be correct on that regard.
Stopping a genocide... I don't think many people can claim to have accomplished that, Dust. If you don't mind me asking, why were the Moonbloods being hunted down?
So you have a shady sub-faction, and another faction that's potentially shady and potentially non-existent. Those thoughts must be keeping you on your toes, Ribbon Girl.
It's always a good idea to look up to a role model when you're striving to be a competitor, Ribbon Girl. I know that many young trainers idolize me.
Not having the ability to control your powers seems more like a curse, Ribbon Girl. I know someone who can't control her psychic powers, and she has to sleep most of the time as a result.
An antique floor mosaic? That's a very valuable thing to see for a historian like me. I'm very interested in visiting this Misangan Temple Grounds, Ribbon Girl.
Meia, is it true that Jura is part of the same space traveling crew as you? I wouldn't have known if someone hadn't told me.
Jura can't really be your crewmate, can she, Meia? It doesn't look like you're part of the same job sector at all.
That does explain everything. I was just utterly baffled that Jura was supposed to work anywhere remotely close to a ship cockpit while wearing a dress like that.
Thanks for that explanation, Meia. Everything makes sense now, aside from the fact that Jura would wear that dress while piloting a ship, but who am I to judge foreign fashion sense?
Ah yes, that pyramid theory, among other ridiculous "theories" about ancient construction. Why is it so difficult to believe that ancient humans are capable of such feats, Jolyne?
That pyramid "theory"... It is only believable if you operate under the belief that ancient humans were borderline brain-dead. Don't you agree, Jolyne?
It is highly unlikely that aliens will travel across galaxies just to help humans build stone megastructures and I couldn't make any sense of it, but where more informed than them, Jolyne.
You were asking me what type of ruins I was curious about, Jolyne? I was talking of old structures that have been damaged beyond repair, and is now a reminder of past architecture.
Any old building that are still standing can be considered a ruin, Jolyne, but I'm particularly interested in those that are culturally or historically significant.
Jolyne, you mentioned a queen who died after having sex with a "horse"... What exactly is a "horse"? I haven't heard of that term before.
Jolyne, you talked about a queen and a "horse" earlier... Can you elaborate on what a "horse" is? It might make the context clearer for me.
Jolyne, you were telling me a fascinating story earlier, but you mentioned a "horse". I would appreciate it if you explain to me what it is.
Lucario shouldn't take too long in Smash, but I'm curious that you had a similar story, Jolyne. Would you mind telling it?
I just hope Lucario is doing well in Smash, but on that note, you mentioned something about this happening before, Jolyne. That would be an interesting story to listen to, if you please.
Do you really do all of that by yourself, Shantae? I never knew you had that type of fighting spirit in you.
If what you're saying is true, then I have severely misinterpreted your personality, Shantae. I didn't take you for someone who can act as a one-woman army.
Well, I suppose that is a rather comforting thought. Still, you must keep alert in any case. Some rumors turn out to be true, Ribbon Girl.
There's no reason to be wary of an unconfirmed rumor, I suppose. Either way, it's till better to keep alert at all times, Ribbon Girl.
That would be great, Ribbon Girl. Even though my schedule is quite busy, I can spare some time for this, especially since I could potentially get valuable information from this trip..
Since this could of potential relevance to my current research, I would be glad to spare some time for a trip to that temple, Ribbon Girl.
What a strange phenomenon! How did the world lose a century's worth of history, Nami? Perhaps we can look at my historical records to bridge the gap then...
I've heard of regions losing their historical records, but for an entire world to do so? That is almost inconceivable, Nami! Perhaps some of my researches can fill in the missing details...

I know the prehistory is, well, before recorded history and is forever lost, but for a portion of recorded history to be lost like that... I need to check my records. Perhaps the answer lies within them, Nami...
Shantae, you mentioned that it is part of your duty to raid caves all by yourself. I am struggling to figure why that would be, so I would appreciate it if you could explain it to me.
You mentioned that you raid caves "when duty calls", Shantae. Is that what you do for a living, Shantae? Forgive me for all this questions, but I'm just very curious about that part of your life.

I couldn't help but notice those writing you showed us, Komi. I recognize it as the native writing back in Sinnoh, and the surrounding regions. I never expected to meet another native speaker this far away.
I never expected to see that writing system being used here of all places, Komi. The only other places I've seen it are back home, which is far, far away from here. Great penmanship too, I must say.
To answer you earlier question about guns, Tomoko, I have my Garchomp with me, and she's powerful enough to protect all of us from an attacker.
About your earlier question, Tomoko, my Garchomp can handle a shooting attack should one happen in here. I'd even dare say that having her is a bit of an overkill for that situation.
You mentioned a folklore story, Komi... Can you elaborate on it? It could be an interesting glimpse at your hometown's culture.
It might not be what I had asked for, but I'm interested in hearing about that folklore story you mentioned, Komi.
Komi, you mentioned a Perry Expedition that altered your local culture. Was it a cultural expedition, or did the expedition have other goals in mind?
I've never heard of this Perry Expedition, Komi. Do you any details regarding that expedition? Was it their goal to spread culture into your lands?
Arash, you were chanting something in another language earlier. What was it, a prayer of some sort?
Was that an incantation you were reciting earlier in another language, Arash? Or is it some sort of a prayer?
How did your imagined creation story lead to a revenge fantasy, Tomoko? I can't quite make the connection.
You mentioned earlier that you had an imagined creation story that also doubled as a revenge fantasy, Tomoko. I'm not exactly sure how you connected those two things.
I was talking about historical ruins, Tomoko, but I wouldn't discount the possibility of the existence of such a ruin. History can imitate art sometimes.
I had historical ruins in mind, but I wouldn't be surprised if there exists a ruin that does indeed contain skeletons and treasures within.
I haven't heard of a "Pablo Escobar" before, Tomoko. Can you elaborate on his accomplishments?
You mentioned a historical figure named "Pablo Escobar" earlier, Tomoko. I'm unfamiliar with him, and would appreciate it if you can give a summary of his legacy.
I wasn't asking for personal historical stories indeed, but I'm still interested in what happened next in your story, Tomoko.
I didn't expect to hear personal stories, but since you've already begun your story, might as well finish it. What happened next, Tomoko?
I wouldn't say that hobbies would be that rudimentary without the internet, Tomoko. Leisurely games stretch far back in history, Tomoko. I can give you a rundown if you're interested.

Even though it is true that internet greatly accelerated the development of leisurely games, they had already progressed past tin cans and jumping games way before that. I can tell you the whole story if you want, Tomoko.
My, this is quite a long story indeed, Komi. I'll make sure to read it in the future. I do hope it doesn't get mixed up with my research papers. I'll never be able to recover it in that case.
You weren't exaggerating, Komi. This story really is long. I'll have to remember to read it in the future. Hopefully, I don't lose it before then.
About that historical story you mentioned earlier, Komi, what kind of far-reaching consequences were you alluding to?
Going back to the story you were telling earlier, Komi... I would assume that the expedition greatly influenced the local culture... or were you describing a different type of consequence?
Do you happen to have a form of communication with this Reimu, Miko? She might have met my Lucario if she attended.
Can I request something from you, Miko? I would be happy if your can ask your Reimu if she has met my Lucario in the tournament.
Is Kokoro your daughter, Miko? The rebellious phase can be especially rough for girls.
The Kokoro you mentioned is your daughter, Miko? Girls can be very difficult to handle when they enter their rebellious phase.
You mentioned a creation story about Gensokyo, Miko? Would you be so nice to provide more details on that? I haven't heard any creation stories that are quite like it.
I'm interested in the creation story you mentioned earlier, Miko? Can you remember any more details? It's quite unique compared to the other creation stories I know of.
All empires come and go, Miko, no matter how mighty and powerful. Besides, the cultural impact of long-gone empires last much, much longer than their physical ruins.
Every empire ends, regardless of power and status, Miko. It's more of a question of when and how. The cultural influence of such an empire continues even if said empire has long been forgotten.
You mentioned a couple of historical figures from Gensokyo, Miko. May I ask what about their legacy make them impressive in your opinion?
Were those historical figures you mentioned in Gensokyo a prominent presence in Gensokyo's history? I'll be interested in hearing about their legacy, Miko.
I've been meaning to ask, Miko... If you're the crown prince, does that mean that you became king?
I see now why you have "Crown Prince" as your title... But did you ever ascend to the throne, Miko?
Gossips about a certain historical figure being a woman has been a commonly used method of slander throughout history, Miko. I wouldn't just believe any gossip like that.
If the gossips are to be believed, half of historical figures are secretly female. It's difficult to believe those types of gossip when they are so rampantly used, Miko.
That was an interesting story, Miko. It's interesting that a centralized government was such a massive game-changer back then, when it is commonplace today.
It's interesting that a centralized government used to be a radical idea, when most people don't even take note of it nowadays. Don't you find that interesting too, Miko?
What would you say was the biggest difference between your "playthings" and modern toys, Miko?
Are those "playthings" really that archaic when compared to modern one, Miko? That's interesting to note.
It wasn't like that, Saki... Lucario can handle himself under most situations. I'm just worried that I haven't heard anything about him.
No, Saki! Don't just believe anything you hear about me! We shouldn't be encouraging anyone who would make up a lie like that!
There's absolutely no truth about those stories, Saki! You shouldn't believe anything out of it.
You don't know any creation story at all, Saki? Not even when your parents were telling you a bedtime story?
Surely, you must have heard at least one creation story, Saki. Anything... even from children's books.
I wasn't talking about urban exploration, Saki. I was thinking more in the lines of old caves, and long-abandoned temples.

Regarding your earlier request, Jura, I'm afraid I can't do that. I only have my Pokémon attack people when it's absolutely necessary, and this isn't one of them.

(Don't worry, Jura. I have Spiritomb ready in my hands if she pulls that trick again. Anyway, I would suggest avoiding... whatever you did to anger her in the first place.)

(I'm keeping a close eye on her, Jura, and I've decided sending out Spiritomb would be the best corrective action should she go berserk again. Just don't provoke her until then, and everything would be fine.)
Haru, you mentioned the luck gods earlier. Can you tell me more about them? Quite a few pantheons worshiped a god of luck, and I want to check any similarities between your pantheons.

True, choosing the most impactful event in history would be like choosing among different candies from a jar, when you want all of them equally. I can understand why you couldn't take a pick, ~lucina~.

It would be quite an educational trip for you, Jim. I can teach you a lot about Sinnoh's history and culture during the exploration. You never know, perhaps you can help unlock the story of Sinnoh's creation.

I believe I can handle myself, Nami, no matter the danger. I've had plenty of run-ins with life or death situations myself. Mere pirates wouldn't faze me.
I'm not just a mere damsel in distress, Nami. There's more to me than meets the eye. I wouldn't worry too much about my safety if I were you.
No, there's absolutely no truth to those rumors, Ayano! I have no idea who started them, but I'm making sure nobody believes them for even one second!

Well, not every ruin will contain something spectacular like secrets or treasure, but you can still learn a lot from them, Lux.
Hmm... What is it with megalomaniacs and wanting to reset the universe..? Out of curiosity, would this entity be capable of doing such a thing, Ringo?

You mentioned an Omnic Crisis earlier, Angela... Would you mind describing that particular incident, if you don't mind...?

Is this "evenicle" really that raunchy, Aster? I've read a lot of old stories that are rather... suggestive, but none to the extent you described!

It's quite an interesting story, Jim. There was this explorer that was trying to find a shorter passage to a faraway land, but ended up discovering a new continent instead! He still thought he had reached his intended destination.

That story about the sun-eating machine is quite odd, Orendi, but not something I haven't heard of before... Does this sun-eating machine happen to look like a chariot?
That story sounds somewhat familiar, Orendi... I got it! I just wonder... Are you familiar with the sun-eating machine? Would it happen to resemble a chariot?
I'm not really sure how to feel about the fact that the fate of the universe lies in the hands of someone like you, Orendi...
Great, of all the people that would be responsible for the fate of the universe, it just happens to be Orendi...
You mentioned earlier about someone who collected Pidgeotto, Colress... What exactly did he do with them? Keep them as pets?

I don't know exactly how much a meal costs here, but apparently a bottle of water is priced at 300 Pokédollars, May.

I don't think I've ever heard or observed those types of behavior from Marill before, Perona... but I can see how they could be useful for farm work.

For people who find bonding with humans difficult, I suppose bonding with Pidgeottos is as good as a substitute, Colress. I know people who have Stuffuls for the same reason.
You said earlier that you fight terrorists in caves, Angela. I don't know what kind of terrorist you fight, but I suppose a strong Pokémon team can cope.
Regardless if you're fighting wild Pokémon or humans, having a strong Pokémon team by your side is never a wrong decision, Angela.
The Omnic Crisis you mentioned earlier must be the largest war I've ever heard of, Angela. How well have your world recovered since then?
I've read about massive wars in the history of Sinnoh, but none of them rivals the magnitude of the Omnic Crisis, Angela... How has the recovery process been for the nations involved?

The concept of the world being reset for the sake of a new world is hardly a new thing for me, Fina, but using artificial means to do it... That's the first I've heard of such a story.
The concept that a mere man created all of existence is indeed an absurd belief, Wheatley. How can one man possess more power than a Legendary Pokémon?
Legendary Pokémon are capable of creating the world we know, but a mere man? I've heard that story a lot throughout my travels, and I still can't believe how absurd it is, Wheatley.
I wasn't thinking of any specific type of ruins, Senko, but old decrepit shrines would be a good place to start learning about a specific culture.
Your idea of visiting old shrines is a good idea, Senko. Places of worship can reveal a lot about the culture and beliefs of a region. Especially in regards to creation stories.
You mentioned earlier that you're descended from someone that was member of a "Ten Elites", Hilda. Would you mind explaining what made your ancestor elite?
If your ancestor that you mentioned earlier is a member of an elite group, then I would expect he has quite the legacy, Hilda. I'm curious as to what that would be exactly.
I suppose there are no shortages of generals of noble birth in history books... What exactly has he accomplished so far, Hilda?
Well, many prominent generals throughout history came from noble houses, so I wouldn't be surprised if he becomes prominent enough, Hilda. I would prefer a little bit of specific details first...
I may or may not encounter this Seteth person, Hilda, but now I'm intrigued. What kind of historical stories can I expect to hear from him?
I have never heard of anyone named Seteth, but he must be quite a remarkable figure for you to recommend him, Hilda? Tell me, what specifically should I ask of him if we do meet?
War of Heroes is quite the intriguing name for a conflict, Hilda. I would be interested to learn more about this part of your nation's history.
War has always been a vital part of a nation's creation, and a conflict named War of Heroes certainly sounds significant. What more can you tell me about this event, Hilda?
Weapons of mass destruction are hardly an alien concept where I'm from, but I do wonder about one thing, Fina... When the Old World ended, is that literally or figuratively?
Tales of self-destruction is quite fascinating, but I must say, none of them have destroyed the world... Speaking of which, was the Old World literally destroyed, Fina?
If you put it like that, no event can be as impactful as the creation of the universe by Arceus, the Creator Pokémon, Pauling.
Abandoned, huh? Even though meetings with Arceus are well-recorded throughout history, it has indeed been a while since the most recent sighting.
I wouldn't say that Arceus has abandoned this world, but it has indeed been quite a handful of centuries since the last recorded sighting...
If you believe in the idea that an all-powerful being that created the universe, then seven days of creation isn't too far-fetched, Miku. A powerful being like Arceus can certainly accomplish it.
Creation stories where the universe is the work of a mystical entity is very common, Miku. If you have a being with unlimited power, then seven days of creation is relatively easy.
Well, we don't have to explore ruins immediately after this game, Miku. We can schedule it whenever you have the free time. It's not like the ruins are going anywhere.
There are many ruins that I plan to explore in the future, and you are free to join me whenever you find the free time, Miku.
In that case, which event comes first to your mind when you hear the phrase important event, Miku? Surely, you can pick at least one event.
Perhaps giving your Marill clothes would not be a bad idea at all, Perona. Doing so would increase their opinion of you, which is a necessity for them to evolve to Azumarill.
I would suppose giving your Marill dresses is one way for them to become friendlier to you, Perona. Another positive to that is that it would help them evolve to Azumarill.
Speaking of the Crisis, it sounds like you're on the verge of another Great War, Angela. All it takes is one spark, no matter how small, to cause the proverbial powder keg to explode.
From what I've read up on past warfare, the nations that are least damaged by a global war tend to become world superpowers, Angela. That's a good omen for your home country.
The fate of a nation can swing easily due to one major event, Angela. Although, given past circumstances, I would presume this Russia shouldn't fall too hard.
Nuclear fallouts can cause long-lasting, irreversible damage from what I've read, Angela. Desertification, climate changes, and wildlife mutations are the aftermath.
Great to know that some nations have fully recovered from that great crisis, Angela. Events like this can upset the balance of the world powers, causing the rise and fall of nations.
Lucy, you mentioned earlier a king that dressed up as a pumpkin... Is there any reason he did that, or is it just part of his eccentricity?
I've heard some stories about weird inheritances, mostly when I hanged out at the museum. Anyway, what's the story behind your clock hand heirloom, Lucy?
If you're still interested about the ruins I plan to explore, they are indeed very valuable, Lucy. Not just in terms of monetary value, but also historical and cultural value.
The ruins that I wanted to explore indeed contains very valuable artifacts, Lucy. But, you can't put a price on the historical significance of ruins like it. They are irreplaceable.
You mentioned a Second Trade Caravan War earlier, Lucy. I've known conflicts and disputes caused by trade routes, but never outright wars. Tell me more about this event.
You mentioned an Eclipse Gate? I've never heard of that before, Lucy. Can you tell me more about it, and how it can be used for time travel?
I'm not familiar with that date system you used earlier, Lucy. How long ago would you say those events happened?
It's quite a morbid story, but hardly surprising, Fina. There are more than a few empires that have fallen due to cataclysmic events and their cultures lost to history, save for artifacts.
That's all part of the life cycle of any empire, Fina. Every empire will eventually meet it's demise, one way or the other. For some of them, their ruins serve as their lasting legacy.

That deal with the Inkay's evolution is indeed quite weird, Dawn. How does a Pokémon develop in such a way that it can only evolve while upside down? And how does captured Pokémon forget how to evolve?
The owner of the Devon Corporation is indeed an admirable man, Dawn. Not many people would willingly halt a lucrative construction job just to spare the local Pokémon.
You're right, Dawn. I shouldn't be blurting out rumors I'm trying to stop from spreading. It would be like if you blurted out that rumor of you following a boy all the way to Unova.
Ah, I've also heard of that story before, Dawn. Another version I've heard says that the world is lifted by four Copperajahs instead, each one corresponding to the four cardinal directions.
This Seteth person sounds fascinating, Hilda. Churches always have a good archive of historical records... Anyhow, how would I go about meeting him, for my research?
Churches do tend to contain records and artifacts that have been forgotten by the common people... If I wanted to meet this man, how would you suggest I do that, Hilda?
If your ancestor used to be one of the King's Champions, then surely he must have some great feats of his own, Hilda. Does your family tradition not mention what they are?
Even before all of that civil war, the fact that he was a champion means that he was an esteemed warrior, Hilda. Are there any surviving accounts of what they were exactly?

If he's as good as a general as you say, Hilda, then I have no doubt that he will become part of history books. Although, the most remembered generals are those that becomes kings and emperors as well.
It was a rumor that spread quite a while ago, Dawn, probably by one of your rival coordinators. There was a bit more to that rumor... Well, best not to talk about it anymore.
I don't know who exactly started the rumor, but this was back when you were still a coordinator, Dawn. The rumor is a lot more explicit too, but it's best that we forget about it.
Preventing history from repeating itself is one of the main reason why it is very important to learn about the historical past, Fina. A past mistake is a lesson for the future.
The more you study history, the more you will realize that it is cyclical in nature, Fina. Hence, studying the past is the most effective way of learning how to break the cycle.
I did check out some of those statues some time ago, Spooky, and they do have a bit of... allure to them that a clothed statue doesn't have.

You wouldn't normally put that much ornate details to an artwork if you were not interested at it at a personal level, Spooky, and some certain body parts have indeed received a lot of time and effort.

Hmm... I've not heard of a Garreg Mach before, but just from the name, it's probably somewhere in the vicinity of the Galar region... Well, I was due to visit that region anyway, so I can go out of my way and visit Garreg Mach.

Garreg Mach... just the name alone is a giveaway that it's located in the Galar region. It's indeed been a while since I went on an adventure of my own volition, and this Garreg Mach does not sound like a bad place at all to start with such a journey.
It's odd that their feats have been lost to history. You'd think those details would be passed down through the generations. That could be a fascinating subject for historical research, Hilda.

Not at all surprising that various details have been left out of the oral traditions, but the lack of known feats leaves a rather huge blank in the story. Nevertheless, such a topic would be interesting to look at, just to recover what has been forgotten.
I'm intrigued about your Corviknight, Fischl. Was it a gift to you, or did you catch it yourself? Also, how did you teach it to learn human speech?

I hope you don't mind me asking about your Corviknight, Fischl. I personally have not encountered one before, so I was wondering if you had receive it as a gift. Additionally, is it normal for Corviknight to be able to speak, or is it unique to your pet?
How was my earlier question funny, Trixie? And I take it that you've got a story to share?
I was serious when I that question earlier, Trixie, but I've got an inkling that you have something to tell...

That was a unique take on the Divine Creator belief, Trixie. Speaking of random factors, a card game would be a good medium for such a game, hmm? Wouldn't it be frightening if we were created solely to be thrust into a game like strip poker, purely for the titillation of those divine beings?

Well, if we are merely cosmic playthings created purely to satisfy the sexual desires of an unseen, powerful entities, then wouldn't that be a miserable existence, Trixie. Quite a fascinating hypothetical scenario though.

Well, I can't deny that the people here are pleasing to look at, but it was the thrill of something new and that lured me in here. All work and no play makes for a dull life, after all.

It's not that I wanted to see naked people, ~miki_miura~, but I wanted to do something unorthodox, and this was the most daring thing I was willing to do for fun.

I would love to tell you how to get one, but I legitimately don't know the criteria used to select my Lucario for Smash, ~wasp~. If anything, my Garchomp might have been a better candidate instead.
~Wasp~, you mentioned earlier that I had a strong MILF energy... Could you explain what that is? I'm afraid I'm not familiar with that term.

Ditto is a Pokémon that can change its shape and appearance at will. Unlike every other Pokémon, there are no limits to what a Ditto can breed with, making it perfect for breeding, ~fischl~.

Oh, we wouldn't have to worry about splitting the payout, Fate, because there is none. This is a non-profit expedition, with the aim of discovering more about early history.

Why, this library is one of my favorites! I know every nook and cranny.

I've been here so often, I know this library like the back of my hand! There's a small cafe down stairs of anyone's hungry after the game.
I know this library quite well! There's a mythology section over there, astrophysics in that corner, and ~male~ can find his section on the seventh floor.
I know this library quite well! There's a mythology section over there, astrophysics in that corner... The porno section is on the seventh floor, ~male~, if that interests you...
I know this library like the back of my hand! The DVD rental desk is upstairs, ~male~; but I'm sorry to tell you, they don't carry any pornos.

I'm sorry, ~male~, but if you came to this library looking for a porno film, they don't carry those here.

With five people here, I hope we aren't making too much noise...

It appears as if ~exhib~ has an extra win condition that the rest of us don't...
Say, are we sure ~exhib~ should even be allowed to play? It... seems like his priorities might be misplaced.
Is a guy like ~exhib~ even allowed to play? Seems like the incentives aren't properly aligned for him.
Is a guy like ~exhib~ even allowed to play? I don't think the incentives are properly aligned for him.
Is ~exhib~ even allowed to play these sorts of games? I don't think losing carries the proper weight for him.
~Exhib~ doesn't seem too bothered by his losses... Should he even be allowed to play?
If the object is to win, is it even allowed for a guy like ~exhib~ to play this game?
By the way Detective ~detective~, would you mind if I asked a few questions after this game? I think you're insight might be helpful in guiding my research.
It seems ~exhib~ and I are both exposed, but only one of us feels any shame in the matter...
Aren't you at all embarrassed, ~exhib~? How is this not embarrassing for you?
My Lucario's been away ever since that white envelope came in the mail. I hope he's enjoying his time in Smash...
Someone sent a white and red invitation to my mailbox addressed to my Lucario. He's been away ever since. I just hope he's doing alright.
Hmm. This is difficult. I was greedy and brought a lot of swimsuits, but now I can't pick which one to wear.
Here's my problem. I have a white swimsuit and a black swimsuit... Which one would look better on me?
This beach reminds me a lot of the Unova region.
I wonder what Pokémon we could find in the waters in this area. I can't wait to check after the end of this game.
I remember training my Milotic in a beach like this.
I'm always willing to take on new challenges and adventures. I figured a strip poker game would do just that.
It's nice to engage in new experiences from time to time. On that note, I'm afraid I'm not too experienced at this game.
As much as I enjoy training my Pokémon and studying mythology, I felt I needed a bit of a break and try something new.
I think I'm getting the hang of this game now. Don't expect me to go down as easily this time.
My inexperience at this game is becoming apparent, but I think I've figured out the proper strategies.
Not exactly a good showing from me so far, but I think I've identified the flaws in my decision process.
The best thing to do about mistakes is learn from them, and that's exactly what I've done. Expect a tougher challenge from now on.
Everyone experiences failure, even trainers of my level. What separates great trainers from the others is the ability to learn from them.
This is it: my last stand. Don't expect me to give up my chances at winning.
I may be on my final battle, but I'm not giving up!
A tough challenge! This is exactly why I agreed to play this game in the first place.
This is The Inventory, right? What's with the curtains? Is this placed closed?
I find it odd that The inventory is closed at this hours. Isn't late evening the peak hours for a bar like this?
I'm surprised that they let us play in The Inventory while it's closed... That why they put the curtains up, right?
I didn't know The Inventory would put up curtains during strip poker games. I had heard that it was played in full view of the other patrons.
I must say, it's been a long time since I've seen a curtain that large.
Have you considered using that curtain to clean yourself, ~male~?
Do you think the staff would mind if you use that curtain to wipe yourself, ~male~?
Is this where ghost-type Pokémon live? I'm afraid I'm not at all familiar with their habitats.
I wonder if those specters I'm seeing from here are illusions created by ghost-type Pokémon.
I've never tried taming a ghost-type Pokémon before... I should explore this forest after the game.
Despite their appearance, ghost-type Pokémon are actually not any more dangerous than other types.
Does anyone fancy a quick swim after the game?
Does anyone fancy a quick swim after the game? We'll already be naked anyway.
Are we allowed to take a dip after the game? It's the quickest way for us to clean ourselves.
I hope the water in this place isn't too cold. It's a great way of cooling ourselves from the excitement of this game.
The prospect of jumping into the water is very tempting.
Oh, I-I d-didn't know it would be this type of a g-game, ~male~.
Is this your bedroom, ~male~?... You're n-not thinking of doing t-that with me, are you?
Why... i-is there a reason you brought me here, ~male~? This isn't what I e-expected.
I must say, this mansion is top-class. My villa doesn't even compare to this.
My villa in Undella Town is nothing to scoff at, but this mansion makes it look unremarkable in comparison.
This mansion reminds me of my summer villa at Undella Town. Speaking of which, I wonder what Jervis has been up to.
Don't be intimidated by my presence here. This is a poker game rather than a Pokémon battle, so I'd say you have a decent chance of beating me.
I may be the Sinnoh League Champion, but I don't think my skills would translate to strip poker. If anything, you might have a better chance of winning than me.
Strip poker - I don't think my years of experience as the Champion have done anything to prepare me for a possible defeat here.
If this was a battle, I would have already lost since we would only be allowed 6 Pokémon to fight with. Good thing this game allows 8 layers instead.
I may have lost 6 times already, but this game is a lot more forgiving than Pokémon battles, so I still have 3 defeats remaining before I'm out.
I... I don't think I've ever been naked in front of any of my Pokémon before... Not that I'd have a reason to...
Come to think of it, it would be weirder if I was naked in front of my Pokémon instead...
Is it common for people to stand naked in front of their Pokémon?... Why would you even do that?
Oh, it's very warm in here, not at all like Sinnoh. Wearing my coat was a mistake.
Perhaps I should have checked this place out first before bringing my coat with me. My summer blouse would have been more appropriate here.
This air reminds me of my home in Celestic Town. Ironically, this cold air is giving me a warm, fuzzy feeling.
This place might not be as cold as back home at Sinnoh, but I like it nonetheless.
Bringing my coat was the correct decision then. I don't think my summer blouse can handle this cold.
How is the Pokémon egg I gave you after your previous win, ~player~? I hope you are taking good care of it. Every Pokémon deserves to be loved by its owner.
Are you loving the Pokémon egg I gave you during the previous game, ~player~? Meeting all the Pokémon is an accomplishment, and I only want to lend you a little hand, that's all.

That Egg I gave you after your win is special, ~player~. An Egg is the cradle of every being. The planet itself is an Egg in a sense... Life that comes from an Egg will come to an end in due course... to begin anew...

I hope that Egg I gave you previously will come in handy, ~player~. A Pokémon will hatch from it while you are traveling. I would be happy to know that it will help you fill another page of your Pokédex.
I hope my outfit isn't too dark for this location. It blends in somewhat with the shadows doesn't it?
Keep your eyes peeled. A dark-type Pokémon could be lurking in the shadows.
Is everyone sure this place is truly isolated? It would be very embarrassing if someone sees us playing strip poker in here.
I'm not exactly sure hosting strip poker here was a good idea. There might not be anybody currently here aside from us, but someone might end up walking into here.
The triple scoop cones are usually a good promo, but it might be more expensive here... and it is already expensive to begin with...
I have heard that they sell Inkay ink flavored ice cream here... no way such a flavor would be cheap though...
I haven't had strawberry ice cream for quite a while now... but it's so difficult to find non-artificially flavored ones...
I wonder... would they charge extra to add ice cream toppings...?
Do they sell Vanillish-shaped ice cream cones here? I haven't had one for years now.
What about I order a double scoop with two different flavors... But what flavors should I include...?
Why do they call it ice cream and not iced cream?
Is ice cream just a thinner gelato, or is gelato just thicker ice cream?
I wonder if she's thinking of ice cream or snowcones...
Oh, right... I haven't decided on an ice cream flavor yet... Now, what should it be?
I can order all of the available flavors... but where would I put them all...?
(Placeholder line. Report this bug immediately.)
(Placeholder line. Report this bug immediately.)
(Hidden line for setting the JuraPokemon0 marker. Report this bug immediately.)
If you eat plenty of ice cream, would it come out as ass cream?
I've heard that some people likes to be hit by Bulbasaur's vine whip. That might explain why Gardenia is always with her Bulbasaur...
I remember when I stalked a kid all over Sinnoh. Thank goodness I'm hot, which is why nobody reported me.
So, what are your dreams? My dream is to have Arceus implant his seed of creation inside me, and fill me up to the brim.
From what I've read, the Crown Tundra at the Galar region is quite a desolate wasteland. No wonder the locals spend most of their waking hours drunk.
I've heard that the natives of Spikemuth at Galar get a little too affectionate with the Wooloo population. Sounds like I should book a trip there soon.
I find it funny that Galar invented all kinds of sports, yet can't win in any of them.
It's been said that Galar left the Pokémon League because they wanted to stop the entry of foreign Pokémon in their lands. That's a good thing for the foreign Pokémon.
I've read that it rains all the time in Galar. It's the closest the male Galarians will get to making women wet.
Galarians have a motto everytime they play football: "It's coming home." I'm amazed they can predict exactly when their team will be coming home.
Galarian cuisine is so bad, that it's recommended as a meal plan for people wanting to lose weight.
Did you know that Galar colonized half of the known world for spices before realizing they didn't want any of it?
Once I step down as Champion, I plan on becoming a Pokémon breeder. I already have plenty of experience breeding with Pokémon.
My butt is so tight that sometimes when I'm on the toilet, the log gets stuck between my ass cheeks.

An interesting fact I learned from a breeder is that Skorupi can dislodge their tails if it gets stuck. However, since the tails contains their anus, the Skorupi get filled with feces until it bursts.

Here's something I learned from my stint as a breeder: When a Beedrill breeds with a Vespiquen, their testicles explodes and penis detaches while still inside the Vespiquen. This plugs the Vespiquen's vagina and ensures that the semen is sealed inside.
I wondered why it's not possible to teach a Kecleon to shoot blood from its eyes. Wild Kecleon can do so naturally, yet it doesn't appear to be a teachable move.
I do wonder, what's everyone's favorite number? Mine is 1777013.
I'm not hiding any Pokéballs under my shirt if that's what you're thinking...
Despite his professional appearance, Professor Rowan is every bit of a dirty old man. Every time I would visit him, he would be in bed with the likes of Lasses or Rising Stars.

I'm not sure if the news has gone around yet, but I repealed a ban on exotic meats such as Wailmer, Phanpy, Raikou, and Mr. Mime. You can now eat all sorts of meats without feeling guilty about breaking the law.
I've had people asked me what happened to the black-faced Jinx. Well, they were all hunted to extinction in an organized eradication effort, and only the purple-faced Jinx now remain.
Anyone find it odd that Unova keeps proclaiming themselves World Champions for sports that only they play.

You must be wondering where all the Gym Leaders get the money they payout to winning trainers considering they almost always lose. Well, let's just say that rich elderly men are willing to pay big bucks for a night with a gym leader. I even get commission for organizing the deals.

I've tried out one those sushi parties where the sushi is served on a naked woman. Although, instead of a naked woman, it was a paralyzed Gardevoir. And instead of sushi, we just bit chunks off the Gardevoir while it was still alive and screaming.

Anyone here interested in becoming a gym leader? The requirements to become a certified gym leader is that you must be willing to be rented to rich old men, and that you're willing to have your gym be used for money laundering by the Sinnoh League.

I went on a visit to a Pokémon Center in Unova, and the prices were outrageous! Almost a hundred times more expensive than in any other regions. Either you go on severe debt or you just let your Pokémon die.
