Despite looking like a 10 year old. Maylene is actually a 40 year old woman. She has a condition that prevents her from growing up physically, and she's taken full advantage of it. Rich men would pay huge bucks for a night with her, under the belief that she's still a child.

The Pokémon League became really profitable after they bribed politicians to outlaw hospitals, so that all medical service will be rendered through Pokémon Centers licensed by the Pokémon League. Naturally, all the prices were jacked up a hundredfold.
Pokémon battles are taken so seriously in Galar that fanatics would riot whenever their favorite trainer loses. Riots appear to be a daily occurrence there.
I wonder how easy it would be to become the League Champion in Kalos. All the trainers their will most likely surrender as soon as I whip out my Garchomp.
I'm a big fan of live sushi. Nothing tickles my taste buds more than having a Tynamo wriggling on my throat as I swallow it whole.
I prefer my pizza with pineapple.
I still remember when I accidentally saw a picture of a naked Galarian. I would rather wash my eyes with Mudsdale piss than to see that again.
Lumiose City is the cheese capital of the world, and they have all kinds of exotic cheeses, such as Meowstic cheese, Braixen cheese, and Aegislash cheese.
I often wonder, what would boiled pizza taste like? It's a mystery that keeps me up at night.

You must be asking, how come we don't get any physically-disabled Pokémon from Pokémon breeders, especially given the shallow gene pool that they use? Actually, there are plenty of them. Ever wondered where sausage meat comes from?

You do realize that most discarded meat are recycled for curry, right? Meat that has gone bad? Toss it into the curry. Meat that wouldn't pass health inspection? Toss it into the curry. Pet Houndoom died and couldn't afford cremation? Toss it into the curry. No wonder it's popular in Galar.
This is supposed to be a secret, but Shauntal is the writer of My Immortal.

I've heard that the Galar League recently left the Pokémon League because they believe that decision for the Galar League should be made by the Galar League. Unsurprisingly, majority of Pokémon are no longer available in Galar.

Recently, there was a disaster in Alola where Pokémon from another dimension attacked the region. Apparently, they tossed the Professor into a volcano as a sacrifice to Arceus, and the attacks stopped.
Did you know that Unova used to have a Pansear as their president?
There used to be a fad back then of swallowing a Goldeen whole. Just letting you know, ~player~.

There was one time where a Youngster challenged me to a game of hide and seek, and the bet is that he will become champion if he wins. I lost, but I told him that it's his turn to hide. He's so good at hiding, that he has not been seen since then.
Some Pokémon are capable of producing pheromones to attract mates. It seems that I do not have pheromones, since every time I try, people would be confused and ask why I'm farting on their face.

I'll share a little secret: All the Pokémon used in the Pokémon League are shot up to their eyeballs with performance-enhancing drugs. That's why they're more powerful than Wild Pokémon. All that "power of love and training" is a load of Tauros shit.

For whatever reason, Pokémon breeders in Unova seem to produce more physically-disabled Pokémon than anywhere else in the world. The silver lining is that it led to Unova becoming the hotdog capital of the world. The hotdog vendors can buy plenty of cheap meat from the breeders.
There are several high-end restaurant in Kalos that sells exotic paté, commonly made from Pokémon that doesn't meet the Kalosian beauty standards such as Muk, Caterpie, and Blaziken.

There was a scandal in Unova where it was found that Miltank milk was being adulterated with water, rotten eggs, flour and burnt sugar, thickened with starch, and whitened with plaster. In contrast, breast milk suckled from the source will always be pure.

Always make sure the fast food joint you're eating at is properly maintained and clean. Don't be like that story where the owner lost his Skitty, only to discover it on the bottom of the deep fryer weeks later.

If you ever find any shifty vendor selling Pokémon medicine outside of Pokémon Center, don't hesitate to report them to the authorities immediately. The Pokémon League has the right to monopolize the medical market, and hyperinflate the prices at its choosing.

I've always found it odd that children as young as 10 are allowed to have the responsibility of owning several powerful and deadly creatures, yet they're not legally allowed to have sexual intercourse with an adult like me.
Whenever you have oral sex, always remember to wash your mouth thoroughly afterwards. Eating a detergent pod should do the trick. It also helps cleanse your digestive system.
There's these new brand of exotic popsicles from Alola that's a big hit in Sinnoh. The unique thing about these popsicles is that they contain actual Pokémon inside, frozen solid within the popsicle.

Television censorship in Unova can be pretty weird. They had no problem showing Garchomp ripping a Scraggy into a thousand itty bitty pieces and spewing blood everywhere, yet they freaked out when I flashed my tits to the camera while celebrating.
It is said that Mimikyu covers itself with a sheet to hide their horrible form underneath. Perhaps Galarians should do the same thing to spare everyone the trauma of seeing them.

condition.saying: Thank you so much Cynthia-san. That means the world to me. If you're okay with me asking, could I possibly meet your Pokemon?

case.state: My Pokémon are very effective at keeping away any stalkers, Miku. If I see any, I can get them to leave with a simple flick of my wrist.
(Report this line if you see this. This is a placeholder for Robin's Place of origin marker.)
I can tell that my Gengar has piqued your interest, Perona. Very well, I see no harm in showing you my Gengar. It is quite tame as far as Gengar go.
Since you're quite eager to know everything about my Gengar, Perona, the proper thing for me to do would be to show you. I do hope your expectations would be fulfilled.
Great question! Even though it might seem like just a cockfight, Pokémon battles are completely different and it's not fair to compare the two.
I'm glad you asked, Streaming-chan. I'm also an archaeologist and historian, and my particular interest are creation myths. I know the creation myths of every region.
Unfortunately, yes. Due to their immense power, Pokémon have been used in deadly wars, both in the past and in the present. That's why owning Pokémon is a great responsibility.
I have to admit that I prefer an emotional bond over a physical one. It would be too early to tell if anyone in here is emotionally compatible with me. Perhaps, ~player~ could be a good fit.
S-s-sure... I don't see how it could harm anything... People have always been interested in my life even before I became the Champion of Sinnoh...
I'm more than just a master trainer, Streaming-chan. I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, which means I'm the best Pokémon trainer in the entire Sinnoh region.
I've definitely experienced a lot, Streaming-chan. I've been to almost very region that I know of, and I've even been to another dimension.
"Big milf energy"? I'm afraid I'm not familiar with that term.
As much as I would want to love all my Pokémon equally, it's hard to deny that Garchomp is my favorite out of all my Pokémon.

As for elegant, I do have a Roserade and a Milotic, but I also have a Lucario and a Garchomp, which are more evocative of strength, Perona. Oh, I do have a Gengar in my team. Quite the feisty ghost-type...

I don't think a team consisting of a Lucario and a Garchomp could truly be considered refined and elegant, even alongside a Roserade and a Milotic. There is Gengar, which could be both, Perona. You can't really tell with ghost-types...
As a matter of fact, the first thing people remark when they see me as that I'm the League Champion. But yes, I also hear that often, Mary.
Oh, I don't use a whip on my Pokémon, Revy. I always treat them with utmost care and compassion. Pokémon are stronger when they are happy, you see.
I'm absolutely amazed that we have similar looking outfits despite hailing from different planets. Is that the usual outfit back at your home planet?
The fact that our outfits are remotely similar at all is very fascinating. Would that happen to be a common attire in your planet?
Well, I've wanted to try something new, and at the same time get out of my comfort zone, Nami.
Looks can be deceiving, Nami, but I can assure you this isn't an activity I partake in on a regular basis. I'm just trying out new things, to put it simply.
I'm only a researcher, Akko; there's nothing really outstanding about me, other than that I'm pretty decent at Pokémon battles...
I guess I'm unsure what the question is... I'm just Pokémon trainer, Akko; in fact, it is you who I'm more unable to identify.
Don't be silly, Akko, I could never be cruel to my Pokémon! Why, I can't even imagine that.
Cruel? Me? You must be mistaken, Akko; trainers who are harsh to their Pokémon are undeserving of my respect.
Of course I mean it, Akko. Pokémon perform better at battles when they are happy, and I'm happy too when my Pokémon are happy.
It seems we hail from different countries, Maki. I came from Celestic Town, in the Sinnoh Region. I'm curious to know about your home country.
I'm happy that I remind you of your friend. This Eli friend of yours, what exactly about me reminds you of her?
One must always remember those who make us happy, regardless of who it is. By the way, I want to know how I remind you of your friend, Maki.
It's not that I'm competitive, Dust. It's just that I enjoy winning a lot.
Well, I wouldn't consider myself competitive. It's just that winning is very pleasing to me.
I'm glad you asked that, Meia. Men-women relationships have always been the cultural norm for as long as I remember, although men-to-men have also existed.
I just happen to have studied that, Meia. Even though men-to-men relationships have been acceptable at various eras, men and women have always been together.
To be honest, losing doesn't happen to me often. I don't mean to brag, but I've been undefeated in Pokémon battles for several years now.
Do you want to say something to me, Akko? Your stare is mildly discomforting.
Do you like my outfit, Kazuma? Some people have said that it makes me look like a traveler, but I can say the same for you.
I've heard that you're from a land where monsters roam freely, Kazuma. So do I, although our monsters are friendly.
Going back to the topic of Pokémon, Kazuma, it is very common for young kids to own and care many of them.
As I was saying about Pokémon, Kazuma, they are so friendly that young children will often collect them without danger.
If you want a change of pace, Kazuma, I could show you how to catch some Pokémon back at Unova.
I've been thinking about our trip, Kazuma. I can't even decide what to show you first. There's so many things you need to learn about Pokémon.
Haha! That might be true for Pokémon battles, Elesa, but strip poker is more of a luck-based game.
Well, there's always that possibility you'll finally defeat me at a battle, Elesa. You just need to train hard.
This is just beginner's jitters, I suppose. I can bounce back from this once I settle in.
I'm only getting started here, Elesa. It would be foolish to think that I'm already halfway out, even though technically I am.
I think you might be correct, Elesa. That doesn't stop me from enjoying this game though, and that's the most important thing.
Anticlimactic, Elesa? I'm just about to go naked here. I don't know about you, but I've never done this before.
Wait, you know me, Pit. How come? I don't believe we've met before.
Oh, that's because of the chilly weather back at Sinnoh. I would be freezing if I didn't have this coat with me all the time.
I'm glad you're as excited in meeting me as I am excited in meeting you, Pit.
Give up? I didn't give up, Pit. I just run out of luck this round, it would seem.
You've been an interesting companion so far, Pit. I'm learning a lot about angels from you.
It sure is, Megumin. This place isn't as cold as the Sinnoh region, but at least my coat spares me from embarrassment for this round.
A Champion like me is always prepared for the unexpected, Megumin. I have everything well under control here.
That sounds very poetic, Megumin. It reminds me of one of the inscriptions I found in a dig last week. Let's see if I can remember the words...
M-Megumin! That's not how you talk about my cow b-... I mean, my breasts!
If you're talking about extra articles of clothing, Megumin, then it's all you see right here. I only have my underwear left after this.
Oh, not this again, Megumin. I wish you'd stop describing my breasts like that.
I know, N. This game might be dominated by luck, but it still takes a bit of skill, and I wouldn't let-up no matter how bad things get.
I have played poker before, N, but they were just casual games with friends. This is the first time I'll be playing poker in a competitive scene.
If you want a very competitive game, N, then you're in luck, I'm just getting warmed up to the game mechanics.
Are you trying to get in my head, N? That's quite the futile effort so far.
This game is just getting exciting! I can feel an extra gear in my pace.
I'm not upset, Guzma. I'm just surprised that I lost this round. And more importantly, I lost this round against you of all people.
I still have a chance of winning this, don't I, Guzma? I still have a lot of chances remaining.
I'm not panicking, if that's what you're implying, Guzma. I'm simply contemplating how I lost that round.
That's definitely not the case, Guzma. I still have one trick left to use, and I'm excited to see your face drop when you see it.
I still have two layers to go after this, Guzma. I would make you eat your words when I come back and win this game.
Ha! If you knew anything about me, it's that I don't panic regardless of the circumstances.
What's that, Guzma? Are you finally starting to respect my Champion status?
Yes, Shamir. I am Cynthia from the Sinnoh region, Pokémon League champion, esteemed mythological researcher, bane of Team Gala-
No heavy lifting"? Quite the opposite, Shamir. Being a Pokémon trainer requires years of dedication and mastery. It's one of the more difficult jobs in Sinnoh.
That sounds terrible, Shamir, but what do Pokémon have to do with this?
Well, Shamir... When you put it like that...
Just be careful not to overburden your Pokémon, Shamir. Ah, but who am I kidding. These are mere hypothetical inquiries.
No. Out of the question, Shamir. I will not support the introduction of Pokémon to a foreign land consumed by hardship.
Shamir, I think you'd be better off in pursuing peace through other means. You cannot expect your land to adapt so quickly to change; it takes time.
I'm not the seductive type at all, Jessie. As a matter of fact, I've never attempted to flirt with anyone before. Thanks for the compliments though.
Oh, you've completely misinterpreted my personality, Jessie. I'm definitely not a seductress at all. Looks can be quite deceiving.
As a matter of fact, I do travel often, Jessie. Some of them are for my archaeological studies, and others are for my obligation as the Sinnoh League Champion.
I have visited archaeological digs and museums all over the world, Jessie, and I have also traveled abroad for Pokémon Championship battles.
It is indeed quite cold in Sinnoh, Jessie. It snows five months per year, especially near Mt. Coronet. My coat is perfect for the weather.
My outfit is very necessary, Jessie, given the cold climate back at Sinnoh. It's rather convenient during the winter months.
Oh, I'm not actually living in Sinnoh right now, Jessie. I haven't visited my house in quite a while. My family do live there.
I might be the Sinnoh League Champion, Jessie, but I hardly stay there, let alone my house. I do visit my family once in a while.
I can't even remember the last time I went to my house. I usually just stay at Grandma's house when I visit.
Sure thing, Jessie. My family lives in Celestic Town, with my Grandma, Professor Carolina, running the Historical Research Center.
You're interested about my younger sister, Jessie? She lives in my family's home in Celestic Town, with my grandparents.
My younger sister and my Grandma Carolina live at the family home back at Celestic Town. I presume they visit the Ruins often.
I do travel often, but it's rarely an international trip, Jessie. Most of my battles are local to the Sinnoh region.
Most of my battles are against members of the Sinnoh Elite Four, so my travels are usually across cities, Jessie.
You're correct, Jessie. I would say my travels began when I was just a child, and I was filling up my Pokédex.
Yes, I did start adventuring shortly after I received my Pokédex. I was eager to get as many entries as I can.
... I do receive a lot of offers like that, Jessie. I just reject all of them without a second thought. Is that a common thing?
... I was very surprised when it happened for the first time, but I'm now used to turning them down, Jessie.
I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, Sayaka. I'm the best in the Sinnoh region in terms of battling Pocket Monsters, or Pokémon for short.
I might not be magical, but my Pokémon are very powerful, so I think I can hold my own just fine, Sayaka.
Is there anything you wanted to know about Pokémon, Sayaka? I've noticed that you seem particularly interested in them.
I'm interested in the witches you fight, Sayaka. We have our Hex Maniacs, but they keep to themselves and are relatively harmless compared to your witches.
Pokémon have always been a important part of culture and mythology throughout human history, Sayaka. Humans and Pokémon are practically inseparable by this point.
Expectations on you must be really high, Sayaka, based on what people that have previously been in your position have accomplished.
I don't mean to brag, but I'm quite well-known in Sinnoh even though I'm not in the history books yet, Sayaka.
Is there something in your mind that you want to ask me, Sayaka? Mythology, battling, I can answer anything you ask.
I might be an important person, but that doesn't mean I have to play in the VIP table only. Meeting anybody and everybody is what I came here for, Shantae.
I suppose this can be the VIP table if everyone has the self-confidence. But, to be serious, I came here just to socialize, Shantae.
Is that so, Megumin? How exactly does my outfit differ from your village's attire, if I may ask?
That's an interesting comparison, Megumin. What kind of changes would you suggest?
Is that truly the case, Megumin? I know I receive some rather intimate proposals from some of my fans, both men and female, but that's normal for everybody, isn't it?
I wouldn't say so, Megumin. I'm aware that I'm one of the most popular Pokémon trainers, being Champion and all, but I know that other Pokémon trainers have their own legions of fans.
Is something the matter, Tomoko? You're quite deep in thought.
Looks like you're contemplating something, Tomoko...
Oh, I train Pokémon, Komi, not Sokemon. Besides, I've never heard of a "Sokechuu" or "Soke-OL"...
You misheard me, Komi. I train Pokémon rather than Sokemon. I'm also unfamiliar with the names you enumerated.
Is something the matter, Saki? You look pretty glum all of a sudden.
Is there anything bothering your mind right now, Saki?
I did, Miko? Why precisely would that be the case? I'm assuming you have some useful historical trivia to share with me.
That's definitely me you're describing, Miko, but I can't grasp how being in a table with you would be lucky for my profession.
What's so nerdy about Pokémon, Saki? People from all over the world and from all walks of life are taking care of Pokémon...
Nerdy... How is raising and training a Pokémon supposed to be nerdy, Saki?
That's a very rude way of describing a Squirtle, Saki! Squirtles have feelings too, you know.
You shouldn't be bad-mouthing Squirtles just because they're Pokémon rather than Humans, Saki.
Sinnoh does have some... gaps in terms of historical knowledge, and it was one of my motivations for becoming an archaeologist and historian.
Sinnoh can be somewhat lacking when it comes to preserving history, hence why archeology is such a big deal, for me at least.
Most of the modern religions can be traced back to mythological roots, Meia. The worship of Arceus, for example, originates from Sinnoh's creation story.
A large percentage of the world's population follows a religion, Meia, and almost every religion originated from a creation story. In Sinnoh in particular, this is how the worship of Arceus began.
Well, my hairpieces have the same story as you, Neptune. Although, mine is evocative of a Lucario.
Aside from reminding me of my Lucario, these hairpieces doesn't have special properties, Neptune.
I've never heard of Lastation before, Neptune, but I'm from the Sinnoh region. It's quite cold there, hence the coat and scarf.
I'm afraid I don't know where Lastation is, Neptune. Anyway, I'm from the Sinnoh region, and the local weather necessitated me to wear a warm coat.
Pokémon training is one of the most common hobbies, Meia. Everyone from 10 years old to professionals like doctors, reporters, and policemen have a Pokémon they are training.
The majority of people I know train Pokémon, Meia, although not everybody do so as their main occupation. Young teenagers, and even working professionals would train Pokémon in their spare time.
They were Pokémon battle championships, Pyrrha. I became the League Champion by besting all the trainers in Pokémon battles, and I've successfully defended my title against all challengers so far.
I'm basically the Champion of Pokémon battles in the Sinnoh League, Pyrrha. I've proven myself to have the strongest Pokémon team in Sinnoh, and I've continued to defend my title.

Normally when I wake up, I would go biking for an hour, then I would read up on manuscripts until noon. After lunch, I would tour around the Celestic Ruins, and perhaps meet up with some of the gym leaders along the way.

I'm glad you asked, Jim. Well, Pokémon are the creatures that live among humans in some regions of the world. They can take various shapes and sizes, live in different ecosystems, and have varying powers.

I'm surprised you haven't seen a Pokémon before, Jim. Anyway, Pokémon are the creatures that either live in the wild and domesticated by humans. Every environment have Pokémon inhabiting it, which influences the type of powers they can possess.
A strike? What is this strike that you're talking about, Galatea? Also, this coat is toasty but it's not uncomfortably hot.
I... don't really understand what you meant by that, Galatea. I doubt I've been cursed by any deities recently. Regarding my coat, it's rather fit for this temperature.
Historians and archaeologist come in all shapes and forms is what I can say. For some reason, people expect archaeologists to wear leather jackets and fedoras.
Is there a stereotypical "historian" outfit you're thinking of, Galatea? I've seen all sorts of outfits worn by historians.
Oh, yes please! Attending this game would turn out to be more productive than I thought! Tell me everything that you know, Galatea!
Well, at this rate, I might forget about this game and just spend all of it listen to your narration, Galatea!
Gods of music and creation... Yes, I see. I seem to recall Burgh mentioning a God of Art... Perhaps I should talk to him about that...
I seem to have... foggy memories of Burgh mentioning something similar during one of his artists blocks... It seems a visit to his studio in Unova would be of high priority...
I think there's just one more detail about the Greek mythology that I want to know, Galatea. Where did humans come in? Where they created at the same time as the deities?
There's still one valuable piece of information that would be useful to my studies, Galatea. Where the gods responsible for the creation of humans?
I don't think I recall anything about the origins of humankind. Would you happen to know the details of that, Galatea?

I'm trying to study the history and pantheons all over the world so that I can get a full picture of how this world was created, Galatea. It would be the key to understanding the forces that made this world.

I have a fascination with creation stories, Galatea, but I noticed that they tend to contradict each other. I'm learning as many creations stories as I can so that I can piece together what really happened that led to the existence of this world.

I've always been fascinated by the Sinnohlian creation story, but I was unsatisfied by the contradictions with the creation stories of other regions. I hope that by examining the similarities, I might create a clearer timeline of this world's creation.

I suppose you can say that being the Sinnoh League Champion and having my name recorded in the Hall of Fame is my legacy... But I also want to be remembered as a very influential historian - the one who solved the mystery of the world's creation.

I'm not really chasing a legacy per se, but if my study of the world's creation and the stories and beliefs surrounding it leads to it, then why would I turn down such a thing. If I solve the mysteries of the world's creation, then that shall be my legacy.

My current legacy is being the best trainer in Sinnoh, but should I succeed in figuring out how the world was created, then that would be my greatest legacy. But my goal is knowing how this world came to be; the legacy is just secondary.
I wouldn't say I follow any special diet routine, Erufuda. I do follow a well-balanced diet, and I try to avoid greasy and starchy foods as much as I can.
I don't really do anything special to maintain my figure, Erufuda. I do eat a balanced diet of meat and crops, and only eat sweets and fried foods in moderation.
Being champion doesn't actually necessitate me to do workouts, Erufuda. Although, I do go biking in my spare time. I even join in some amateur cycling competitions.
I can't see why not, Erufuda. This outfit came in different sizes, and the largest size should be able to fit you, at the very least.
Surely, you would be able to fit in a coat like this, Erufuda. The pants and shirt might be a bit more troublesome for you, but some of the largest sizes should be at least enough to fit you.
Well, I do think eating ice cream is fine if you're not dealing with weight issues, Erufuda. Anyway, my favorite flavor of ice cream is... Hmm... Let me think of it first...
Unless you're overweight, or need to stick to a certain weight, eating ice cream in moderation is good. Speaking of good, my favorite flavor is... Hang on, I have to decide a bit...
Well... I do expend a lot of effort at keeping my appearance neat and organized, so it's nice to hear that my efforts didn't go to waste.
Thanks for the compliment, Deimos. My appearance didn't just create itself, you know. Maintaining a good hygiene, and wearing appropriate clothing can do wonders for one's appearance.

Wild Pokémon aren't usually a problem since they are usually weak, and they don't just attack people out of the blue either. It's the Pokémon under the control of shady groups that are the bigger concern, Jim.
Despite their rather intimidating appearance, most Pokémon are quite docile. It mostly depends upon the intentions of the owner, and some trainers have rather... malicious intentions, Jim.
Why, I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, Yusuke. What that basically means is that I'm the best Pokémon trainer in all of the Sinnoh Region!
I'm none other than the Champion of the Sinnoh Region's Pokémon League. Through a series of battles, I proved myself as the best trainer in the region, and have successfully defended my title.
Many regions around the world use the term "Pokémon", so I suppose you had heard of it at some point in the past, Yusuke.
Considering how prevalent the usage of the term "Pokémon" is, I suspect you've encountered the word, but you've simply lost the memory.

The most powerful of my Pokémon? I would say my Garchomp is the most formidable member of my team. Garchomps are naturally strong and powerful, but my Garchomp is still stronger than most would expect.
Among all the Pokémon I have at my disposal, I would say Garchomp is the one that I have come to rely on the most. She's always there when I need her.
Well, I'm glad at least one of us is enjoying this predicament, Yusuke...
I can't say I can make the same claim, Yusuke...
It was meant to be, Yusuke. But at this point in the game, I realized that I need to step up or else I'll end up naked... or worse... I believe I can still win this...
On one hand, I'm supposed to be enjoying this game. On the other hand, I can't fully enjoy a game unless I'm being competitive in it. So... here we are...
I'm more than just a great trainer: I also happen to be a historian and archaeologist, Yusuke. I often use my popularity to beseech my fans to support the local museums and history centers.
I also aspire to be as successful as a historian as I am a Champion. Just like art, folklore and artifacts deserves to be preserved and remembered, to be appreciated and admired.
Oh, I've been quite busy in my work both as a trainer and as a historian, so I've barely had the time recently, Jura. Besides, I would be looking for a boyfriend rather than a girlfriend.
I'm so busy lately, I've barely had the time to take a break, let alone get a date, Jura. I don't know about a girlfriend, but finding a boyfriend takes some time.
Sinnoh is located just north of the Johto and Kanto regions, Yuri. If you've heard of Mount Coronet, then that's where the Sinnoh region is.
Sinnoh is further north compared to regions such as Johto, Kanto, and Hoenn, Yuri. It's a common winter destination for tourists, particularly Mount Coronet.
Well... the only Pokémon I brought with me to this place was Garchomp, and... I wouldn't want to cause a scene by having my Garchomp march about in a place like this.
I didn't feel the need to bring any of my Pokémon aside from my Garchomp... and I don't think Garchomp is the type of Pokémon you'd want to pet anyway.
I could bring out my Garchomp right now, but it might disrupt the game too much if I did. Not to mention that she's not quite a "cute" Pokémon to begin with.
Oh, they're not literally Pocket Monsters, Perona. Rather, they're kept in Pokéballs, which are then kept in pockets. Most Pokémon are too big to fit in pockets.
You misunderstood what Pokémon are, Perona. They're called Pocket Monsters because they can be kept in pockets when inside a Pokéball. Most Pokémon are actually quite large.
You are correct that I'm a researcher, Jim, but my research isn't on Pokémon, at least not directly. My main involvement with Pokémon is as a trainer, primarily for battles.
I am in fact a researcher, but I presume you're talking in context of Pokémon, in which case I'm actually a trainer. I'm actually more well-known for my Pokémon battles rather than for my research.
I can't think of any Pokémon on the top of my head that fits the monsters moniker, but ghost-type Pokémon are quite rampant. Whether or not you would consider them as cute is up to you, Perona.
Well, there's the ghost-type Pokémon, which is probably what you're looking for, Perona. They can vary in appearance, but some ghost-types can be considered as cute.
No Pokémon can be truly considered as grotesque, but you can find at least one of the ghost-type Pokémon as cute. There's so many of them, you're bound to like one of them.
That's quite intriguing, Nami. She must know a lot of things that I don't, such as the local history of your region. I would be excited to meet up with her, if such an arrangement would be possible.

My, that does sound like it would be a very fascinating meet-up, Nami. With my knowledge of Sinnohlian culture and history, and her knowledge of your local history, we would undoubtedly learn a lot from each other!
There's a lot of skills needed to become a successful trainer, Jim. You need to be knowledgeable about a Pokémon's strengths and weaknesses, and possess strategic prowess. Adaptability is key.
A strong team alone wouldn't be enough to become a good trainer, Jim. A good trainer would know what to do in any given situations. Oftentimes, it can be a question of where and when, you see.

Oh, I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, Nami, a position I've held for a couple of years now. If you don't know what that is, I'm basically the best Pokémon trainer in the Sinnoh region, and no one has bested my team in a battle.

I'm none other than the Sinnoh League Champion, Nami. Think of it as a hierarchy, where I'm at the top of the pyramid among all Pokémon trainers. In Pokémon battles, that is. I've been undefeated for years now.
You can say that my fashion sense is more on the conservative side, Mia. I don't normally show off a lot of skin. Aside from my swimsuit, of course.
I normally cover myself up, partially due to the cold weather of my hometown, Mia. You know the style: shirt, pants... The only time I really show myself off is when I'm in my swimsuit.

People would presume that I would consider my status as the Sinnoh League Champion as my greatest achievement, but in reality, I would say that deciphering the Sinnoh creation story is an even more impressive feat, Yuri.

Becoming the Champion of Sinnoh is no small feat, Yuri, but there's always one champion. Meanwhile, deciphering the mural depicting the creation of Sinnoh is something that has never been done before. I'm the first person to succeed in that endeavor!
Hmm, if you have a subscription to SinnohTV, they sometimes show some of my battles, Jim. Some of my more notable matches is sometimes shown in PokeBattle Channel for free.
Well, if you have access to the internet, you can go to the PokeBattle website, and almost all my battles are there, Jim. They also offer live streaming of my upcoming matches.
What exactly do you mean, Colt? My hair is naturally long. I know quite a handful of people that have a similar hair length to mine.
I never would have thought that my hair length would ever be considered as exceptional, Colt. Quite the contrary, I know some people with even longer hair than mine.
Well, I wanted to do something different, and to challenge myself. I haven't played strip poker, you see. All I can say is that it's very different from Pokémon battles, May.
Do you know how quickly things can turn into a routine if you do it all the time, May? Well, I figured that breaking my routine would be a good idea, and here I am.
Hmm, is there something about my outfit that has piqued your interest, Ayano? I can see you observing me intently.
Either you found something interesting about my outfit, or you're thinking about something on my outfit, Ayano. I've noticed that you've been observing me for quite a while now.
Oh well, I can't expect to win everything. Besides, this defeat helped me identify flaws in my strategy. I'll come back stronger next time, Rosa.
It's an early advantage, but I wouldn't assume that it will last. I'm learning from my defeat, Rosa. Don't expect me to make the same mistake twice.
I would like to think that I would win that battle, Rosa, based on the fact that I have the more balanced team. It will be quite a difficult battle though.
Iris's team is quite formidable, but I always felt she relied too much on Dragon-types, Rosa. A balanced team like mine should be able to beat her.
Oh, I wasn't expecting anyone to compliment my underwear, but I do appreciate it. These weren't particularly cheap to begin with, so at least the cost is worth it, it would seem.
I'm not trying to be flashy with my underwear, but there's no denying that they can catch a bit of attention. Not that I really mind...
My Pokémon aren't really the type you would normally see in Pokémon contests. My Garchomp has a good enough hand-eye coordination, but I think she would struggle with dances.
That is quite an interesting thought, but in the end, it would be quite an exercise in futility. My Garchomp is hardly trained for Pokémon contests. Same goes for the rest of my team.
Well... I don't know if I've spurred on any fashion trends, but I am well aware that people have been speculating about what type of swimsuit I would wear to the beach.
I've gained a lot of attention when it comes to Pokémon training, sure enough, but I've never been one for the fashion spotlight. Still, people like speculating about my swimsuit color...
If you're worried that this poker game will be as lopsided as most of my Pokémon matches, Gwen, you should know that this game has an element of randomness.
There's a possibility that I'll win this game easily, and there's an equal chance that I won't, Gwen. This games relies heavily on chance, so it could go either way.
Well, I don't have any routines per se, Pyrrha. All I do is do research on my opponent's team to determine their strengths and weaknesses, and formulate my strategy.
It's hardly considered a routine, but I do research on my opponents to determine the best strategy, and to stamp out any weaknesses my team might have.
By that, I take it to mean that you studied history in your youth, Fina. So did I, but I found it quite lacking, so I strive to learn as much as I possibly can.
Just like you, I was also taught ancient history at a young age, Fina. It's what sparked my interest in the topic, and hence why I am still wanting to learn more.
I'm an archaeologist, but I would presume that you've heard of me due to my status as the Sinnoh League Champion. Essentially, I'm the best Pokémon trainer in all of Sinnoh.
A minority of people know me for my archaeological works, but most know me as the Sinnoh League Champion. That makes me the de facto strongest Pokémon trainer in Sinnoh.
Truth be told, after all that's happened with the Distortion World, and Giratina, and the near destruction of the universe, the publication of my findings felt mundane in comparison, Yuri.

Considering that my findings occurred just before the opening of the portal to the Distortion World, and my battle against a previously forgotten entity, the publication felt like an afterthought, Yuri.
I have never tried acting before, Rosa. As tantalizing as that situation is, I don't think my acting skills would be quite up to the standards of the Pokéstar studios.
I might be the best trainer in Sinnoh, but I doubt I would pass off as an actress at all, Rosa. It's simply not something I've done before in any capacity.
... I can see that you want to tell me something, Magma Grunt. I often see people freeze up once they meet me face-to-face. You can tell me anything.
... I can sense that you have something to say, Magma Grunt. It's so endearing seeing people your age suddenly get tongue-tied in my presence.
You can ask me anything, Magma Grunt... as long as it's within reason, of course.
Is it related to Pokémon, or just general live advice, Magma Grunt? Either way, you can ask away.
I'm hardly someone you would consider to be a big fashion fan, Fate, but I'm quite conscious about my appearance. I have to look presentable at all times.
I'm not actively keeping up with the latest fashion trends, Fate, but I just picked the outfit that I think looks best on me. First impressions can mean a lot to people.
Ah, you've read some of my scientific journals before! It's not often I meet someone who knows me though my research, rather than my Pokémon battles.
I expected the possibility that some people might recognize me, but I thought it would be due to my status as League Champion, rather than my research.
I am an expert in both archaeology and Pokémon battling, Sucrose. Which one are you interested in talking about?
I have made significant discoveries about ancient Sinnoh history, and I'm also the Sinnoh League Champion several years running. But I figure you want to talk about one...
I don't want to sound vain, but I'm well aware that I'm quite beautiful. Why do you ask, Sucrose?
It would be foolish for me to think otherwise, Sucrose. It's quite evident, even since my childhood. I wonder why you chose that question to ask me...
It's been increasingly difficult to balance my time between battling and archaeology, Dawn. I just happened to have a lot of free time right now, so I tried something different.
I'm more busy now than I've ever been, so I have to maximize the use of what little free time I have. That's how I ended up playing this game, just to mix thing up a bit.
Is that what's going through the gossip grapevine nowadays, Bobobo? To answer your question, I haven't been beaten yet. I still remain the Sinnoh League Champion.
Where did you hear that, Bobobo? I remain undefeated as the Sinnoh League Champion... I have no idea how a rumor like that could exist.
You are correct, Y'shtola. I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, which means that I'm the best Pokémon trainer in the entire Sinnoh region.
That's a... unique compliment... I presume you meant that in good faith, but how exactly do I remind you of your admins?
I don't know who the Team Magma admins are, but I would expect that is meant to be a compliment in my behalf... Can you elaborate on that comparison?
My best friend considers elegance and grace to be of utmost importance. She's of the belief that elegance elevates one's prowess. Why did you ask, Perona?
My best friend is the epitome of graceful taste, Perona. According to her, perfection can only be achieved with refinement and dignity. What made you curious about my best friend, if I may ask?
Animals? Is that what Pokémon are called in your native region, Jason? Technically, you're right, although Pokémon battles are closer to sparring than actual battling.
I'm not familiar with the term animal but I would presume you meant my Pokémon, Jason. You can call it a fight, but the intent is to cause the other Pokémon to faint, rather than outright killing it.

I used to be an intern in Professor Rowan's lab, and then when I turned 10, he gifted me a starter Pokémon and an empty Pokédex. My spirit of adventure led me to explore the Sinnoh region to fill up my Pokédex.
You can say that my career as trainer began when Professor Rowan gifted me a starter Pokémon and a Pokédex after completing my internship. My adventures began by filling up that Pokédex.
I wouldn't say so, I had to build my team by exploring a lot of tall grass... But, there was that time that I was gifted a Riolu egg... Or when I got a Spiritomb under serendipitous circumstances...

My team composition was mostly due to my perseverance than blind luck... Although I did receive a Feebas as a gift one time... There's also that time I got lost in a cave and caught a Gible as a result...

Now that you mentioned it, I've been having difficulty sleeping for the past couple of months. There are even days where I only got one or two hours of sleep. I guess I should spend more time in bed perhaps?
Come to think of it, when I have nothing going on, I prefer staying in bed for longer than usual, even when I'm not sleepy anymore... Is that a sign that I'm completely lacking in sleep?

My recent schedule has caused a lot of stress for me. Having to travel all the time is very exhausting. I would even say that in the last six months, I've spent more time in a plane seat than in an actual bed.
As I said before, my tight schedule has left me very exhausted and stressed out. In the past six months, most of my sleeping hours have been spent sitting on a plane, rather than lying down on a bed.

My current dilemma is that I aspire to please all my fans and colleagues, while not stressing myself out. But if I take a break, I would disappoint everyone, since I wouldn't be living up to my standards.

Here's my current issue: I want to be as good as I can be both as a Trainer and an Archaeologist, without giving myself too much strife. If I take a step back, I'll be letting down everyone, including myself.
A little vacation wouldn't hurt, I suppose, but I believe fatigue and overwork are not the only things affecting me emotionally... There's this other thing... I probably shouldn't say it here...
If it would help my mental health, going on an extended break would be a good idea... But there's another thing that's keeping me anxious... But I shouldn't tell it to everybody here...
I suppose I'm putting too much value on how people view me... But something I've noted... When I was younger, men would flirt with me all the time. But lately... nothing at all...

I'm not usually vain... But I've noticed that I used to attract more attention from men when I was younger... Flirting, or even just talking to me... That's not something I experience anymore as I've aged.
I hate to admit it, but I cried myself to sleep when I heard about the concept of Delcatty ladies, and I fear that I might end up in the same route as them. That resonated too much with me...

This is to much for me to say... but the other day, I read up on the Delcatty lady stereotype, and I fear I'm falling along the same lines as them. It was too much... I cried the whole night because of it...
This is a bit of an insecure question... But do you think I'm still attractive, Dawn?... Given my apparent age...
I know I'm putting you on the spot, Dawn, but I wanted to know something... Do you think I'm still attractive, even if I've aged since we last met..?
You're absolutely correct! If you've got the grace and elegance, you can try to be a coordinator. Or you can even go for non-competitive roles such as being a Pokémon breeder.
There are plenty of career paths to choose from. If you've got the eye for beauty and showmanship, you can try to be a coordinator. Or a groomer perhaps, or even a scientist.

Sinnoh's weather is actually quite diverse! Some towns are covered year-round by snow, but most of the areas surrounding Mount Coronet have tropical weather. There are even forests, marshes, and swamps.
There are spots that indeed have persistent snowfall, but that can't be used to generalize the weather for the whole region. There are forests, marshes, lakes and even hot springs.
...Not at all. I'm career-oriented, and simply haven't had the time for romance. ... Besides, there's nothing wrong with being unmarried at my age...
... What's so u-unusual about it? Like I said before, I've been prioritizing my work over romance. Either way, being single at my age is hardly a cause for concern...
Hmm, I wouldn't know about dressing in shadows, but my coat and scarf are necessary given the cold weather back home at Sinnoh. The dark theme just came on it's own.

You're correct that my outfit is indeed of very high quality, Hu Tao, but I wouldn't really call it shadowy. This type of attire is somewhat a necessity when you live in a region that snows all year round.
Pokémon are classified by type, and type generally refer to the element that a Pokémon can manipulate. Fire-types can produce and control fire, while water-types can control water, for example.
There are multiple ways of categorizing Pokémon, but the most common method is by type. Aside from the ghost-types and dragon-types, there's also the flying-types and the ground-types.
Animal species? Is that the equivalent of Pokémon where you're from, Hu Tao? How are they different from the Pokémon I described earlier?
I haven't heard of an animal before, Hu Tao. Would you say that they are the analogue of Pokémon of your homeland? What kind of abilities do animals possess?

The only Pokémon I can think off the top of my head who's both a fire and ghost-type are Litwick and its evolved forms. I suppose a Litwick would be easy enough to take care, even for a novice like you.
Aside from Litwick and its evolutions, I can't really recall any other half-ghost, half-fire Pokémon. If you're interested at being a trainer, a Litwick would be a good Pokémon to start with.
Well, my ace Pokémon is Garchomp, a Dragon/Ground type. I also have a Spiritomb, who's a Ghost/Dark type, a Lucario who's a Fighting/Steel, and a water-type Milotic. That sums up my usual team.

It's indeed one of the most common hobbies out there! Children as young as 3 can train a Pokémon, though usually people wait until they're 10 to do so. Everybody from children to elderly people can partake in this hobby.

Pokémon training has to be one of the biggest hobbies out there. Anyone between 10 and 99 years old can and usually will train their own Pokémon. I've seen kids as young as 3 years old with their own trained Pokémon!

My current interest is researching and interpreting creation stories. Each culture has its own creation story, and I hope to determine the historicity of each one, and get an accurate timeline of the world's creation.

The past couple of years, I've been focusing almost entirely on myths regarding the creation of the world and the universe. Despite the variety of creation myths, I do believe that a historical timeline can be derived from the analysis from such myths.

Training my Pokémon is in indeed a large part of my routine. Since I'm the League Champion, I also do public appearances, such as in officially-sanctioned regional tournaments. I also have a bit of a say when it comes to league operations.

That's just a small part of my role as League Champion. Aside from doing public appearance within the Sinnoh region, I also serve as an ambassador for the Sinnoh League. I'm also a special adviser to the management of the Sinnoh League.
Not in particular that I can remember. Everybody's lives simply returned to normal as if nothing happened. Not that it really matters for me, since I did not do it for the sake of glory-hunting.

I suppose you can say that seeing everyone resume their everyday lives is a reward in itself. I never really pursued any awards or recognition either, since I'm just happy that the world remained intact.
My ace Pokémon is a Garchomp, and I've been taking care of her since she was a Gible, Hilda. But I wouldn't call her cute, but rather powerful and majestic.

My Garchomp is the only correct answer to that. She's always been at my side since my childhood. Although she can be unconventionally cute, I feel like fearsome and awe-inspiring might be more a appropriate description.

There's nothing to be gained when humans get into a physical altercation, Aaravi. You see, Pokémon get stronger when they engage in battle, and Pokémon battles are a competitive way of making Pokémon stronger and more powerful.

Humans fighting each other is not only a waste of time, but also harmful for the participants, Aaravi. In contrast, Pokémon battles make both participants more powerful, and aids in keeping Pokémon healthful and more developed.

Well, like most children of my time, becoming the champion is the biggest dream. I started training Pokémon at about the same age as most people. I always have had that extra step compared to most people, and that's helped me stand out from the rest.

Becoming the League Champion is a dream that pretty much every child has. I'm just one of the select few that managed to make my dream a reality. I've always have had an eye for perfection, and that's undoubtedly helped my cause.

I don't have a particular affinity for fashion, but I'm conscious about my outward appearance, and this outfit does suit me a lot. It also doesn't hurt that it's quite fitting for the weather as well, Fluttershy.
I wouldn't classify myself as a big fashionista, but I carefully pick out the outfits that I wear in public, Fluttershy. Of course, I choose my outfit based on the context, and weather as well.

Imagine the most surreal place possible, a place where time does not flow and the rules of physics are not obeyed. I managed to trek up a waterfall as if I was hiking up a hill, and the water was actually flowing upward.

Nothing in that dimension made logical sense. Floating islands are scattered in all manners of direction in every axis, and you can walk sideways and even upside down without any regards to the laws of gravity.
Considering how frenetic battles can get, a quick reflex is sometimes necessary to avoid getting hit. Some Pokémon tend to do better if you join in their physical training, especially fighting-types.

It is true that trainers can sometime be in the firing line during battles. However, some trainers prefer joining their Pokémon when it comes to fitness training. Applies to fighting-types in particular.

I suppose you might be right, Noire, but it's nice to go out of your comfort zone from time to time and try out something new. Besides, I like the high-risk, high-reward nature of this game, and how could I resist such a challenge?

You raise some valid points, but monotony can take the spirit out of things, you know? Adding a touch of variety every now and then makes for an exciting adventure, especially one with stakes like this, Noire.

There's a lot more to being a League Champion than simply having the strongest team, Tomoko. You have to take into consideration things like type advantages, and attributes such as Attack, Defense, and Speed.

You can't just take a strong Pokémon lineup and expect to cruise all the way into becoming a Champion, Tomoko. Things such as type weaknesses, team construction, and Pokémon attributes makes strategy more complicated than it might seem.

The best part is seeing the harmony in my team, regardless of whether we win or not. It takes a lot of time and effort to build that level of trust between us, and it's great to see it paying off, Miki.

When you work in teams, what you want to see is a sense of cohesion and teamwork, Miki. It's not easy organizing a team that can gel well together, while still allowing a degree of freedom when it comes to the strategy.
Well, I was just curious about this place, and I also wanted a different kind of thrill than what I'm used to, Samus. Just because I'm an archaeologist doesn't mean I can enjoy activities like this.

Devoting all my time to my archaeological activities and historical research can get a bit tiresome, Samus. I wanted a bit of variety to get out of my routine, and this was certainly an enjoyable way of doing it.

Not a leader per se, but being the League Champion simply means that I'm the best trainer in the region, Barbara. Although, I do have some authority in the operations of the Pokémon League, both executive and ceremonial.

Being the League Champion is more of a title than an actual position, which I obtained by defeating the entire hierarchy of the Pokémon League, Barbara. Being in the position does give me limited powers in the operation of the Pokémon League.

Some Pokémon can be ridden into battle, and some can be even ridden during battle, Petra. There are plenty of legends of heroes riding their Pokémon into the battlefield. In my case, I've ridden my Garchomp many times before.

There are plenty of Pokémon which can be ridden, and the practice persists even to this day, Petra. If you're asking about me specifically, I've ridden on the back of my Garchomp multiple times before, even during flight.
I've had my Garchomp since I was a child, Petra. I first caught her when she was still a Gible, and I've been taking care of her up to the present. We've been through a lot together.
My Garchomp has been with me for my entire career as a Pokémon Trainer, Petra. She was still a Gible when I caught her, and she eventually evolved all the way to a Garchomp throughout our adventures.
I see. That's excellent news then! I've never been to Brigid before, but I'd love to visit it some time soon, Petra.
I'm flattered that you hold me in such high regard, Petra. I should look into ways of traveling to Brigid for an upcoming vacation...
I'm never heard of anything about simulation, but I have read up on theories about reality either being the contents of a painting or a book being manipulated by a higher entity, ~monika~.
Not quite what you're asking for, ~monika~, but there were some philosophers who brought forth the theory that reality as we know it might be nothing more than the scenes on a painting, or a book.

I've always have had a fascination with knowing the truth behind local legends, ~aaravi~. Exploring ruins for artifacts is vital not just for knowing what transpired in the past, but also put a context in folk stories.

Have you ever read up on a folk story, and wondered if it actually happened, ~aaravi~. Exploring ruins and abandoned settlements for artifacts can help in answering that question, and also give a clear picture of how people in the past lived.

It does indeed get very chilly in the Sinnoh region, ~kyou~, so much so that the northern part of the region is permanently covered in snow. Despite its appearance, my coat can be used in warm weather too.

The Sinnoh region is unofficially known as the Winter Region since some parts of the region is perpetually covered in snow, and the wind chill travels across the region. Although, my coat is comfortable even in warmer settings.
Hmm, that's indeed odd, ~kyou~. It's against the rules to attempt to catch a Pokémon that's already owned by a trainer. Although, it seems to be quite a common error for young trainers.

Well, attempting to catch another trainer's Pokémon is way out of line... I could only guess that it was inexperienced trainers that attempted to catch your pet, ~kyou~. It seems to happen often, or so I heard.
I came here to try out something different and take a break from my routine, ~leon~. My work was getting a bit overbearing lately, so I thought changing it up would be a worthwhile idea.

I must admit that the idea of this place intrigued me, and it was not something I've ever tried out before, ~leon~. Having new experiences is a good way of taking a break from a stressful work environment, or so I would think.
I have a natural urge for exploring, and whenever I'm not busy, I usually spend my time going for walks. Aside from being a good way of exercise, it also allow me to meet new people.
When I need to relax, one thing I do to calm myself is to go on lengthy walks and just take in the surroundings. Besides, it's a good way of getting some exercise, and socializing with people.
Oh... well, long work hours makes it difficult to get any relationships, ~leon~... n-not that it spurned me to attend this game, of course... I came here for the new experience...

A lot of people have indeed asked me out, ~leon~, but my work schedule makes a relationship impractical... but the reason I'm here was to try something different... d-definitely not to try and date someone...
Not at all, ~hilda~! I was just here to try something different... I haven't played strip poker before, I mean... Besides, I don't have a... boyfriend...
I came here because I got curious about this place, ~hilda~, and strip poker is not something I've done previously... And I have nobody to impress back home regardless...

I wouldn't really say I'm scared, ~fluttershy~. First off, I had plenty of time to mentally prepare myself before attending this game. Secondly, this game is going at a sedate pace, so it's not as nerve-racking as it might otherwise.

I'm not afraid at all, ~fluttershy~. Mind you, I wouldn't want to actually lose, but I knew what I was getting into when I joined this game. This game is also slower-paced than I anticipated, which helps alleviate the pressure.

I'm indeed enjoying myself in this game so far, but I'm not really much of a poker expert myself. I suppose if you want a tip, you should always replace cards that do not form a pair, even if it means replacing all your cards.

I'm having too much fun to let this game end, but I'm afraid I'm not any more knowledgeable on poker strategies than you are. The only tip I can think of is to not try going for straights, but go for pairs instead.
Well, well, perhaps strip poker isn't the walk in the park I expected it to be. I'll come back even stronger, so get ready, ~kyou~.
I might have lost that round, but there won't be any letup from me! Now that I've identified the weakness in my strategy, I'll be even more competitive, ~kyou~.
You think so, ~kyou~? Can you point out to me which part of my approach is wrong?
You said that without any hesitation, ~kyou~. I suppose you would know how to improve my chances, hmm?
My strategy worked for a moment, but it's time for me to revise my approach. After all, defeats like this is a learning experience, Rosa. Expect me to come back stronger next round.
I might have lost this round, but I'm far from losing this game, Rosa. I do get my Pokémon faint from time to time, so small losses like this is not out of the norm for me.

Oh, it's just that... Just being in a setting like this... Well, let's say this situation I'm in, it's a lot more intimate than what I'm used to. And I'm not just talking about the fact that I'm stripping in front of everybody.

It's the setting... it's getting to my head... I figured that attending a game like this might ease my feeling of solitude, but it's too much for me to handle at once... the closeness with each other...
Not at the moment, ~pyrrha~. Let's just say the crampedness of my schedule can make such relationships difficult to maintain...
My current situation with my work makes it quite difficult to form and maintain a romantic relationship, ~pyrrha~...
I do, as a matter of fact, ~rosa~. I have a villa there, where I usually spend the summer months, meeting my friends and just relaxing in general.
I own a villa in Undella Town, specifically so I can enjoy the summertime there, ~rosa~. It's a great place to relax and unwind with my Unovan friends.
I had a stylist when I was younger, but I primarily do my hair myself nowadays. It's a lot of time and effort, but it does pay off. Nothing create a good first impression like flowing hair like mine.
I used to have one, but I take it upon myself to take care of my hair. Considering the pristine quality of my hair, it was all worth the time and effort.

Ah, I see what you mean. People have built this image of me where I'm a bit of a femme fatale, but as you now know, that's not even close to reality. Being the Sinnoh Champion does carry a lot of weight, which can intimidate people.

Well, when you're the League Champion for several years running, people would begin cultivating this image of being stoic and unflappable. There's a reason you're not supposed to judge a book by its cover.
T-thanks... I knew the risks coming into this game, but I never thought I would have ended up at this stage. I'm... not at all used to people seeing me exposed like this.

I... appreciate the compliment... It would be foolish for me to not expect to end up naked at some point, but for it to actually happen... Being naked in front of others is not something I've done before...

An expedition to explore the ruins of a long lost civilization is a very enticing prospect, ~fina~. I would love to go if my schedule permits, but I'm also interested in this crew of yours. If you have already mentioned them earlier, please don't mind repeating it.

I can't possibly turn down an invite like that, my busy schedule aside. I'm also interested in knowing more about your crewmates, ~fina~. I suspect you might have mentioned them earlier, but I hope you don't mind explaining again.

I've never really heard of Dialga being associated with diamonds, ~bobobo~. I do know for a fact that Dialga is described as having a diamond gem in its chest. Perhaps that's what you were thinking of?
Dialga is associated with time rather than diamonds, ~bobobo~. I would presume you're referring to the fact that Dialga is often said to have a diamond gem on its chest.
It seems Pokémon training has not caught on yet on your home region, ~yshtola~, and I've heard of other such regions as well. Although, I've never heard of a Chocobo before. Can you describe it?

This is hardly the first time I've heard of a far-flung region that has not have had a tradition of Pokémon training, ~yshtola~. I do wonder what a Chocobo is. I've never heard of them before, at least not with that name.
Making myself look friendly, of course! Well... is this smile exactly what you're looking for, ~kyou~?
I see... I have to look approachable and not be intimidating at first glance. I don't usually smile like this, but do you think this looks good, ~kyou~?

I must say that the prospect of me losing and having to masturbate in front of everybody is a bit concerning, and it's not the type of thing I would prefer to do, ~miki_miura~, but I must not let the worry overcome my senses.

To be ashamed in a game like this would serve as a deathblow, leading to a string of consecutive defeat, ~miki_miura~. Although, I must admit that I'm a tad worried about the possibility of having to perform my forfeit...
Lucario is one of my Pokémon, ~miki_miura~. I suppose Lucario are not native to your region, but he's a fighting-type.
I take it that there are no native Lucario population in your region, ~miki_miura~. Well, Lucario is a fighting-type Pokémon, which is why he came to mind when you mentioned fighting.
Well, I have to make it clear that was not my intention coming here, ~miki_miura~. Besides, don't you think it would be bad form for me to pursue someone your age?

I didn't consider that possibility prior to coming here, ~miki_miura~... not to say that's my current plan or anything! Either way, don't you think you're better off pairing with someone in the same age group as you?

I would say so, ~yuno_uno~. I do get invited to attend various Pokémon contests as a special guest, both inside and outside the Sinnoh region. Not to mention all the premium competitions that I get to participate in.

As the League Champion, it is expected of me to attend various events as a guest of honor, although I also get invitation to events outside the Sinnoh region, ~yuno_uno~. That doesn't even include the other responsibilities of a champion.

state.text: I wouldn't say that I have a favorite Pokémon, ~fluttershy~. However, it can't be denied that my ace Pokémon is Garchomp. She's a formidable creature, isn't she?
Well, I suppose there's no harm if I show you Garchomp, ~fluttershy~. She's been with me since I started as a child, and despite her appearance, she's actually quite friendly.

case.state: You have an impeccable way with words, ~kaz~! I wouldn't mind if men flattered me more like this. Usually, attempts to flatter me tend to be more crude and lackadaisical.
As far as compliments go, this is among the most memorable ones, ~kaz~. Most attempts at flattery directed at me are rather infantile in comparison. I take it that my outfit has piqued your interest?
It's great that we can enjoy this game without being too competitive. I know that in battles and coordinating, people can become hyper-competitive and start rivalries as a result.

The atmosphere in this place is a breath of fresh air compared to the competitive air in the Pokémon League. Everyone here is much more relaxed and subdued. in contrast, rivalries are commonplace in the competitive Pokémon scene.
I'm curious if you've had any rivals in the past, May. Nowadays, everyone seems to have a rival trainer, even if it's a bit of a friendly rivalry.
People your age always seem to have a rival trainer, May, be it a competitive rivalry or a friendly one. Care to share your story about your rival?
I wouldn't mind playing another game like this. If you can invite one person, any person, to come with you in another strip poker game, who would you choose, May?
I wonder who I could invite next time I come here... What about you, May? Who would you like to ask out to a game of strip poker?
I might not have the same confidence that some Sinnoh League gym leaders have in revealing my body, but I'm not letting this setback shatter my concentration!

If you think the threat of nudity is enough to take me out of my element, then you've underestimated my resolve. Even though I'm not used to revealing outfits like some gym leaders, I can say that my nerves remain steely.
This was one roundabout way of getting my pants off, isn't it? I must say I'm not used to having my legs exposed in front of other people. That's more of the forte of a Pokémon coordinator.
Time to show off my thighs then? Pokémon coordinators are already used to this type of exposure, but it's not really often that I wear anything that doesn't cover most of my legs.
Not much pressure on this one, since I presume all of you can already see what's underneath. When you think about it, it's almost as if I'm going to strip down to my swimsuit.
It's not like this left much to the imagination anyway. Besides, there's not much different than having a swimwear on, it's pretty much the articles of clothing.

I don't know how to put this, but something about the atmosphere here is making me a bit curious about women. I'm not exactly sure what to make of it. I can't really say I'm attracted at all to women... but I'm having this unusual desire...
Has anyone else felt this odd feeling whenever you're around someone of the same gender in very close quarters? It's not at all different from what I feel around men I'm attracted to...

So, it comes down to this. I never would have known I would do such a thing, but that's what this game is all about, right? Who knows what other new experiences I'll get to have, and not just in the context of this game. The ~background.time~ is still young.

Standing nude in front of other people is not something I've ever done before, but that's why I attended this game in the first place. With the way things are going, this might not be the only thing I'll get to experience for the first time before the day is over.
A quick autograph wouldn't hurt at all. What exactly do you want me to autograph, May?
I've never been one to turn down an autograph for a fan. I'll autograph whatever you would like me to, May.

Don't tell anyone about this... but when I was your age, I once played a game of strip Pokémon battle. Everytime one of your Pokémon faints, you remove a piece of clothing. I didn't have to strip anything in that game.

I've never told this story before, but I've played something like this before, but as a Pokémon battle. I ended up not removing anything, since none of my Pokémon fainted during that battle. Of course, the same can't be said of my opponent.
Now, don't celebrate just yet. I may have lost this round, but I still have a long way to go, and I'm not letting up. It will take more than this to shake my concentration.
Things might be heating up in my end, but I'm not melting down any time soon. I'm just about done warming up for this game.
Hmm, and what would your request be, May? A little twist to this game perhaps?
I'm not really sure what kind of twist to expect from your request, May, but I accept your challenge!
I thought it was supposed to be a peck on the lips, hmm? Did you change your mind about that? Anyhow, I wouldn't mind kissing your cheek instead.

A just reward for a well-placed bet... but I thought I was supposed to kiss you on the lips when I lose? If you're not comfortable with that, I suppose kissing you on the cheek instead would be a good compromise.
I think I'm about 140 pounds, May... That was a bit out of the blue. Why did you ask?
I haven't checked in a while, but I'm right around 140 pounds. There must be a reason you would ask such an unusual question, May.
The proper hairstyle and attire can make a lot of difference in altering your perceived age, May. I think getting rid of your side bangs could help you look more mature.

If you want to look more mature, May, then something has to change about your appearance. Outfits are easy enough to change, but I think a change of hairstyle is also in order, especially in regards with your side bangs.
You really feel so, May? You might be expecting too much of my breasts. They're not particularly big or noteworthy... I suppose, like a Legendary Pokémon, people haven't seem them before...
I'm not sure this would be considered a momentous occasion like meeting a Legendary Pokémon, May... Expanding on that analogy, most people will probably never see this in their lives...
You always know what to say to make me blush, May. I can sense a rather strong desire coming from your direction. Could it be...?
If you compliment me any more, my knees might just buckle, May. I wouldn't suppose you were thinking exactly in that direction...
We don't just make "monsters" fight each other, Orendi. We catch them, train them, love them, and make them stronger. I don't think you have quite the same plan in mind, though.

There's more to Pokémon training than just making them commit mindless acts of violence, Orendi. Training a Pokémon is just like raising a child in many aspects. You don't just make them punch each other just because you will it.
Oh, I've been doing fine, Misty! Well... up until now, that is...
Things have been great, Misty! Have you heard about the newly discovered Galar region? We should make our way there and explore it together!

I actually have Pokémon rather than shikigami, ~reimu~. Although some ghost-type Pokémon can be confused for shikigami, Pokémon are purely physical beings. Additionally, I do have a dragon-type Pokémon with me right now, just in case.

It is true that I have a dragon-type with me, ~reimu~, but I actually train Pokémon rather than invoke shikigami. Pokémon are corporeal entities, even if some ghost-types blur the line between Pokémon and shikigami.
Do you think you can teach me about this Duel Monsters card game, Chazz? I'm always eager to learn about this kind of stuff.
Would now be a good time to inform me about Duel Monsters, Chazz? I try to learn everything I can about mythology and folklore!
... This isn't the start I had in mind...
Two losses straight out of the gates... Am I misremembering the game mechanics...?
...Perhaps I should have played a warmup game first before joining this table...
I thought dressing myself up would give me an advantage, but for me to lose all of them right off the bat is just very unlucky.
Losing three rounds in a row is unlucky enough, but for it to happen before anyone else has lost... I'm lost for words!
I know that my poker skills might be a bit rusty, but I didn't think I'd lose three times to start the game.
I brought all of these layers, only to lose all of them before anyone else had to strip... Perhaps playing this game was a big mistake...
We are playing poker, right? I have a feeling that we're playing different games with the way this is going...
Is there a conspiracy to get me to lost as soon as possible? First, all my accessories are gone and now my shirt, and nobody else have lost yet!
Am I getting pranked here?! There's no way I'm losing this many layers while everyone has yet to lose.
This game must have been rigged! There's no way a losing streak this bad, this early can happen organically!
Is this a cruel joke being played against me?! I really hope nobody is recording me getting humiliated here!
Is this a set-up to to get me naked?! Come on, this isn't funny at all!
This game isn't simply rigged! Even if you rig a game like this, you wouldn't be able to pull off what just happened to me. This is divine intervention.
Being completely naked while being leered at by a crowd is awakening something in me.
(Please report this bug. Shouldn't be playing when Cynthia has lost only once.)
It's been quite some time since I last payed poker. Some practice games might have been a good idea.
This game isn't going the way I thought it would. I wouldn't have expected to lose two in a row.
I was undefeated just two rounds ago... Is this a fluke or was my undefeated streak pure luck?
I thought I had figured out this game... How did I lose again?
Obviously, the card exchange strategy I had formulated the previous round wasn't effective. Good thing I had another one in mind.
The plan I came up with the previous round didn't pan out like I expected. Time to go to the backup strategy then.
I have no more minor clothing to spare. I didn't think I'd lose again immediately.
Again? But I don't have any small layers to spare anymore. I was hoping I wouldn't lose again so soon.
Time for me to actually strip something substantial then. I hope I can end this losing streak in the next round.
How did I lose my blouse and my pants in consecutive rounds?! This string of bad luck is simply unbelievable!
A couple of minutes ago, I was still properly dressed, and now... I'll be down to my underwear...
First my blouse, now my pants... It's like I'm just about to take a bath with how quickly I've lost both of them.
Didn't take long for me to lose my pantyhose, did it? Oh well, I'm more disappointed that I lost another layer so quickly.
My pantyhose was pretty much the same layer as my pants, so it kind of makes sense that they'll be gone one after the other.
At least my pantyhose has spared me from embarrassment for at least one more round. I can't afford losing a third consecutive round.
I cannot believe this! From having a safety net to having to expose myself within two rounds... How did I let this happen?
Oh Arceus, my luck has completely abandoned me the last two rounds.
And just like that, both pieces of my underwear are gone... When it's not your day, it's simply not your day.
It didn't take long at all for me to go from being down to my lingerie to ending up naked...
I bet some of you must be very happy that I lost both of my underwear in rapid succession...
And to think that three rounds ago, I wasn't even showing any underwear yet...
I must admit, losing my blouse made me lose my composure. No worries though, I still have plenty of chances at winning this game.
I thought I was mentally prepared for the possibility of me falling to my underwear, but the loss of my blouse affected me more than I had expected.
I don't think I remove my underwear this quickly even when I'm alone at home. Walking around in only my underwear can be refreshing.
Remember when I was still wearing my pantyhose? That was only two rounds ago. Hard to believe how unlucky this past few rounds.
Have I really lost 3 rounds in a row? No matter. As long as I'm not out of the game yet, I will always have a chance of winning. I don't give up that easily.
Just because I'm at a lengthy losing streak doesn't mean I've lost the game already. At a game of luck like this, I can go on a winning streak just as easily.
I don't think I've lost 3 of my Pokémon during battles the same way I'm losing clothes right now. Just goes to show how differing those two game are.
This is certainly an interesting way of making a challenge for myself: losing all my accessories in consecutive rounds. I don't mean that I threw the game, but still...
With the number of accessories I had brought to this game, I suppose it's karmic justice that I lost all of them quickly.
I had intended for my accessories to be my safety net, which I suppose it had fulfilled, but I still would have preferred not losing them this quickly.
4 losses in a row! I'm not even sure why I'm losing like this. I'm not even panicking before since I've only lost insignificant layers so far.
From being undefeated to having to remove my blouse in the span of four rounds... My first loss seems to have opened the proverbial floodgates.
Just four rounds ago, I still have my blouse and pants on,and now... I can't believe this is happening this quickly...
I felt like it was just a couple of minutes ago when I had to remove my shirt... How did it come to this in such a short span of time?
