I might have lost 4 in a row already, but I'll do everything I can to make sure it wouldn't be five. I can't afford another loss after this.
If you're enjoying this losing streak, then savor it because I'll make sure I'll go undefeated from now on. I have no other choice from this point.
Four losses in a row? You'll need a calculator to compute the odds of this happening to anyone!
I wouldn't be celebrating just yet if I were you. All losing streaks must come to an end. Don't expect me to give up anytime soon.
It's not the loss that hurts, it's the false hope that gets you.
I refuse to believe that there's nothing shady going on here. Dealer, you have some explaining to do!
I can't even figure out what's going on here! I feel like everything in this circumstance is actively working against me.
I'm getting the feeling that a deity is looking down at me and laughing at my humiliation.
Is this a secret test of character to see if I would break down under these circumstances?
Even the most mentally strong people will break down under these circumstances. Being used as a play toy by the universe is very disheartening.
For a second there, I thought everyone had forgotten that I'm also supposed to strip.
It took quite a while to get me to lose. This is also approximately the length of time it usually takes for my first Pokémon to be defeated during battles.
If it takes this long for me to strip each layer I'm wearing right now, then it would be early morning by the time you get me naked.
I still have another small layer remaining after this, so I would suggest picking the pace up. It took too long for me to lose this layer.
I know this might be frustrating for all of you, considering how long it took for me to lose this layer, but I had planned my strip order beforehand.
It took quite a while, but you finally got me to remove the last of my insignificant layers. Great job, everybody!
If everyone is got frustrated by the length of time it took to lose this round, then you'll be happy to know that this is my last minor layer.
I've been standing like this for so long that I had forgotten that I was in danger of losing my blouse.
With the amount of time I've gone without losing, I was starting to hope that I'd get to keep my shirt on for the rest of the game.
I know this sounds weird, but I'm somewhat glad that I'm finally removing my pants. It felt weird having them on without my shirt.
This is the longest I've gone wearing pants with no shirt. It's simply not the way I usually dress myself.
Using my pantyhose as a safety net worked much better than expected, considering how long I kept it on before losing again.
My pantyhose had been doing a perfect job of keeping my legs warm. I almost feel bad about having to remove them even though it's not even hiding my panties.
Just when I was starting to become comfortable in being in my underwear in front of other people...
I didn't mind being on my underwear for this long since it felt like I'm in my swimsuit, but having to remove my bra is a different matter...
I have been mentally preparing myself for this situation since I removed my bra. It has been quite a while since then, hasn't it?
I've been feeling cold since I removed my bra. By the way, how long has it been since then? It felt like I've been topless for a long time.
The only thing mitigating the embarrassment in this situation is the fact that I'm not the only one naked.
Since everyone is already nude, this might not be as bad as it seems.
With everyone being naked, I suppose the attention won't be all towards me.
Another crushing defeat by the hands of you two?
Another crushing defeat by the hands of you three?
Another crushing defeat? Even with all of you playing?
Huh? I had the worst hand out of everyone here? Impossible!
Ah! Not again!
Huh? Another loss? I'm beginning to lose count...
A-another defeat? B-but how? I thought I would have been good at this game!
Ah! NO! I don't have any layers to spare!
Huh? NO! Not now! Not when I'm only down to my underwear!
What?! What?! B-but I'm on my last two things! H-how did I... fail... like this...
I'm impressed that you've come this far... You've certainly earned what I'm about to show you...
You've fought your way through all 8 of my layers; nobody can say you didn't work hard for this.
I certainly hope this doesn't result in a scandal; I am a well-known figure in the Sinnoh region after all.
Even if I lose this game, this would help shape the way I play at future games.
My first loss? Ahh-- I see there's a fire in your eyes after all! This could get exciting.
Oh well. I knew that a perfect game wasn't a realistic expectation anyway.
A loss? Maybe I was mistaken in underestimating you! I now know that I have a battle in my hands.
Well, well, well. And I thought I had a chance of going undefeated like in my battles. I suppose that's the disadvantage of not having Garchomp with me right now.
I see... So this might be a closer game than I had thought...
My second defeat... No matter, I still have some clothing to spare.
Maybe... I should avoid taking unnecessary gambles in this game.
I don't mean to brag or anything, but I haven't lost two Pokémon in the same battle for quite a long time now. This game is quite different, to say the least.
Ah, so careless! ...Very well, I'll remove my shoes.
Huh? So, it seems I've lowered my guard...
A... third loss? This is... *ahem* this is quite unexpected.
... Just when I thought I was getting a hang of this game...
I see now that strip poker isn't as easy of a game as I thought. I'll... I'll take off my shirt now...
I knew the risks when I joined this game, but to actually experience them... I haven't even thought of it.
This is all on me. I let my earlier defeats get in my head.
It looks like I've got a real fight on my hands! No more underestimating my opponents!
It seems as if I've got a real fight on my hands! I won't be underestimating my opponents any longer!
I've lost again... But this game is far from over!
If I refuse to strip, would you guys rip off my clothes? I'm not opposed to that idea, as long as you get your dicks out immediately after.

There has been some groups with some rather... self-serving machinations that have attempted to use their Pokémon to further their goals. Some have gotten close to succeeding, but none have actually done so.
... I would be very interested in finding a man to marry... but I don't think now would be the best time, Jura. I would rather... focus on my obligations first... and find an opportunity later on...
... There's a time and place for everything, Jura... and I would say now's not the time yet... I mean, it's not a bad time but it's not the best time yet... More of a lack of opportunity...

I wouldn't call it fighting, but it's more like sparring... Pokémon spar with each other to become stronger. It is also a sport, but the objective is not to injure other Pokémon, but to merely make them faint.
Pokémon can indeed attack other Pokémon, and humans, but the goal of battling isn't to severely injure or kill other Pokémon, but merely cause them to faint. Think of it like simulated fighting.
Oh, I don't sell Pokéballs, nor do I have a spare I can give to you, but you don't really need a Pokéball if your plan is to have a Pokémon accompany you. It's merely for convenience of logistics.
A Pokéball isn't a strict requirement for getting a Pokémon companion, although it makes it easier in more ways than one... There are other ways you can befriend a Pokémon.
If you have a map of either Unova or Alola, I could easily point out where Sinnoh is located relative to those regions, Yuri. Those two regions are quite distant from Sinnoh though.
If you have a world map, I could easily point out the Sinnoh region. For additional reference, Sinnoh is almost antipodal to Galar and Kalos, if that would help you.
Well, ghost-type Pokémon can be found pretty much in any location that receives little light, such as caves or abandoned buildings. But, yes, they do have a tendency to live at graveyards.

If a location is dark and abandoned for extended periods of time, a ghost-type Pokémon most likely would inhabit it sooner than later. Graveyards are one such location, along with abandoned buildings, and underground ruins.
Hmm, did you mean Gengar? Well, I find Gengar to be very effective in battle, but can be a bit of a glass cannon, and I prefer a well-balanced team.
If you're talking about Gengar, all I can say is that he can be powerful in terms of attacking, but is quite vulnerable in defense...
Indeed, the stripping portion of this game is completely unfamiliar to me. I can't say I'm inexperienced in high-stakes competition though, given my status.
Stripping myself naked in front of other people isn't something I'm wont to do, but I'm not adverse to risky situations, hence this game was the perfect fit for my situation.
But that's not all. Your Pokémon also need to have a strong morale, and the best way to achieve that is to develop a strong emotional bond with them.
However, there is also a mental side to training Pokémon. They tend to learn faster when you have developed a strong emotional bond with them, not to mention it also makes them easier to train.
Don't worry, all Pokémon regional leagues are organized by officially sanctioned associations, and there's no reason to believe anything shady happens behind the scenes.
Pokémon leagues undergo heavy scrutiny to ensure that no laws and regulations are violated. The industry itself is quite heavily regulated.
... Well, this is a Gengar! Despite the mischievous smile, this Gengar is mostly harmless.
... Here you go, a Gengar. Even though they have been known to cause trouble, I can assure you this particular one is very friendly.

Battling is hardly the sole purpose of Pokémon, but rather is a common way of strengthening them. Besides, battling rarely results in long-lasting injuries, let alone death. When done correctly, it is a learning experience.

Battling is less of a duel to the death, and more of a sparring match. Someone must have committed a grave error for a Pokémon to get seriously injured, or even die. It's the best way of making Pokémon stronger.
Ah, but isn't that the thrill of this game? Seeing people in situations that don't normally occur in public. If anything, the challenge should make this game even more enticing!
Doesn't that just give you the thrill of the hunt, as people would call it. The more difficult it is to achieve something, the more desirable it becomes...
Well... I wouldn't say that it was written in an extinct language, but more of the fact that it was inscribed as a pictogram, and the meaning has long been lost to history.
Technically, it wasn't written in an extinct language, because it wasn't written at all. It was a carved inscription, not at all dissimilar to a drawing, but the meaning had been forgotten.
If you plan to watch one of my battles live, an online subscription would be your best option. Although, I've heard that the service can be a bit bothersome to use.
Well, if you're not a fan of commercial breaks and having to buy a special subscription package, then watching online would be good idea. From what I've heard, it's far from perfect though.
... Well... you see... Nudity is not really something I encounter in my routine and I was curious to see a bit of it... I mean as a subject of study, of course...
... I figured that this might feel a little bit more intimate than my usual activities... I mean intimidating, not intimate...
Well, my grandparents live in the old family home back in Celestic Town, in the Sinnoh Region. My younger sister lives with them as well. Come to think of it, I should visit them soon...
My family had a house back in the Sinnoh Region, in Celestic Town to be precise. My grandparents and sister still lives there, I think. I haven't visited in quite a while now...
You really think I'm thirty-four, Perona? Not that it really matters, since age is just a number after all. If it makes you more comfortable, just assume that we're the same age.
Thirty-four or not, my age hardly matters in our current predicament, Perona. You can think of me as being the same age as you, if you would prefer it that way.
Unfortunately, my strengths and weaknesses are hardly a secret anymore, at this point. So I have to get really creative for my strategies. Do the unorthodox.
My team composition is pretty well known, so I can hardly surprise my opponents. That's why I have to think outside the box when coming up with plans and strategies.
Part of what motivates me to be the Sinnoh League Champion is to inspire the next generation of trainers. It's important to use your training skill for the benefit of both man and Pokémon.
I know that young trainers look up to me as a role model, and I always strive to be the perfect model of a trainer, Magma Grunt. Never forget the bond between trainer and Pokémon.
Well... we wouldn't want the Pokémon League to turn into a pay-to-win model, so items like Revive and Max Potion are restricted to those who have proven to be competent trainers.
A gym badge is proof of a trainer's skills, so restricting items based on gym badges incentivises trainers to challenge and improve themselves, rather than relying on items or money.
Well, some of my fans have begun imitating my fashion style, so perhaps that's how you got that impression. I have been offered to do modeling, but I've turned them all down.
I've seen people in Sinnoh imitate my current attire, so you must have seen it beforehand. I've never done modeling, despite the all the offers from magazines.
Indeed, archaeological digs are part of my studies. However, another way of gathering data is by studying local cultures, and analyzing their ancient histories.

You can learn a lot from ruins and artifacts, but I felt that culture is an overlooked aspect of historical legacies. You can learn a lot from the stories that have been passed down through the generations.
I've done a bit of research into the history of alchemy myself, and I find the thought process they used to be quite unorthodox.
I'm not at all a stranger to the history of alchemy, and I must say that some of their processes and logic are a bit odd when compared to modern knowledge.
"Capturing Pocket Monsters" is not an incorrect terminology, but most people just say "catching Pokémon".
"Capturing Pocket Monsters" sounds a little bit aggressive, no? Most people I know simply say "catching Pokémon".
What?! What makes you say that...? I... I didn't come here... to feel wanted... I came her for the... challenge of this game...!
Well, they are indeed called Pocket Monsters, but they are hardly monstrous in demeanor, if not in appearance. And it's more of a sport than a battle. Killing is not the goal here.

Beasts and Monsters are not terms I would use to describe Pokémon. they're far more gentle than you might think. And battles refer to sport than warfare. It's a contest for the strongest Pokémon team.
I see. Indeed, to be a League Champion, you need a combination of determination, perseverance, intelligence, and cunning... It goes without saying it's quite a high standard.

It goes without saying that to become an ace trainer, you need to have a certain mindset: the mentality to always strive for excellence and self-improvement. As you've noted, it requires quite a lot of motivation.

Long story short, a madman once tried to create a new universe at the expense of the current one. Giratina, a Pokémon from another dimension, stopped him and created a portal to its home, the Distortion World.

To keep things brief, there was a man that tried to destroy the universe and rebuild it in his own image, but was stymied by Giratina, a Pokémon from another dimension known as the Distortion World. A portal there was created.

I know of some 10 year olds that have collected all the gym badges, but none of them have defeated me, Bobobo. As for Team Galactic affair, I did enlist the help of a young trainer, but that was mostly me.
I've been challenged by a 10 year old trainer, but I won that battle. That same trainer then helped me take down Team Galactic, but I was in full control of that operation.

I'm hardly the only trainer to have received a Pokédex... And I did explore the entire Sinnoh region, from Snowpoint City to the north, Twinleaf City to the South, and every route, lake, and cave in between.

It might be difficult to believe, but I'm not the only one to have been privileged with such a start in my career. Anyhow, I traveled through all the cities in Sinnoh, and left no cavern and building unexplored.
Your team is weak now, but they don't have to stay that way. If you believe in yourself, and set your heart into your goal, then I don't see a reason why you can't be an ace trainer too.

All ace trainers had to work their way from the bottom, the same can be said for your admins. If you work hard and power through all rough patches, then you will see your team improving during your journey.
Just like when I was your age then... My schedule has been tightening up lately, with Pokemon Leagues all over the world wanting me to do exhibition matches for them ever since the World Tournament.
Reminds me when I was younger... But I'm much busier now since I have exhibition matches scheduled all over the world. My participation in the World Tournament has to do with it.

That's a bit of an extreme deduction, don't you think? I would guess I'm just getting old. I've been feeling quite lethargic and disinterested lately, and I've also developed an insatiable craving for sweet foods.
You're jumping to conclusions, Dawn. All the body pains and headaches I've been feeling are also common signs of aging, I think. The lack of sleep and lethargy I've been experiencing is another one.

I don't think that would be much help, Dawn. When I do get the chance to sleep in a bed, I spend hours doing self-reflection. I mostly ruminate about my past mistakes and what I could have done differently.
A soft, warm bed might not do me much good in this case, Dawn. I would just spend my time contemplating about my past decisions, and thinking if I had chosen poorly.

The last time I took an extended break, I returned to a stack of paperwork so high, it covered the entire floor when it toppled over. If I relax now, I would only be bringing more stress on myself later on...
The caveat is that if I take a break now, I would be returning to a tall stack of unaccomplished paperwork. That would simply result in a net negative in terms of stress produced.

There's no point in hiding it... but I know women your age who already have boyfriends, and most women around my age are already married... Do you understand what I'm implying here...? I can't get myself to say it....

Since we're on this topic, I might as well continue... Most women my age have settled down and started a family, and even younger women have boyfriends already... Do you see where I'm going with this?
They still do, just like always. When I was younger, they used to gawk at me, even uncomfortably so. Nowadays, I sense an aura of fear and intimidation everytime I walk past...
When I was younger, people would look at me with admiration and even lust... In the present day, people look at me with a sense of caution and fear.
Perhaps you're right: I do need to let this issue go... I'm not that old at all yet. I've heard of this older Alolan professor that still got married, so hope is not completely lost for me yet...
You do have a point, Dawn... I should just let this issue go and not let myself be consumed by anxiety... After all, if this Alolan professor I've heard about can get married at her age, so can I.
T-thanks... Truth be told, doing this in front of an old friend is... not fully comfortable... But if I'm going to cast my insecurities aside, I would have to be less guarded than this...

As close as I am to my friends, going naked... in a setting like this... It makes me feel vulnerable... But I would have to learn to be brave in situations like this, if I am to get over my insecurities.
It seems that you've made a strategic blunder. Did you enter the Cuteness category instead of Toughness? You would also need to feed your Numel a big serving of yellow berry Pokéblocks.

I know that a Numel has no chance of winning the Cuteness category. You were better off entering the Toughness category, but you would still have needed a vast amount of yellow berry Pokéblocks to win.
Oh! That's the reason why I wear a coat and a scarf all the time! No need to snuggle up with anyone in this case. I can do j-just fine.
W-well, I have no need to snuggle with anyone due to the weather or for any other reason, because my attire does a sufficient job of keeping me warm.
... Are you implying that I'm too old to marry!? I'll have you know that I do not appreciate your condescending attitude.
Hmm, what are you suggesting!? Despite what you might think, I'm not yet beyond a marriageable age. I will not tolerate such uncouth behavior from you.
Not in particular, unless you consider archaeological sites as such. I suppose the fact that I have a ghost-type in my team would count, but my ace is Garchomp, who is a dragon-type.
I wouldn't say I have an affinity for such, but the closest I have would be Spiritomb, who's a ghost-type. But my main Pokémon is actually Garchomp, a dragon-type.

I appreciate the compliment! I do spend a considerable amount of time and effort in maintaining my hair, and the effort is clearly paying off. I always say that hair maintenance is the most visible part of personal hygiene.

It's amazing what the proper hair care can do! I've tried out various hairstyles over the years, and I've found that this one suits me the best. It does take some managing, but I would hardly consider it as wasted effort.
Is that so? Well, what is your honest opinion about my hair? I know I put a lot of time and effort into it, but I'm open to any suggestions you might have.
Your response is the opposite of graceful, you know. I don't know what's gotten into you, but you shouldn't be insulting total strangers. I doubt she'd appreciate your comments.
How uncouth! Bad-mouthing people like that is simply rude, especially when you don't even know them! Don't you think you would hurt her feeling if I tell her your comments?
Given the climate back in my home town, people prefer functionality over style when it comes to their outfit. Not to say that they can't be fashionable, but scarves and winter coats are the norm.

The cold weather back home has a great deal of control over the local fashion. There's only a limited number of ways you can make sweaters and fashionable while still remaining practical for the temperature.
There are currently 18 types of Pokémon, and not all of them are elemental-based, such as poison-types and ghost-types. Although, your wind-type most likely corresponds to flying-type Pokémon.
If your monster have 7 classifications, then Pokémon have 18 classifications, including dark-types and bug-types. As for Anemo, I would suppose the flying-type would be the closest analogue.
... Right? I would just operate under the assumption that animal is what you call docile Pokémon.
... I don't understand what you're implying here. I would infer that you're trying to differentiate between docile Pokémon and violent Pokémon.

Litwick are relatively easy to feed. Berries and beans should be enough for a complete diet. Although, it becomes stronger when sucking the life forces of people around it. To answer your other question, it is indeed a living thing.

It is alive rather than undead, and aside from a steady diet consisting primarily of beans and berries, there's not much special care you need to give to a Litwick. Just do keep in mind that it absorbs people's life forces to make itself more powerful.
When you think about it, just merely getting the chance to venture inside the Distortion World is a reward in itself. I doubt humanity has ventured there before, and hopefully never again.

It might have been under stressful circumstances, but becoming possibly among the first persons to tread among the Distortion World is a unique privilege. If all goes well, I might be the last one as well.

I learned that the world is always changing, and the only thing that is universal is joy. Humans bring Pokémon joy and Pokémon bring humans joy. A harmonious relationship between man and Pokémon is vital.
In all the places I've traveled, the concept of joy always exists. And it is people that brings joy to Pokémon, just as Pokémon bring joy to people. Humans and Pokémon need each other equally.
Oh, not at all! I'm wearing quite a substantial number of clothing, so it might take a while before I end up fully naked.
Considering I still have more than a handful of articles of clothing to spare for this game, it's not a topic that will be irrelevant soon.

Well, the oldest fossils discovered so far is about a hundred million years old. But given their biological complexity, it can be safely assumed that life existed way before that, possibly for billions of years. Then you have to add the actual process of the world's creation, which took time.

If my memory serves right, the oldest known fossilized evidence of life dates to at least a hundred million years, but it is commonly believed that microbial life predated those by as much as billions of years. In addition, the actual creation of the world was a lengthy and arduous process.

Indeed! I still look back to my youth, when I went on an adventure across the entire Sinnoh region. I met all kinds of Pokémon, and challenged trainers all over the region. It was quite the adventure!
Starting off at a young age can lead to a lot of childhood memories. I still remember when I was a child, and I traveled the entire region just to see as many type of Pokémon as I could.
Oh, suitors... I suppose having too many suitors would be a nice problem to have. Not that I would know how to deal with such a situation.
... Getting more suitors than I can handle sounds like a problem that most people can only dream of. Although, I'm not exactly sure what to do in such a scenario.
Well, the point still stands: nothing can beat my team, in a fair battle or otherwise, mostly due to my talent for strategizing. That makes me the deserved champion.
This outburst of you did nothing to discredit my rightful claim as the League Champion. No trainer out there can best my team, either in strength or in strategy.
I was starting to get overwhelmed by my workload, and one way or the other, this is an excellent opportunity to relieve some of my tension.
I must admit, this place was a bit out of my way, but regardless of what happens tonight, this ought to go a long way in reducing my stress.
I see. You came here to socialize with other people as well, hmm? It's nice to meet new people, and I wouldn't have met you if I hadn't come here.
I suppose you also came here to meet new people. I've met a lot of new people just on my journey here, and I'm certainly glad to have had the chance to meet you.

Oh, I should have been clearer. There are beaches in southern Sinnoh, ~kyou~, and I enjoy taking a dip from time to time. It's northern Sinnoh where it snows all the time, and it's also where I grew up in.

There are actually beaches in the southern tip of Sinnoh, ~kyou~. It's only the northernmost regions of Sinnoh that snows perpetually. I make the trip every summer and spring just to relax at the beach.
Well, I could release a PSA reminding trainers of the proper catching etiquette... Although, that ought to have been taught in the Pokémon Academy to start with...
I'm not exactly sure why it keeps on happening, but an awareness campaign during the next Junior Cup should help clear things up. Most of the young trainers watch that particular event, you see.

state.text: It wouldn't hurt if I bring her out for a quick moment. Just... don't try to touch her. She can be a bit shy around strangers.
As long as she's not reeking havoc, I don't see the harm in bringing out my Garchomp. Don't forget to give her plenty of personal space.

case.state: Oh, I see what you meant. I'm even more inexperienced when it comes to stripping... Removing my clothes in front of strangers is not something I've done before.
A little less experience is a bit of an understatement, given that I have no experience in stripping for the entertainment of total strangers, which I consider a good thing.
Oh, you meant a fighting-type battle? Well, my Lucario packs quite the punch, but his strongest move is Dragon Pulse, so his battles rarely draws blood.
I didn't realize you were asking about my Lucario... His punch is so strong that it can sometimes knock out with just one punch. But usually, we just use Dragon Pulse, which is even more powerful.
... I don't really need a bodyguard, since I can easily defend myself from anything... but I wouldn't oppose if you wanted to do so still...
... I would be happy for you to take a walk with me some time... Not that I really need protecting during my walks... but I could show you a few sights...

... I must admit that I wouldn't be opposed to the idea of you taking me out on a date... Or rather, the hypothetical idea of it... I'm not imploring you to take me out, I'm just saying... in a complete hypothetical scenario, it might not be so bad...

... If I came here to simply find a date, then I would accept if you asked me out on one... Hypothetically speaking of course... Well, even if I did accept, it doesn't necessarily prove that I only came here in a desperate attempt at getting a date...

A good type spread will always overcome a type specialization. Off the top of my head, I would think my Lucario's Dragon Pulse, combined with the fact that he's half-steel-type, should wreak havoc against her dragons. That's half her team out of the running.

When half your team are one type, you leave yourself vulnerable to one Pokémon type. The fact that my Milotic has both an ice-type move and dragon-type move will spell trouble for her dragons, leaving me with only three Pokémon to worry about.

Well, all I'm saying is that I'm not opposed to the idea of acting, but to do my debut in such a high-profile movie... It's a huge risk. Besides, I doubt I can live up to Sabrina's performance in the original.

The prospect of becoming an actress does appeal to me in some way, but I might be punching above my weight starting off in such a well-known film. I wouldn't want to disappoint people just because I couldn't replicate Sabrina's unique charm in the first film.
I didn't come here to do... that, mind you... I just wanted to get my nerves settled, that's all. I wouldn't want to be a nervous wreck when things come to that...
That wasn't my goal... This is more of a dry run, to help myself get comfortable with the idea of carnal intimacy... I don't want to be a bag of nerves when the special moment comes...
When the going gets tough, that's the time I show my true qualities as a champion. You wouldn't have to worry about seeing me even more exposed than this.
If you hate that the fact that I'm becoming more and more exposed, then you'd love the rest of the game, ~kyou~. Don't expect any easy give away from this point onwards.
Do go on... What would you say is your preferred approach...? One that I can easily pull off.
I'd be lying when I say that I knew exactly how to do that... If you were in my position, how would you go about teasing people?

I do recall seeing some trees there, and they were quite unusual. Spiky and extending straight upwards, almost like kelp. But, the one and only Pokémon inhabiting it was none other than the Forgotten One, Giratina.

There were some tall and spiky trees scattered all over the place. It would have been an interesting thing to study, but my attention was captured by the only inhabitant of that world: Giratina, the Shadow Pokémon who had been banished to that realm.
It's all a matter of preparation, really. If I had participated in this game without preparing myself first, I would be a lot more nervous at this point.
Mental preparation and getting in the right mindset really does a lot of wonders. Otherwise, I would probably be not as composed as I am right now.

Aside from hanging out with my friends in my villa, I also enjoy taking long walks in the beach and the nature trails. Visiting the local spa is akin to an annual event for me. It's a class above the others I've visited.

Of the top of my head, my friends and I would visit the local shops and restaurants, and hang out on the harbor... I mustn't forget that I would also visit the local spa. The service there is quite heavenly.
Your buns are quite unique as far as hairstyles go. I wouldn't be at all surprised if your fans began imitating it. I might give it a go myself...

I was going to comment that your hair is even more memorable than mine are. You made a new hairstyle trend with those buns during your acting days. I wouldn't mind trying for hair buns in the future...
That's good to hear. I'm glad that opening myself to you has allowed me to show my true personality to you, even if the circumstances are quite atypical.
There was no need to feel intimidated to begin with. Even if this is not the usual way of doing it, it's good that I was able to show my genuine personality to you when I'm outside of battles.
Even if I'm not used to someone leering at me like this, it would be silly of me to expect anything else to happen in this situation... I wouldn't mind you staring... but please don't overdo it...

I'm flattered that my physique is attractive enough for you to stare at me like that... I could learn to be more comfortable with my own body, but I'm still not quite used to people staring at me... that intently...

Your sentiment is correct, but the possibility that we might be living in a computer simulation is rather discomforting. Can you imagine if we were nothing more than digital toys, existing solely for the titillation of unknown higher beings?

Even though they are quite similar in concept, the concept of a computer simulation is more disconcerting. We could be nothing more than video game characters, being made to play this game for the sake of unseen viewers, and we wouldn't know.
It's not that I can't get a date. In reality, I've... been very busy with my work! Especially my very busy schedule and all.
I wish things were that simple... Of course, when you're traveling all over the world and working long hours like my job dictates, forming a romantic relationship can be a challenge.

My hand in the administration is not as extensive as you think, although I do have actual as well as symbolic powers in the league. Not to say that this work is trivial, as it is part of my responsibility to ensure the smooth operation of the Sinnoh League.

Being the League Champion does come with the responsibility of overseeing the operation of the Pokémon League, as well as all that entails. Although, much of the wide-reaching decisions are outside of my control.
And this crew of yours, you must have had a lot of prior experience with them, yes? You trust them with all your life, and you know that they would never betray you for anything in the world?

I would suppose that you've been with this crew of years for a long time, and each of you have had quite a lot of adventures together, to the point that you can fully place your life in their hands without hesitation...
Slow and steady wins the race, after all! Would it be effective if it's not quite the big reveal everyone is eagerly waiting for?
Well, there's no reason for me to hurry with this strip, is there? Although, there's an additional layer under these that others might not have expected.

I didn't throw that round on purpose, but I was taking different card exchange strategies just to see which ones work and which doesn't. Whatever I did that round, it evidently isn't an optimal strategy.

It's not that I intentionally tried to lose, but you can say that I was trying some suboptimal strategies, in an effort to figure out an optimal one. As you see, the one I used this round was particularly costly.
I suppose a friendly rivalry wouldn't do much harm, even if it's a bit of a contradictory statement. I do wonder, have you had a friendly rival in the past?
I would presume you're proposing a friendly rivalry, hmm? Would it be unreasonable of me to assume that you have prior experience when it comes to friendly rivalries?
Not a rival per se, but I wouldn't turn down an opportunity to battle with Lance. It takes a lot of skill to be able to be the League Champion of two regions.
Among the list of people that I would like to engage in a battle, Lance would at the top. He must be a one-of-a-kind trainer to be able to remain League Champion of two regions simultaneously.

Hmm, I've never thought of an answer myself... I suppose Grimsley would be a good choice. I would expect he would quite the formidable strip poker player. If anything, this game has lower stakes than his usual games.
That's a tricky question... but I would have to pick Grimsley. Aside from his skill with cards, it would be quite easy for him to maintain his composure, given the lack of money in this game.

Now that you pointed it out, the female gym leaders back in Sinnoh do wear some climate-inappropriate clothing. Gardenia for example, her robe doesn't even cover her abdomen. I can't imagine wearing anything that revealing.

I've never realized before, but you do have a point in regards to some gym leaders, May. I've always found it odd that Candice, who lives in the coldest region in Sinnoh, wears a miniskirt that exposes her thighs. My thighs and legs would freeze if I leave them exposed like she does.
It would foolish of me to not make my underwear look respectable, given the nature of this game. What exactly do you look for in underwear?
That should be a given, doesn't it, with this being a strip poker game... Since you have the discerning tastes of a coordinator, what would you say is your criteria for good underwear?

Well, if I'm going to wear underwear for someone special, then I would have worn something more flashier than this. My current underwear is looking somewhat plain, for a lack of better term. It's not wet though, I can say as much...

Don't you think my current underwear is a bit lackadaisical for a hypothetical scenario like that? Not that I would wear something completely vulgar, mind you, but it could be... more eye-catching. Well, at least it's dry for now...

Well, it's like this feeling, where I'm hoping that a particular someone will be impressed by my display. Normally, I would expect such validation from a man... but for some reason, I want to seek your approval, May.

It's this warm tingly sensation, a strong desire to impress a particular person. Like it is my utmost mission to gain validation. I've felt this towards a handful of men before, but never a woman... and I feel it towards you, May.

Being in a relationship, let alone with another woman, would already be a first for me. We should start with that date you proposed earlier, and see where it goes from here. I know of a diner not far from here that we can go to after this game.

That date we discussed earlier would be another first for me, and not just because it's with another woman. I'm strongly looking forward to it, so much so that I think we should go straight to the nearby diner and get on with it as soon as we're done here.
Truth be told, the significance of the pearl on Palkia's chest has not been adequately explained. But then again, Legendary Pokémon in general can be a bit difficult to comprehend.
It's one of those things that would remain a mystery I suppose, as not a single one of the manuscripts I've read even attempted to explain the presence of that shining pearl.
Well, I have plenty of scarves, so I can afford to give you one. But, you have to give me one of your items in return. Fair is fair, after all!
I wouldn't mind giving you one of my scarves, but under that logic, wouldn't that mean that I would receive one of your items in return?

It was against Arcade Star Dahlia, the Frontier Brain of the Battle Arcade. She said she wanted a different type of gamble, and somehow came to the conclusion that a strip Pokémon battle would be a good idea.
Speaking of exciting... You're not getting too excited about this, are you? Not that I mind, but I was just curious...
Indeed, an intense battle can really excite you, but not quite the same way this game might. Would you say that's the case for you?
I don't think putting ~player~ on the spot like that is particularly nice... Although, if you want to remain in the direction, perhaps I can instead kiss... you?

I find your intentions and ethics to be rather questionable, Orendi... but very well, if you're really curious about how you can make your Pokémon stronger and learn more moves, then I suppose it wouldn't hurt if I give the details. You see, there are several types of Pokémon, and their types play a huge role in determining the moves that they can learn. Of course, this doesn't mean that Pokémon of the same types will have the same move set, but instead they will have the same pool of moves that they can learn. And another point I must make is that an individual Pokémon species can have its own unique move sets, and learning those will require familiarity with the Pokémon in particular. Anyhow, teaching a Pokémon a new move requires a lot of practice and repetition. A Pokémon instinctively knows there moves, but it is quite unrefined, which is why repetitions are so pivotal. Although, in the context of you, which in this case are Valresi punching each other, that would be rather easy to teach them, don't you think? I'm not familiar with how Valresi can adapt to teaching, but I would suppose the bigger obstacle would be taming them in the first place. And then after that, you would have to take into account their injuries. Pokémon centers are adept at healing Pokémon injured in battles, but I don't know if the same can be performed for the Valresi. Hmm... quite intriguing indeed. Anyway, I suppose that covers all the basics... Oh! I forgot another thing: when a Pokémon evolves, they usually have a different move set than that of their previous form... Come to think of it, that might not be applicable in your case... Anyway, that's all I have to say on the topic. I hope I was quite clear on the subject matter. Do you have any questions, Orendi?

I have a rather ominous feeling as to your goals with this knowledge, but I suppose keeping you informed will not hurt, Orendi. As for your question, how does a Pokémon learn a new move? Well, one thing that will always make your Pokémon - and people in general - better at a certain skill is training. You see, you don't just get good at a certain skill right of the bat. You have to train hard to master it. Not only does it help you develop your muscle memory, but it also makes you physically stronger overall, which in turn makes you better at performing said task. You see how it's all a cycle? Anyway, one of the ways a Pokémon can master their skill is by participating in battle. It all makes sense, doesn't it? The more often you use a move in a meaningful environment, the better it will get. Of course, one downside of battling all the time is that your Pokémon is more likely to get injured, so battling might be the most effective way of gaining a skill, but it's not the only option. Another option you have is to spar with another trainer. Of course, you would ask abut the difference between sparring and battling. Well, in battling, the goal is to make your opponent faint. In sparring, you are using controlled moves; controlled in such a way that you don't do damage to the other Pokémon, but you are still using the move. See how it ties up to what I said earlier about training? Anyway, your Pokémon get better with the skill being practiced, and the other Pokémon is also getting stronger because it is "defending" against your attacks. You're mutually benefiting from this setup. Of course, this is not as effective as being in actual battles, but the effect is pretty noticeable. And then, you can choose the third option: obtaining a Z-ring. You can easily find a Z-ring in the Alola region, or so I've been told, and wielding a Z-ring gives your Pokémon a powerful move tied in with the Z-ring. But that's quite the easy way out, isn't it? Anyway, that concludes my lecture. Did you catch all of that, Orendi, or do you want me to repeat it all over again?

Garchomp is living its life as it has always have: Without a single fucking clue what's going on.
Garchomp can sense excitement in the air. She wonders if everyone in this table are her future victims.
Garchomp is thinking of ruining ~player~'s hopes and dreams.
Garchomp is just happy to be here.
Garchomp wonders if one of these nice people would give her treats. She'd love a poffin.
Garchomp ate a berry she found the other day, and it made her vomit. Garchomp doesn't like berries anymore.
Garchomp can't tell why, but she thinks Cynthia looks sus.
Garchomp realized that Cynthia looks different from usual. She wonders if this is because Cynthia hasn't bred yet.
Something looks slightly off about Cynthia today, but Garchomp can't quite figure out why... Did Cynthia change her hair?
Garchomp notices that Cynthia would cry herself to sleep every night. She wonders if it's the human mating call. Either away, Cynthia hasn't been successful in finding a mate.
Garchomp hopes that Cynthia will take her to battle soon. It's been so long since she last ruined a trainer's hopes and dreams.
Garchomp feels tall compared to ~player~. She wonders if ~player~ is an unevolved human.

Garchomp doesn't understand why everyone is excited every time Cynthia touches her clothes, or why everyone is disappointed every time she appears. Must be one of those human things Garchomp doesn't understand.
Garchomp wonders why she's never seen a human egg before. Maybe they're small and hard to see? She sees small, unevolved human all the time, so she thinks they must be coming from somewhere.
Garchomp once saw Cynthia break two Pokémon eggs, and turn them into an omelet. She is afraid Cynthia will do the same when she lays an egg.
Garchomp had a dream where she and all other Pokémon were trainers, and all the humans were doing the battling. Garchomp hopes that one day, her dream will become reality.

Cynthia brought Garchomp to a Pokémon contest, and she could see all the participating Pokémon were dressed up. Garchomp thinks a ribbon would look good on her, but doesn't know how to ask Cynthia for one.
Garchomp realized the other day that she's blue. Da ba dee da ba di Da ba dee da ba di Da ba dee da ba di
Garchomp once saw a Lillipup being carried on a stroller, and she wishes that Cynthia would let her ride a stroller as well.
Garchomp remembers getting in trouble once for flying in formation with an airplane. She doesn't understand why she's not allowed to fly in formation, but Swanna are allowed to.
Garchomp got scolded once by Cynthia for marking her territory.
Garchomp saw a Sharpedo once, and they had a very striking personality. Garchomp wonders if she was destined to live in the oceans with Sharpedo.
Garchomp has absolutely no idea what's going on, but she's glad that Cynthia is finally getting rid of her tacky clothes.
Garchomp would like to roll in mud, but that would usually mean that Cynthia would take her to the Pokémon Center nurse. After consideration, Garchomp doesn't want to roll in mud anymore.
Not to mention that the goal isn't to kill the losing Pokémon, but merely knock them out. Having a Pokémon die in an organized battle would create a scandal.

This is my favorite sex story from any ancient manuscripts I've read. I must warn all of you that the language is quite coarse and vulgar, but this game is vulgar anyway, so I suppose there's no need to tone down the language. Anyhow, here it goes: "
I will sodomize you and face-fuck you,
cocksucker Aurelius and bottom bitch Furius,
who think, from my little verses,
because they're a little soft, that I have no shame.
For it is right for the devoted poet to be chaste
himself, but it's not necessary for his verses to be so.
Verses which then indeed have taste and charm,
If they are delicate and have no shame,
And because they can incite an itch,
And I don't mean in boys, but in
Those hairy men who can't move their loins.
You, because about my many thousands of kisses
You've read, you think me less of a man?
I will sodomize you and face-fuck you."

There are people who have had sex with Pokémon, but they are sexual deviants! Nobody in their right mind would even think of doing such a thing!

Oh, I didn't mean it like that! We... we were sharing beds after a long trip and we weren't fooling around in bed or anything... We just slept next to each other...
Oh, sorry about the outburst back there. As for your question, I don't have a child. I haven't even done that yet with a man...
Would you mind if I continue? Anyway, my first battle was with Gible. Every battle I've had, she was part of my party. She made Garchomp a popular Pokémon among Sinnohlians.

To elaborate on that, when this world was made, Dialga and Palkia appeared. Apparently, there was one more Pokémon that appeared at the same time. A Pokémon with as much power as Dialga and Palkia... But also one whose name was never to be spoken--Giratina! It's said to lurk in another world... A world on the opposite side of ours...It's said that in the Distortion World, neither time nor space were stable. I think that tells us something about Giratina, the only Pokémon there. It must have been as powerful as Dialga and Palkia, the rulers of time and space. In some way, though, Giratina has to have a power opposite of theirs. I'm sorry this is so long. May I say one last bit? Dialga's Roar of Time...Palkia's Spacial Rend...To the people back then, those Pokémon really must have appeared to rule over time and space. Seeing them must have shaken the people to their very core. Those feelings of awe, wonder, and everything else. It passed that memory to countless people, eventually becoming a myth...That's what I believe as a researcher of myths. I think I let myself get carried away and talked for far too long. I'm sorry, and thank you.

Perhaps Hex Maniacs aren't the only group with a deep interest with the Arcane Arts... Your captain might have been a member of another Arcana-centric religion.

Even after all these years, the sights and sounds of riding on the back of my Garchomp is still mesmerizing. There's simply nothing quite like it.

It's not really a fight per se, it's more like a sparring session, Meia. The goal isn't to kill or permanently injure an opponent, but rather weaken them to submission. This type of battles actually does make both combatants stronger in the long-term.

I'm assuming that you think I was referring to a fight to the death, which isn't the case. You're no suppose to maim, disfigure, or permanently injure an opposing Pokémon, you only have to make them too weak to fight. Injuries are usually minor.
Ah, so they are corporeal deities then. Interesting that these deities can have children with each other, very much unlike the Sinnohlian creation trio.

Love and chaos, two seemingly contradicting forces, but commonly intertwined by many religions. What does that say about human nature when the two are often considered inseparable?
A beauty with a cruel side. Love combined with trickery. Generation accompanied by discord. Common themes among not just history, but human nature itself. That says a lot, really.

I always say that a Pokémon trainer is only as strong as their bonds with their Pokémon, and in the case of my Garchomp, I had taken care of her for her entire life. Nothing can overcome a bond that's as strong as chains.

There were artifacts called plates that are scattered all over Sinnoh. One of them said "Two beings of time and space set free from the Original One". Then I realized - our interpretation had been incorrect all along.

... Has it really been that long since I became the Sinnoh League Champion? It almost... almost makes me feel old...

If Arceus wanted you to be miserable and remorseful, then leaving you no memories surely achieved the goal. Not only did it detach you from your past as a human, it also left you with nothing to return to, nobody to ask for help, and no joy in life.
Ah, thank Arceus you're back! I was worried sick that I had scared you away. I got a bit carried away. I should have known you didn't see me that way.
Oh, Dawn, you're back! I was beginning to think that you would never want to see me again. I should have kept my attraction to you a secret. That was an error of judgment on my part.
If you reclaim land from the beaches and ocean, that would harm not just Pokemon, but also the fishing and tourism industry. Have you ever thought of the harm that would do?
You might treat aquatic Pokémon with callous disregard, but what about the millions of people that live off the ocean? You can't just ignore the suffering this would cause them.
Anyway, what's your planned method of performing land reclamation? Simply using fire-type moves into the ocean isn't going to cut it in the long term.
Since you seem very certain of this plan, I would presume you have an idea of how your team would go about executing your plan. The world's ocean is quite vast, too vast to get rid of.
Returning to this Team Magma, I can clearly see you're not one for thinking or planning ahead, but then again, the fact that you're an unnamed grunt should have given it away.
Seeing that you're nothing more than an unnamed grunt, I'm not at all surprised that you're not being kept up to speed with your Team's dealings and plans.
Come to think of it, there is a fundamental flaw with your plan: You don't simply control a Legendary Pokemon like you would any other Pokemon. Otherwise, someone would have captured it by now.
Have you considered that a Legendary Pokémon powerful enough to destroy the ocean would be too powerful to handle for Team Magma? That seems like quite the fatal flaw in your plan.
Team Magma doesn't seem like an organization worth sacrificing your life for, Magma Grunt. Are you really sure you want to remain committed to their goals?
From what I've gathered from you so far, this amounts to a suicidal mission for Team Magma... Do you really want to go on with this, even if you know it would be a futile effort?

Seeing as your juvenile mind couldn't be changed, and your organization's activity is outright destructive, I ought to warn Steven Stone immediately. Proper precautions must be prepared for this event.
Given your organization's intentions, and your refusal to be discouraged otherwise, the only thing I can do is to warn the Hoenn League Champion, Steven Stone, about your group's impending actions.
This is a very atypical place to be performing a prayer service, but I think I could learn a little bit about your religion by analyzing the text of your prayer. Oh, please do start...
On one hand, this does not seem to be the proper context to be performing a prayer, on the other hand, this could serve as my introduction to your religion...
I heard that you work in the research of power generation, ~heris~, but I was wondering what power source in particular you are using. Back home in Sinnoh, power is generated using wind energy.

I remember that Sinnoh had a wind-works power plant that provided power to majority of the Sinnoh region. I'm curious as to what power source is the focus of your research on power generation, ~heris~

I've always been intrigued by the origins of the kitsune, since folklore tends to be contradictory. I take it that you're a Braixen that failed to evolve into a Delphox, and gained supernatural powers after living for centuries.

Writing and oral traditions regarding the kitsune has always been a bit difficult to decipher. But from what I've gathered, you are, or were, a centuries-old Braixen, hmm? Didn't evolve into Delphox, so you gained supernatural powers instead.
Well, it doesn't take much analysis to realize that you're a rock band member, Critical Darling. I do wonder, do you happen to know Roxie, from Virbank City?
That's pretty much what I always imagine rock stars to dress like, Critical Darling. I must say, you remind me of Roxie, in terms of appearance and enthusiasm.
Have you been to many places, Jim? You look like you've traveled quite a bit.
I've gotten the impression that you've done a fair bit of traveling in the past, Jim. I'm interested in knowing what sort of places you've been to?
You're a painter despite not having any arms, Rin? That's quite impressive! Just the mental fortitude required to overcome such a disability is outstanding!
Is it true that your hobby is painting despite your distinctive lack of arms? That's one of the most impressive feats of perseverance I've heard!
Do you really think your government has put up surveillance in this place, Nami? Would they really go to such length just to eavesdrop on people?
You're suspicious that your government might have sent one of their personnel undercover in this place, Nami? Is that something they're known to do?
Is there someone in particular in here that you suspect as being a spy, Nami, or is it just a general suspicion?
Hmm, I didn't expect to meet a Hex Maniac in a game like this. I've heard that they can be quite antisocial, but you're quite bubbly and sociable.
Well, what a pleasant surprise. It's been quite a while since I've met a Hex Maniac, but I can definitely tell you're one of them, Akko. Though, you're quite energetic for one.
What an interesting outfit. It does looks like the type of outfit that would be common three centuries ago. Is that what it's supposed to be, Sayaka?
Sayaka, your outfit looks similar to one of our outfit pieces in the historical research center back home. I don't suppose that was your intention though - wearing old-school clothing.
Hmm, you're the silent, intelligent type, aren't you? Oh, forgive me for taking assumptions about your personality, Komi, but that was the first impression I got.
I'm trying to judge your personality, Komi, and I'm getting the feeling that you're quite intelligent despite your silent demeanor.
Come on, N, you should really know what you're getting yourself into...
What, you didn't read the rules, N? That's on you, N; you need to be prepared!
Guzma... You may be familiar with Team Galactic from Sinnoh; they've attempted to destroy the universe... If your Team Skull is in any way similar, know that I won't hold back.
I hope you'll excuse my alertness, Guzma; Team Galactic has taught me that I cannot become complacent when criminals organize...
Guzma, if you're to expect any restraint from me, you must be clear what your involvement with Team Skull is; what are your plans?
But of course, Chazz, I didn't expect these mythology lessons to be one-sided! I'll tell you all about the creation of our universe, as known throughout Sinnoh.
Come on, Chazz, I'm very interested in hearing about the mythology of Duel Monsters! I'll even tell you about Sinnoh's mythology... Might that be a trade?
Now, after Arceus, we start getting into the creation of the physical world as we know it; you might want to listen up.
Now that the physical world has been created through Arceus, Dialga, and Palkia, we start getting into the metaphysical.
Now that the physical world has been created through Arceus, Dialga, and Palkia, we still don't have any emotions, or characteristics!
You got off lucky these last few rounds, Catria; there's still a game underfoot!
You got off lucky these last few rounds, Catria; there's still a game underfoot, and I intend to win!
From what I've gathered so far, you've been to space, Meia. My grandma always told me how much of an enormous achievement it was when humans first traveled to space, and the moon.
I didn't think I'd meet a space traveler in a game like this. People from the older generations, mostly my grandma, would often compare ancient historical events to the first spaceflight.
Come to think of it, I don't think I've read much about female space travelers. But then again, I haven't read much about space travelers in general...
How many women have traveled to space anyway? I have heard of men traveling to space, but I can't recall much about women doing the same...
Did you say that you're a space traveler? Your outfit is more fitting for a model, as it looks nothing like a spacesuit at all. Were you just joking?
At first glance, I would say that you're a runway model, but you claimed to be a space traveler? You look nothing like the part.
What is it exactly that you do in space, Meia? Leading a space colony? A test pilot for experimental spaceships?
You're one angry woman, aren't you, Revy? You really needed this game for relaxation, I would say. I hope you enjoy this game.
Well, someone here needed a relaxing game of strip poker more than anyone else. Playing a casual game is always the best way of cooling your head.
Come to think of it, your appearance reminds me of a young trainer I battled once. You could almost pass off as her older sister.
The last time I met someone with that outfit scheme was a young trainer I battled in my villa years ago. You're the perfect age to be mistaken for her older sister.
Just one look at you tells me that you're an athletic type, Rainbow Dash. Even in this game, you just can't stop doing calisthenics.
I'm quite good at determining other people's personalities just by looking at them, and I could immediately tell that you love exercise. Not that you made it difficult to figure out.
Do you happen to know martial arts, Rainbow Dash?
Would I be incorrect if I guessed that you train in the martial arts, Rainbow Dash?
What happens now? I don't suppose this Shiny Butterfree can strip anything unless... it molts its entire exoskeleton...
What's the protocol for when a participant has nothing to strip to begin with? Does having this Butterfree switch to it's Mega Forme count?
What a small girl you are, Chihiro. You almost remind me of Shauntal, although she's more of a creative type than an intelligent type like you.
Small, shy, demure, and very cerebral. You almost remind me of Shauntal, Chihiro. The only difference between you two is the color scheme, and the fact that she's a writer instead.
I've been wondering, Chihiro, if you can create a better version of the Pokédex. I mean, there's nothing wrong with the current versions, but there's room for improvement.
Do you happen to be familiar with the inner workings of the Pokédex, Chihiro. I've heard that they've been looking for programmers who could help create an upgraded version.
(Chihiro is panicking. I should comfort her.) It's alright, Chihiro, you have nothing to fear. We're not going to judge you even if you are naked in front of us.
(The fear in Chihiro's eyes... I must calm her down.) You can do it, Chihiro. You have nothing to worry about, my dear. This will be everybody's little secret.
You're finally back, Chihiro. I was worried that we'll never see you again. I'm not forcing you, but it would be great if you can continue the game.
Good job, Chihiro. You might have ran away, but I bet it took all of your courage to return here. Your bravery has to be commended.
Oh, you came back, Chihiro. I was worried that we would have to play the rest of the game with Alter Ego. Anyhow, you can finally resume the game.
What an uncanny resemblance... It's surprising to meet another person who has intense eyes like that Pokémon Trainer. I can see a lot of hidden power in that small frame.
Well, I had initially written you off due to your appearance, Megumin, but I can feel a strong aura coming from your eyes. You are not someone to be underestimated.
I must say, I've never seen someone extract so much power using a pure fire-type specialization. Not even Sinnoh's fire-type specialist had much use for fire-types.
It's not everyday I see someone look so formidable with only fire powers at their disposal. Powerful fire-specialist are quite rare, especially at Sinnoh.
Surely, someone with such an immense power would have uses for said power, Megumin. I'm curious to know what you use your fire magic for.
I wonder what you use your explosion magic for, Megumin. You can't be that powerful and not use it, right? That would be a waste of your abilities.
You wouldn't happen to be selling some antiques, Anna? Any artifact really, as long as it's old.
I've been wondering if you're involved in the antiquities trade, Anna. With such a large inventory of items, you might have one or two artifacts lying around.
Do you have some artifacts available for sale, Anna? Be it a small trinket, or an enormous relic; a insignificant bauble, or a historically-significant object.
Have you traveled across nations, Anna? I have a couple of questions for you, related to my study about trade across different cultures.
Surely, a traveling merchant such as yourself would have been to multiple regions, Anna. I just have something to ask to you, as part of my socioeconomic research.
I've been studying a lot lately about the cultural influence of trading merchants across nations, and I would like to ask you some questions. If you had traveled internationally, that is,
Since you're already here, why exactly did you become a pirate, Meia? Was it the promise of vast riches across the galaxy?
I'm just curious what possessed you to become a pirate in the first place, Meia. Was it the thrill of going on intergalactic adventures that hooked you in?
From what little I've known from historical pirates, most of them came from oppressed groups, and joined a life of piracy in search of freedom. Are you the same case, Meia?
So what is it exactly that you do, Revy? Aside from hanging out on streets and threatening people.
Surely, even someone like you have a job of some sort. I can't quite figure out what it could be, given your violent and unlikeable demeanor.
Hmm, are you a Hex Maniac, Tomoko? Your appearance and mannerisms suggest so, but that's not their outfit you're wearing.
It's not in the nature of a Hex Maniac to wear an outfit aside from their usual robes, so I'm beginning to doubt if you are one of them, Tomoko.
Normally, a Hex Maniac would be wearing their class's robes, and that's not quite it, despite the similarity in appearances. You do have their distinct idiosyncrasies...
You did mention a planet full of men earlier, didn't you? Have you tried living there instead, Meia? It might be better than wandering through space.
If you no longer feel welcome on your home planet, then perhaps moving to the men's planet would be the correct decision, Meia. I don't think it can be worse than cruising aimlessly in space.
Have you ever considered moving permanently onto the male planet, Meia? It won't be as claustrophobic as being in a spaceship all the time.
My, so much energy in such a small frame. Reminds me of Maylene somehow, although your voice is much higher-pitched, and you look even younger.
The last time I've met a small girl with that much energy is Maylene back in Sinnoh. But you're even smaller than her, and you're voice is more nasally as well.
Your speech pattern is most unusual, Starfire. Would I be correct in saying that you're not a native speaker?
Your way of speaking is very reminiscent of someone speaking a non-native language. Is my observation correct, Starfire?
I've heard that you're a famous singer. That must be quite the busy schedule that you have, having to travel extensively around the world.
I imagine that the travel schedule of a famous singer such as yourself must be very extensive. Having to maximize what little free time you have can be quite challenging, I would imagine.
I must say, your outfit has quite the professional feel to it, and combined with your apparent lack of sleep... Why, you must be an academic, Tomoko!
Despite your disheveled and sleep-deprived appearance, you do have an aura of professionalism emanating from you, Tomoko... You could only be an academic! Your outfit even fits the style of one.
That's quite an impressive costume you're wearing, Arash. It almost looks like a real suit of armor. The detailing on it is just exquisite.
That must have been quite an expensive costume you're wearing, Arash. The attention to detail of it points to an advanced level of craftsmanship.
Oh my, what an unbelievably large syringe. I don't think even the most high-class of Pokémon Centers have a syringe of that size.
Look at the size of that syringe! I bet even the Pokémon Centers would be hard-pressed to find a syringe of that size.
Oh, I never thought I'd meet someone dressed as a 6th century crown prince. I always felt that period to be one of the most under-appreciated.
A 6th century nobleman costume... It's rare for me to meet someone who's also interested in that era. It's criminal how much that period is ignored.
Was your kingdom tolerant of homosexual relationships, Miko? Based on your relationship with your wife, I'm inclined to guess yes.

I've learned that homosexual relationships were prevalent in your time period, but not unanimously accepted among all cultures at the time. I was wondering what your kingdom's stance on the issue was, Miko.
What an intriguing outfit. It reminds me of the Galarian and Kalosian outfits worn by common people from the days of old. It's surprising seeing one in the present day.
Your attire has certainly caught my attention, Kazuma. I've seen those before, but in museums, being the common folk's attire centuries ago in regions like Galar and Kalos.
You're from an all-female planet, correct? Is that the reason why you're quite desperate to be with a man?... The thrill of something new...
If it's true that you're from a planet with no men... Is that where your obsession with men originate from? You view men as being exotic, and want one for yourself...?
I heard you mention that you were training to be a Pokémon doctor, Maki. Let me guess: your Pokémon are psychic-type and bug-types. Is my assumption correct?
It's not often I meet Pokémon doctoral student, Maki. I do appreciate the Full Restores doctors give me when I defeat them in battle. I do wonder if you'll do the same for this game...
Ah, a Pokémon doctor! Or rather, a trainee. Either way, my Pokémon are currently in well-condition, but I do appreciate it if you can lend me a couple of Max Revives, as a gift perhaps?
Oh, I remember you! You're that trainer that I fought in the Alola Battle Tree! Long time no see, Moon!
You look familiar... Wait, I battled you in Alola, didn't I?... My memory isn't deceiving me, you're the same Moon. Nice to meet you! I didn't expect to come across you in a place like this.
Wait, are you the same Moon I encountered in Alola?... You are! I haven't seen you since our battle, and you're quite a long way from home, I must say.
Last I heard, you competed to be the inaugural Alola League Champion, Moon. How did your venture go?
According to the grapevine, you were training to compete for the newly created Alola League, Moon. Did you happen to succeed?
Before I left Alola, someone told me that you had signed up for the Alola League, Moon. Since you proved to be a strong trainer, I'm wondering if you won.
Hold on just a minute! I saw you... emerge from a portal! You don't originate from the Distortion World, do you?
Did my eyes deceive me, or did you hop out of a portal from nowhere?! It's not the Distortion World on the other end of that portal, was it?
My, what a jarringly violet color palette! You must be a ghost-type trainer, Neptune. Why do ghost-types always wear purple?
I know a ghost-type trainer when I see one. It's not difficult, when almost all ghost-type trainers have a fashion sense dominated by violet.
Ah! I know that outfit. That's a traditional Unovan outfit, specifically from --
I think I've seen a similar outfit to yours in Unova before... Yes, I remember that from --
Aimee, do me a favor and... What are you shooting vertically for?! There's only one way those bullets would fall!
Now, let's put the gun down... What are you doing?! Those bullets can't stay in the air forever!
That's even worse! How do you even know where that thing is pointed at?!
Are you deliberately trying to make your stunts more reckless than the last?!
I've never seen such complete disregard for public safety!
Shooting upwards again? At least you're the only one who might get hit if you misaim...
... This again? I hope you've got the measure of this the second time around...
You're not actually planning to shoot your underwear, are you? It's barely more than a string!
This is an impossible task you're planning... Surely, hitting a target that small is not a realistic expectation, even for you...
I've got a random question for you, ~supernova~: If you were to recreate the universe in your own image, how would you go about doing it?
Are you knowledgeable about the universe's creation, ~supernova~? What would you say is your preferred method of creating your own universe?
When you say that you're a goddess, Neptune, do you mean that you're worshiped by an imperial cult? I thought that practice had largely died out by this point in history.
A monarch deified by an imperial cult... Does that describes your situation accurately, Neptune? And here I thought that practice had largely died out centuries ago...

I can tell immediately from your accent that you're Kalosian, Ladybug. Say, is that a ceremonial outfit you're currently wearing? I'm afraid I'm not that familiar with Kalosian culture compared with the other regions.

Hmm, is that the Kalosian accent I hear from your voice, Ladybug? I also can't recognize your outfit, be it due to its peculiarity of it or my unfamiliarity with most of the culture from the Kalos region.

I can't say that I expected to meet a native of Kalos in this setting, Ladybug. You're a long way away from home, aren't you? Although, I'm more intrigued by your unusual outfit. It's unlike anything I've ever seen!
Huh? Are you... one of those Kalosian exotic performers I keep hearing about? What is going on here...?
Are you... an exotic performer from Kalos? You sure do have the accent of a Kalosian... I just... didn't expect to run across one in here...
Is that... a military uniform... composed of a leotard?... I'm guessing you must be a member of the navy. That's the only logical explanation I could come up with.
Your leotard made me think that you were wearing a swimsuit... but you seem to be wearing adornments more fitting for a military uniform. That doesn't happen to be the uniform of the navy, does it?
Your outfit is strangely... familiar for some reason... I think I might have seen some foreign tourists wearing similar clothing to yours... Have you been to Sinnoh before, Chun-Li?
I'm getting a strange feeling about your outfit, Chun-Li... As if I've seen it before... Perhaps I might have seen it worn by tourists before...? Anyway, have you visited Sinnoh in the past?
Oh my! What big ears you have, Erufuda! Is that a physical deformity caused by excessive cholesterol intake?
Those ears! Why do they look like that? Are those the physical manifestation of an unhealthy diet?
You called yourself a "Pegasus Knight", correct? What exactly is "Pegasus"? Is it the name of your founder, or does the name of your order have a deeper etymology?
I've heard you refer to yourself as a "Pegasus Knight", Florina, but I was curious where your order derived its name from? What exactly does "Pegasus" refer to?
You're one of those "social recluse" I keep hearing about, Futaba? I've always been intrigued as to why someone would voluntary withdraw themselves from society.
Aren't you one of those... what was it called... a "shut-in", Futaba? I'm interested in knowing why you chose to keep yourself cooped up indoors when the outside world is full of wonders to explore.

I keep hearing about people who suffer from "Acute Social Withdrawal", but I didn't get to meet one personally until now... Are there any practical reason you've completely withdrawn yourself from society, Futaba?
Ah, I know a noblewoman when I see one, Miss Haru. Despite your rather modest outfit, your aura shines right through it.
Other people might not have picked this up, but I can tell that you're of a upper-class upbringing, Miss Haru. It will take more than a sweater to hide that fact.

It takes more than just flashy upbringing to differentiate a noble person and a commoner, and I can easily tell you're the former, Miss Haru. Although, I don't blame you for attempting to mask it in this setting,
I seem to recall you mentioning earlier that you're a student of parapsychology, Ini... I have a lot of questions regarding psychics that I hope you would be able to answer, if you don't mind.

Parapsychology, from what I can recall, is the study of psychic powers, correct? You might be only a student of this field, but I'm intrigued if you would be willing to answer some questions regarding psychic powers.

Would you be willing to answer some of my queries regarding psychic powers, Ini? You said earlier that you're a student of the field that investigates these phenomena, and I feel that you can clear the air for me.

You referred to yourself as an AI earlier, Kizuna... I assume you meant Artificial Intelligence... Are you a realistic looking cyborg? You seem very human, aside from making comments to nobody in particular, and the unusual glow.

Are you really an Artificial Intelligence, Kizuna, or were you just bluffing? Either way, you're very human in terms of appearance and action. Your only flaws is that you're talking to an unseen listener, and you're glowing.

You're supposed to be an Artificial Intelligence, Kizuna? If that's the case, then you're certainly leaps ahead of the other robots I've seen. Although, you're not without flaws, mostly concerning your speech output, and bioluminescence.

Ah, a priestess, and one who is very eager in proselytizing as well! Hearing about your religion's creation story would be of paramount importance to my research, and I urge you to be as detailed as you can.

You might not know it, but you're exactly the type of person I'm seeking for! If there's anyone who would be knowledgeable about a religion's creation story, it would be a devout priestess! Please, do tell all the details.

After historians, I would expect a member of the clergy to be the most reliable source when it comes to the creation story of a religion. I'm currently embroiled in a study of creation stories, and I would very much appreciate it if you share yours.
I'm getting a weird feeling from you, Mae... As if you're just a Meowth that got transplanted into a human body... Perhaps, it's because you have similar idiosyncrasies...
Not to be rude or anything, Mae... but I'm getting a peculiar feeling... as if you're just a Meowth disguised as a human... I suppose it's because your mannerisms remind me of a Meowth...

Are you the housekeeper of this establishment, Nugi-chan? I know better than to underestimate anyone in a maid outfit. I've battled my fair share of maids, and they're usually more ferocious than they let on.

Ah, an innocent-looking maid, aren't you, Nugi-chan? I've met plenty of maids that are as demure as you are during my battles, and let me tell you, there's always more than meets the eye when battling them.
