I bet everyone in here thinks that you're just an unassuming, little maid, but I know better than to judge someone by their looks. If my battles against them has taught me anything, it's that maids can go from 0 to 100 in the blink of an eye.
Pardon me if this might sound a bit rude, but what exactly are you, Orendi? You somewhat look like a Cofagrigus that has gained a human form.
Are you a human, or a Cofagrigus in human form?! I can tell which is the correct case for you, Orendi?
Ah, a Kalosian! I'm not too familiar with your culture, so your outfit is a bit... confusing for me. Anyway, I was curious what "PA-15" stood for, Florence.
Two things caught my attention immediately, Florence. Firstly, that outfit is quite unlike anything I've seen. Secondly, I was wondering if "PA-15" has any significance.
I'm not sure if I should ask the meaning of "PA-15", or ask the design logic of your outfit... Oh, it seems I was thinking out loud again! Anyway, I'm genuinely curious about those two.
I've got a bit of a personal question for you, ~supernova~. If you were given the chance of moving to a world completely devoid of emotions and hope, would you take the opportunity?
This might be a random thing to ask, but if you had to choose between this universe, and another universe where emotions don't exist, which one would you choose?
A masked man wielding a large sword... How terribly suspicious... (I should get Garchomp ready just in case.)
Well, that's as suspicious of a sight as we're going to get in a setting like this... (Garchomp should be more than enough to take care of this suspicious man.)
What a marvelous outfit, Palutena! You look a lot like those ancient goddess sculptures from two millennia ago. You even had the golden leaf headpiece to go along with it.
My, you certainly stand out like a goddess, Palutena. Specifically, the goddesses of a certain pantheon that was predominant more than two thousand years ago. Nice attention to detail, I must say.
I'm not sure if you intended it or not, but your outfit look very similar to those of goddesses that were worshiped dozens of centuries ago. You have the stature to compliment the outfit as well.
I cannot believe the vulgarity and perverseness that has come out of your mouth so far, Panty! There is no doubt in my mind that you're nowhere near to being an angel!
In the couple of minutes that we've been playing this game, you've said things that I've never heard before, and don't want to hear again, Panty. A real angel would never say any of those things.
I can immediately tell you're a boxer, Ribbon Girl. Say, you wouldn't happen to be a fighting-type trainer, would you?
You're a boxer, Ribbon Girl, but that wasn't difficult to guess given the gloves you're wearing... Do you happen to be a fighting-type trainer as well?
I'm confused over your background, Saki... Are you an idol, a biker, or a zombie? You seemed to insinuate that you were all three...
Based on your statement earlier... you're an idol, or a biker, or a zombie... I'm confused since you backtracked on what you said...

I remember reading about genies before... According to the manuscript I read, genies are spirits that have the same origins as humans, but got changed somehow by the surroundings. Was that accurate, Shantae?

I do remember a handful of manuscripts which describe genies. If my memory is correct, genies are identical in every way to humans, even their origins, aside from the fact that genies are powerful spirits. Was my memory accurate, Shantae?
Just from the looks of your uniform, it's evident that you belong to an upper-class family, Sola. Can you discuss what exactly is the source of your family's fortune?
You must be from a well-off family, if the appearance of your school uniform is anything to go by, Sola. What is it that your parents do?
A violent spirit?! Don't panic, ~player~, this ghost is no match for my Spiritomb. This should be a fairly quick affair.
Watch out, ~player~! This malevolent spirit is carrying a sharp knife! I've fought off this type of spirit before, and my Spiritomb will do quick work of this.
Hold on, what's this?! Stay back, ~player~! This specter looks particularly violent. Fortunately, my Spiritomb knows how to handle a situation like this.
My, I can immediately tell that you're from the Galar region just from your accent alone, Syrenne. I'd even wager that you're from Motostoke City, based on the intonation.

What an awfully distinctive accent! If I'm going to guess your place of origin, I'm betting it's Motostoke City, in the Galar Region. The local accent is just a tad bit different from the other regional Galarian accents.
Huh, what a... provocative outfit... Very reminiscent of those of... exotic dancers from... previous millennia... Wait, you're not an actual exotic dancer, are you? You just look like one...?
Funny enough, your outfit reminds me a lot of a painting of exotic dancers from the Fertile Crescent... Just a coincidence, isn't it?... You're not an exotic dancer, are you?
I'm not the type of person that comments on clothes regularly, but I must say that your dress has very regal feel to it, Weiss. It makes you look like a princess.
It's not often that I comment on clothes the first time I met a person, but I fell it would be remiss if I didn't compliment your attire, Weiss. It radiates an upper-class royalty feel.

Not to be shallow or anything, but I felt that the design of your dress is worth complimenting, Weiss. It gives off a sense prestige and wealth, which you would usually only see with members of the upper class and royalty.
... Interesting... My Pokémon in their Poké Balls are radiating a happy feeling. Are you the reason? What are you, Zizou?
... That's strange... I can feel some form of energy radiating from your direction, Zizou... And my Pokémon are responding positively to it. How could that be?
Hold on just a minute... Named after a celestial object... Talks about being the god of another world... Weird hair color... You're a member of Team Galactic, aren't you?!

... I've met a group of people who are very similar to you, Neptune: Bearing the name of a heavenly body, claims to rule another world as a god, unusual choice of hair dye... You must be a Team Galactic grunt!
You mentioned a "social interaction practice" earlier, Bernadetta. Is that something people in your culture do as part of their studies?
Is a "social interaction practice" something people of your age are expected to do where you're from, Bernadetta?

What an... intriguing choice of knife, Chara. Creepy knives aside, it looks like you have a lot of interesting stories to tell, about where you're from. Don't ask how I knew, I just had a gut feeling.
Looking past that knife with a rather concerning color, my intuition tells me that you come from an interesting place, Chara. I have a feeling that you have some intriguing tales from your homeplace.
What a remarkable outfit, Pyrrha! It reminds me a lot of the battle armor worn by the Ancient Western Empire... Hold on a minute, what is your surname, Pyrrha?
I must say, being a historian, I'm appreciating the fact that your outfit was inspired by the Ancient Western Empire, Pyrrha... Wait, Pyrrha... What did you say your surname was?
Wait, I just realized something: Your name is Pyrrha... and your outfit takes heavy influence from the Ancient Western Empire... Can you reveal what your family name is?
Would you happen to be a biker, Jim? I've heard bikers are prevalent in most regions of the world, but Sinnoh oddly doesn't have any...
I've never seen a biker before, but I would envision that they would have roughly the same attire as you, Jim, assuming you're not one of them.
Did you mention that you were part of a Fairy Tale guild, Lucy? I remember when I used to read fairy tales all the time when I was a child. It served as my first insight to cultures of the past.
You're a member of a Fairy Tale guild, Lucy? I wish Celestic town had a Fairy Tale Guild when I was a child. I probably would have attended that guild everyday.

Hey, I remember wearing an outfit like that before! It was when we were going to explore a pyramid in the middle of the Great Rainforest. I must say, having to hack through the brush and mire wasn't the most pleasant of experiences.

Planning to explore a forest in the immediate future, Jason? The last time I wore an outfit like that, it was to excavate an ancient city in the middle of the forest at the Rich Coast... That's why I don't excavate in the forests anymore.
I don't know what you're planning with that rocket launcher, but I won't hesitate to bring out my entire Pokémon team if you do anything violent with it.

A rocket launcher?! I don't know how you got that thing past security, but if you have violent intentions, the line ends here! I have my entire Pokémon team at my disposal, and they're not afraid of that thing!
What's going on here?! Doesn't matter, what matters is that I put a stop to this! Good thing I have all my Pokémon with me right now!
You mentioned earlier that you were an archmage, Yunyun. Does that mean that your psychic powers are particularly strong?
What exactly does being an archmage entail, Yunyun? Is it an indication that you've achieved a high level of mastery of your psychic powers?
How exactly does one like yourself become an archmage, Yunyun? Does a proficiency in controlling your psychic powers grant you the title of being an archmage?

I was thinking that I might have brought one too many accessories to this game, but you brought a cardboard box as your accessory! At least, I think that's what your plan with the box is, Myriam. It's meant as an extra layer, right?
A cardboard box? Is this a last-ditch attempt at increasing your layer count, Myriam? It looks a bit comical, but I suppose it serves its purpose.

I just have to... stare at amazement at how far out of the box some people will think when faced with a problem. It seems in your case, it was hiding inside the box that was your solution to increase your layer count, Myriam.
Your outfit is glorious, Laevatein! There's no other words that can adequately describe it! Is it meant to be evocative of a Toucannon?
That's an impressive outfit you're donning, Laevatein. It's very evident that a lot of time and effort went to its creation. Is it inspired by Toucannon?
It's pretty evident that you're the captain of a ship. Captain Kokichi, do you happen to know the captain of the S.S. Spiral?
I might not meet sailors often, but I can recognize one when I see one. Anyway, would you happen to be familiar with the captain of the S.S. Spiral, Captain Kokichi?
Are you a lone wanderer of sorts, Deimos? You seem to be rather beaten by your travels. Where are you from?
It seems I'm not the only one here that traveled a long way just to get here. Although, you look more like a lone wanderer than I am. From where did you travel from, Deimos?

I've noticed that you seem to be unfamiliar with the local customs, Twilight. I can say that I'm experiencing the same thing, since I arrived in this place just an hour ago. What region are you from anyway?

I'm relieved that I'm not the only non-local in this place, Twilight. Just like you, I'm also unfamiliar with the culture in this region. I arrived just over an hour ago through a flight from Sinnoh. How long have you been here, and where are you originally from?

You're quite an... excitable person, Pinkie. I don't think I was ever that energetic even when I was still a child. Do you happen to be the person in charge of bringing excitement to this game, or are you always like this?

I don't think I've ever seen anyone jump around as much as you do, Pinkie. It doesn't look like you're even breaking a sweat either. Are you being paid to bring energy here, or is this just something you normally do?

Ah, you're obviously a fashionista, Rarity. Do you happen to be well-connected in the fashion industry? I was just wondering if you happen to know the tailor that crafts the sygna suits. They seem to be the fashion rage these days.

I must say, you've got a great fashion sense, Rarity. I'm assuming you've got a lot of connections in the fashion world, so I wonder if you happen to have any info about the tailor of the sygna suits. Everybody seems to be keen on getting in contact with him.
Would you mind detailing every atrocity that ~player~ committed in your world, Chara?
Do you have any recollections of all the horrible things ~player~ did in your world, Chara?
Hmm... You mentioned earlier that you're from Muspell, Laevatein... I don't think your outfit is endemic to any of the regions I've personally visited. Where exactly is Muspell?

I seem to remember you mentioning earlier that you're a native of a region called Muspell, Laevatein. You don't quite look like a native of any of the regions I know of. Can you point out where Muspell is?
You seem to be rather interconnected with this "Hank" person, but who is he? And why are you acquainted with him?
You must be very close to this "Hank" if you're willingly putting yourself into this much trouble for his sake. Who is he anyway?
It's been often said that ghosts are the spirits of people who died with unfinished business. So, I wonder what yours was, Spooky.
There's no reason for a spirit to manifest itself as a ghost, unless it is still not ready to leave. What kind of event is preventing you from leaving the mortal realm, Spooky?
A patron of the arts, I see. What kind of arts are your favorite, Yusuke? I would say mine are the realist paintings, as it gives everybody a good glimpse of daily life.
Meeting an art enthusiast in a place like this is a bit of a welcome surprise, I must say. Are you also a fan of the Realism artistic movement, or do you consider something else as your favorite?
It must have been quite the struggle leading a revolution like that, Jim. How are things looking up now?
A revolution of that scale results in massive reforms that can take years to take hold. Have situations improved due to your revolution?
So, Yusuke, what kind of themes do you usually utilize in your paintings? I know of another artist whose art gallery are mostly themed around Bug Pokémon.
Every artist, from what I've learned, have a central theme that are visible in their body of work. What would you say is your central theme in your artworks, Yusuke?
You know, all this talk of an all-female planet reminds me of an epic, where an island inhabited solely by women was discovered by a ship crewed mostly by men...

Funny enough, this wouldn't be the first time I would have heard of an all-female society. Not a planet, but an island with no men in it, which just happened to be visited by a nearly all-male ship...
Speaking of the Ancient Western Empire, you wouldn't happen to own a spear or javelin, would you? I just remembered a statue that resembles you, and that's the only thing missing.
There's still something missing from your outfit... Oh, I know! A javelin! Add that, and you're now a foot soldier for the Ancient Western Empire! Or at least, you would look like one.
One look at you tells me a lot about you, and I can confidently say that you're an explorer of some sort. Particularly, the type to explore rainforests and such. Is my assessment correct?
It might be a little obvious of me to say, but you're outfit really does match the rainforest explorer archetype. Surely, that must be the only explanation why you were carrying a machete.
If you didn't go to school, I suppose you spent your childhood filling up your Pokédex like most enterprising children do, Jason.

I don't know if it also applies here, but in my experience, children either go to school, or they begin exploring all over their region in order to get entries for their Pokédex. I would assume you're part of the latter.
Now that your world has been rid of these monsters, what are your plans, Chara? Do you plan to go back to your world?
With all those monsters exterminated, I suppose you can now reside in peace in your world, Chara. Do you have plans to do so?
You look familiar... for whatever reason... Have we met before, Bulma? A Pokémon tournament sponsor perhaps?
Do you happened to have sponsored a Pokémon tournament before, Bulma? I think that's how we've met before...
Huh, what are you?... Are you an illusion created by a Gastly? I've heard Gastly can be quite mischievous when around unfamiliar people...
Are you supposed to be an illusion? The work of a Gastly perhaps? I've read folk stories about this, but never actually witnessed one before.
That outfit... Are you from Eastern Kalos or the surrounding area, Penny? I think I recognize that attire!
I think I've seen that outfit before, Penny... You originate from around Eastern Kalos, correct?
Those animals you mentioned earlier, Jason, what are they? Are they some kind of regional Pokémon? What types and moves do they have?
I've been thinking a lot about your so-called animals, Jason... What kind of abilities do they have, and are they particularly useful in Pokémon battles and competition?
I'm curious as to what you'll do, now that your revolution is over. Going back to your bike? Planning to raise a family?
Now that you've got your revolution behind you, what kind of plans do you have now? Looking forward to your family, I bet.
I've never met anyone so knowledgeable in the topic of poker before! Although, I'm more interested in your ability to make your stick float. It's not often I meet a psychic, you see.

Just by looking at you, I already knew you would be intelligent, but you still blew my expectations out of the water. But what surprised me the most is your psychic abilities, which is quite rare indeed.
Right of the bat, you already gave off an aura of intelligence and confidence, so your extensive knowledge in poker comes as no surprise. However, I didn't think you would also be a psychic.
Pardon my unsolicited comment, but I can't shake off the feeling that you could be a deity of some sort. I don't understand it either, but I'm definitely feeling off.

I know you didn't really ask for this, but you somewhat remind me of old religious figures for some reason. Perhaps it's the robe, but I'm also feeling something strange, as if I'm being watched by a god.

Interesting, I've heard stories of people who live in forests, and hunt for their daily food, but I didn't expect that the first time I would meet one was in a game like this. I can't quite remember the proper term for that way of living...

The term currently escapes me, but you're one of those hunter-gatherer people from the forest, right? You certainly have the appearance of one, at the very least. I never thought I would meet one in this context.

Your real name is Mordred? Quite a curious name. The only other figure named Mordred I could think off the top of my mind was a legendary figure I read from a Galarian myth. Something about a grail...
Where have I heard of the name Mordred before? Oh right, it was from that Galarian epic that I came across during my research into Galarian culture. The figure that was looking for some grail...

Your name reminds of an old Galarian legend I read quite some time ago. That was the only other context I've heard of the name Mordred, and the only other thing I can remember was a grail of some sort of significance...
That's quite an... interesting fashion sense, if you got what I meant. Is all the asymmetry a conscious choice, or did you have to make do with the articles of clothing you had in hand?

I suppose unique would be one way of describing your appearance... The disheveled hair could be considered a style in its own right, but your clothes... You were going for a mix-and-match style, I presume.
I've been wondering why you're called Twisted Fate. Are you some sort of sideshow performer? I wouldn't be at all surprised, given your appearance.
Would Twisted Fate happen to be your stage name? And what type of performances do you give out in that case? I can't quite put my finger on it.

My word, of all the psychotic egomaniacs I have encountered, you might just be the most deluded yet! At least you're not trying to blow up priceless ruins, if that can even be considered a silver lining.
You might not have the power to manipulate universes, but you sure have the ego to fill one! Next, you'll tell me that you can create a universe in your image with just the snap of your finger!
All this talk of energy and spell-casting gives me the impression that you're a psychic, Ringo. Am I correct in my deduction?
Although I have no evidence to back it up, from the mannerisms I've seen from you so far, you must be a psychic, Ringo.

Now, now, playing around with knives is a bit irresponsible, especially when you're wearing a mask that obscures your field of vision. Why don't you put down your knife, before I take immediate action?

This is hardly the time and place to be playing around with a sharp blade, no matter how much protection you wear in your face. Put the knife down, so I can focus on the game instead of planning of disarming you.
You mentioned earlier that you were a model, Aoba, right? Are you involved with magazine publications, or are you more of a runway model?
I was curious as to what extent your role as a model is, Aoba? Do you simply pose for pictures, or are you one of those models that are actively advertised?
What did you mean earlier when you said "an army of zombies made from shadows"? What is the goal of this Lord of yours in accomplishing that plan?
... What exactly is your Lord's agenda in raising an army of zombified shadows, Perona? Don't you think that's a bit suspect?
I've been curious what painting style you utilize in your works, Rin. Do you go for highly-detailed images, or do you prefer a more esoteric style?
What style do you usually utilize in your paintings, Rin? Do you lean towards a colorful image, or a more somber one?
The way you were casually trotting with that thing makes me suspect that carrying heavy ordnance is normal where you're from... Care to comment on that, Brock?
I suppose someone so used to lugging a rocket launcher must have come from somewhere where that's considered normal... Do you have anything to add, Brock?
I've seen my fair share of Pokéstar Studios films, and I know a cowboy when I see one. What's up with the outfit anyway, Colt? Do you just like dressing up, or another reason?

Well, I haven't seen plenty of cowboys in my travels, but I can immediately tell that you're dressed up as one, Colt? Although it's a bit more subdued than most cowboys costumes, I'm curious as to why you're dressed as such.
I seem to recall you mentioning earlier that you were in the midst of a training, Leonie... Can you elaborate what you are training for?
You're an understudy, correct? An apprentice, to be more precise. So, what is your apprenticeship about, Leonie?
I can't help but notice that your outfit is a school uniform, Hermione. Are you an apprentice of the Anistar Gym at Kalos? I've heard that's a prestigious school for psychics.

I've been wondering what school you're attending, Hermione. I've heard that the Anistar Gym in Kalos is the go-to destination for psychics wanting to strengthen their powers. Is that where you're from?
What is it exactly that you do, Fate? My intuition tells me that you travel a lot, and you seem to look the part, at least.
There must be something you do to keep yourself busy, Fate. I have a hard time believing that you stay in one place for extended periods of time. So, what is it?
I can see plenty of determination in your eyes, Ayano. It's surprising to meet another person who has intense eyes like that young trainer I battled years ago.
One look at you tells me that you're a very persevering person, Ayano, and you'll do anything to get what you want... whatever that might be. I can see it just in your eyes, that unbridled passion.
You look like a very shady character, Faye, and your unusual mannerisms doesn't sate my suspicions. You don't happen to be one of those Pokémon hunters involved in the black market, are you?
I'm getting a very ominous aura from you, Faye. I can't shake the feeling that you're somehow connected to illegal Pokémon poaching and trade...
Based on what I've gathered from you, you're something called a "Light Mage", Lux. What exactly is a Light Mage capable of doing?
I must confess that I don't know anything about Light Mages, aside from the fact that you are one, Lux. Would you mind elaborating about your abilities as a Light Mage?
Are you really the vampire queen, Marceline? Well, you're obviously a vampire, but the queen of all vampires? This isn't the type of place I'd expect a member of nobility to attend.
Even though you're obviously a vampire, I'm not exactly convince that you're truly the queen, Marceline. For one thing, I wouldn't expect a queen to partake in this kind of activities.
Well, you're an attorney, and your very professional attire gives it away immediately. I must say, between the two of us, this game is classier than I would have expected.
My, you've got a strong professional aura emanating from you, Mia, it almost makes me look casual in comparison! The two of us can make this game look relatively high-brow.
What kind of healing do you perform, Angela? Are you a Pokémon nurse, or a more specialized type of medical expert?
I've heard that you're a healer of some kind, Angela, but I never found out which specialization. Do you specialize in treating wounded Pokémon?
A talking automaton? How bizarre... What are your origins and goals, automaton?
An automaton... It seems to be aware and sentient, but why was it sent here?
I picked up from your earlier conversations that you're an assistant, Pauling. Which League are you an assistant to? I've heard that being a League Assistant is a very busy and time-consuming work.
I've overheard you earlier mentioning that you're an assistant, but I didn't pick up where, Pauling... I know for a fact that being a League Assistant comes with a lot of work and responsibilities.
Those ears... They look nothing like human ears at all! Are you some sort of human-Pokémon hybrid?
I can't believe my eyes! What is going on with your ears? You almost look like a half-human, half-Pokémon entity!
Are there any ongoing conflicts that you which to be enlisted to, Leonie? Or are you training to be a mercenary as a mere profession?
I do wonder about you're reason for becoming a mercenary, Leonie? Is there a conflict in particular that you're hoping to partake in, or do you simply want to be a mercenary for the sake of it?
Now, that you're just about naked, Nami, I've been pondering one thing... What's is like being a woman onboard a pirate ship? I've read accounts of female pirates, but they're quite scant.

Your half-naked body made me remember a question I've had for a long time: How's your experience being a female member of a pirate crew? There has been female pirates throughout history, but they're few and far between.
I'm still curious about the extent of your magical powers, Ringo. What do you normally do with your magic powers?
If you have some sort of magic powers, then I would presume that they would have some sort of use in your everyday life, am I correct? I would be interested in hearing about them.
I've been wondering, what exactly does your light-manipulating powers entail? By that, I mean what do you use your powers for?
If you're a prominent light mage, I would presume that your abilities have some very essential uses. Or at the very least, you can derive some sort of benefit from it. Is my deduction correct?
I'm still not exactly sure what you are, but I'll play with this masquerade for now... Can you describe where you are from, Orendi?
Extraterrestrial or not, the only way I can get useful info from you is by playing along... Can you describe what your home world is like, Orendi?
That boxing league you participate in must have some sort of divisions. For example, weight classes, or by gender. Surely, you wouldn't just fight an opponent from a different class.
Even without levels, there must be weight classes in your boxing league. I'm not that familiar about boxing, but I suspect you wouldn't face off two fighters of different sizes.
So... this Dr. Eggman transformed you into a human... What exactly is his objective? Is he a member of a villainous team?
You claim that a particular Dr. Eggman did this to you... Do you know his agenda, or his affiliation?
Now that we've established that you're a soldier, I was just wondering if you're part of a squad or an army. Surely, you don't go to combat by yourself.
When you go to combat, do you do so as a member of a group, or perhaps even an army. I don't believe it would be wise to go to battles alone.
I seem to recall battling you before... It was in Caitlin's villa in Undella Town, wasn't it? You've grown a lot since then!
This isn't the first time we've met, hasn't it? I think we've battled in Undella Town before, a couple years back... You look much more like a woman now.
Hmm, that's quite an... interesting outfit... It gives me a bad feeling that I can't seem to shake off...
Your clothes have quite the striking shade of red, yet I have a feeling that's not the only reason you have an ominous feel emanating from you...
I've been wondering about your outfit... That emblem on your chest suggests that you're a member of an organization. Care to share some information about it?
Odd, but I only noticed just now that your jacket has a logo on it. I don't think I've seen that one before, and I would be interested to hear more about... whatever that logo belongs to.
I've been wondering... what kind of medical emergencies do you usually treat during combat, Angela. I've heard diseases can kill as many people as the warfare itself.
I've always been fascinated about the act of providing medical services during the violent struggles... Would you say that diseases are just as rampant as war-related injuries?
My, what an intriguing outfit. Right away, I could tell you're a priestess, but I can't quite place my finger as to what culture you're from, Fina.
I've seen all sorts of religions and culture during my travels, but I don't think I've quite seen a priestess attire quite like yours, Fina. I'm quite intrigued to know more about your culture.
I take it that you're a scientist, Chell. And this thing with you... is it a Rotom? It seems to me that this Rotom is more talkative than usual, and also a lot less mobile.
I've heard that scientists are quite keen on studying the mechanisms of Rotom, and it seems you brought your study subject with you, Chell. This one's quite talkative too, I might add.

state.text: I've been dying to know how or why a talking Braixen is allowed in this game... Anyhow, I believe you're better off staying in a Pokéball until this game is over. Just remain still...
This is hardly the place for a delicate Pokémon like a Braixen... You might be fully clothed and capable of speech, but the proper place for you currently is inside a Pokéball... I have one here...

case.state: Just one look at you tells me a lot about you, Hilda. Let me guess... you're the daughter of a noble, and you are a soldier of some sort... Perhaps a military student?
If I've ever seen a military outfit worn by a member of nobility, it would be yours, Hilda. I could immediately tell just by analyzing your appearance. A military cadet, to be precise.
Once you graduate from your school, what do you plan to do with your skills, Pyrrha? Thinking of joining the army perhaps, or becoming a freelance mercenary?
I would suppose you didn't go to school just to put your skills to waste, Pyrrha. So I do wonder what your future prospects are, aside from joining the army?
I heard earlier that you're a digital singer, Miku. Does that mean that you're not a real person? Or are you a performer being represented remotely by a hologram?
What exactly does being a digital singer entail, Miku? Are you just an artificial construct? Or are you a real person, but being represented by a holographic image?
Hey, I think I recognize you! Weren't you a gym leader from the Orre province? I seem to recall stories about you, and your distinctive hair.
My memory of the details is a bit spotty right now, but I seem to recall that you were a gym leader from the Orre province. It's your hair that I mostly remember about.
It's just my hunch, but I would guess that you're a Pokémon coordinator, Fluttershy. You certainly fit the part, in terms of appearance and personality.
I know that you shouldn't judge a book by its cover, but looking at your appearance, I would guess that you're a Pokémon coordinator, Fluttershy.
A find it odd that you would wear your school uniform to a game like this, Nagisa. Anyhow, do you train Pokémon? I figure you would be a Rising Star, or even an Ace Trainer.
I did not expect to see a school uniform in a game like this... not that there's anything wrong with that, Nagisa. Do you train Pokémon too? You have the looks of an Ace Trainer.
"Princess of Hell" is quite an... intriguing title to bestow to yourself, Charlie. I appreciate your bellhop outfit too, even though it clashes somewhat with the Princess of Hell aesthetic.
I've heard of a lot of self-ascribed nicknames, but "Princess of Hell" is among the most memorable. Though, I'm not quite convinced your bellhop outfit fits the persona you were going for.
Hmmm, what's this? That's quite an... old-fashioned attire you have there, Ignatz. You almost look like a gentleman in training.
I never thought I would ever see someone wearing that style of outfit, Ignatz. It's something I've only seen on paintings. Are you trying to be like an old-school gentleman?
I seem to remember you mentioning that you were a bioalchemist, Sucrose. Truth be told, I'm surprised the practice survives to this day. What exactly is it that you do with bioalchemy?
I'm intrigued by the fact that you're a practicing bioalchemist, Sucrose. I thought that discipline had been superseded centuries ago. What does your job entail, in terms of tasks?
I picked up earlier that you're a pilot, Takatoshi. I wonder what route you fly in, because your knowledge of the places that you visit in your flights could be helpful in my research.
I would expect that a pilot like yourself must know quite a lot about the regions that you visit in your flights, Takatoshi. Your knowledge can help me contextualize my research.
I see that you've taken some inspiration from the Unovan fashion scene, Janet. I have a friend who also works as a model in Unova, and I wonder if you have the same designer...
Well, I believe I've seen that style of outfit before... I know someone who works as a model in the Unova region, and I suspect that you have the same fashion designer, Janet.
Are those Pokémon ears..and a tail? Are you a half-Pokémon, half-human hybrid, or a human-looking Pokémon?
Pardon if I'm stating the obvious, but you appear to have a tail and a pair of Pokémon ears...Are you a type of Pokémon that I've never seen before?

state.text: I'm not sure if you're aware, but you're being haunted by two onibi, Yuna. Don't worry though, my Spiritomb will be able to disperse these two malevolent fire spirits with little effort.
I don't mean to alarm you, but there are two onibi standing on either side of you, Yuna. My Spiritomb should do quick work of them, so just stand back for your own safety.

case.state: Considering that we have not been overrun by zombies yet, I presume the efforts of this Lord Moria failed. I do wonder how that came to past, Perona.
A zombie army would be formidable, but not unstoppable. And like every formidable army, they will eventually crumble. How did these sequence of event transpire in your case?
Even if you're not a gym leader, I take it that you're a Pokémon trainer, Bobobo. I'm curious as to what your preferred type is.
You look like you would know a lot about Pokémon, Bobobo. Tell me, do you train Pokémon, and what type do you usually go for?
You keep mentioning a place called Bilgewater, Fate? What is it like? The name itself doesn't leave a good first impression.
Let's switch to a different topic... About that place that you call Bilgewater, what can you tell me about it, Fate?
I'm curious about your work as a bioalchemist, Sucrose. Does your work with plants allow you to create medicines and potions, or are you doing pure study?
Now that we've established that you work with plants, what applications does your work have, Sucrose? Do you branch out to medicine, or possibly even thaumaturgy?
It's been years since we last met, Dawn. What have you been up to all these years? You must be a prominent coordinator by now.
Did you ever pursue your dream of being a trainer, Dawn? I must admit that I haven't been keeping as close of an eye to the Sinnoh League like I used to.
So how do you plan to go about conducting your field research, Dawn? Are you going on another lengthy journey just like old times?
Field research does take a bit of time to plan, so I would think long and hard if you plan to conduct one, Dawn. Although, traveling around a region like you previously did should work.
Fina, if you can describe the geography, culture, and history of the Silvite Civilization, I might be able to figure out where it is located. Besides, it's also good info either way.
If you can give me more details about the Silvite Civilization, then I might be able to deduce the geographical name familiar to me, Fina.
Out of curiosity, what exactly is it that you do, Janet? Are you a runway model like I initially suspected?
You do have the looks of a model, but are you actually one, Janet? I've got the feeling that it might not be at all a correct assumption.
Out of curiosity, what topics do your songs usually tackle, Critical Darling?
Speaking of songs, what are your songs usually about, in terms of topic, Critical Darling?
Now that the legion of the undead is dead again, what have you been up to recently, Perona?
I'm curious, what have you been doing recently, Perona? Not raising your own undead army, I hope.
Basically, what you need to know about Pokémon are that they are creatures that live around the world. Some live in oceans, some live in forests, some live in the shadows, among others.
Speaking of Kalos, if you ever decide to visit Lumiose City, you should know that people usually walk the streets in pairs. Hence, the City of Love moniker.
I've read that in Lumiose City, majority of people, be it locals or tourists, walk the streets in pairs. You can already figure out why it is called the City of Love.
You know, there are a lot of cafes that we can go visit in Lumiose City. There are so many different options, and it's somewhat difficult to choose which one to visit first.

One of the biggest tourist draws in Lumiose City are the cafes. There are quite a handful of them all throughout the city, each with a different theme, and choosing which one to visit first could get tricky.
Wouldn't it be awkward if people actually thought we're a couple? We've traveled extensively together, discussed our hypothetical date, played strip poker together... Normal friendly activities...

Thinking of it, I can see why people might think we're romantically involved... We've been all over the Sinnoh region together, contemplated what we would do on a date, and are now playing strip poker...
I've been thinking, Dawn... What if we actually tried to pretend that we are girlfriends, just to find out how people would react? It's a silly idea, I know, but I wouldn't mind trying it...
There's no way we would know if people would react positively or negatively in our hypothetical relationship unless we actually pretend to be in one... What do you say?
I've been wondering, what kind of magical powers do you actually possess, Y'shtola? Any powers of particular note that can help you in a game like this?
Just how much control do you have over your magic abilities, Y'shtola? Be honest, are you using any of your magical abilities right now?
Have you ever considered collecting gym badges, Bobobo? I wager you can take on a gym leader or two, given the constituents of your team.
Given that you have a Pokémon team of your own, have you ever tried challenging your local gym leaders, Bobobo?
Come to think of it, weren't you from Aspertia City, which already has a gym? What kind of arrangements do you have with the current gym leader there?
I might be misremembering, but you mentioned back then that your hometown is Aspertia City. Since there's already an existing gym there, what are your plans for your own gym?
I'm intrigued... why are you traveling with two ghosts anyway, Yuna? Are you a psychic, with these two being your familiars?
Given that you have two ghosts accompanying you, I would guess that you must be some sort of a psychic, Yuna. Which would then mean that these two ghosts must be your familiars.
Are you seriously from Hell? Would that mean you're a demon then? What would an entity like you want in a place like this?
I can't tell if you were joking, but are you actually a demon that originated from Hell? The Hell? What could your goal be, partaking in a game like this?
From what I've heard so far, your staff is quite revolutionary in the medical field. It wouldn't be far-fetched for me to assume that it's caught a lot of attention from all sectors, wouldn't it?

Despite the shortcomings, your staff is quite an effective healing tool, much more effective than anything I've seen or heard of before. I would find it hard to believe if you tell me that it remains an obscure invention where you're from.
Since your studies are primarily concerned with plants, I'm curious if you do intensive testing with grass-type Pokémon as well, Sucrose.
When you perform your experiments on plants and they return the expected results, do you perform them on grass-type Pokémon as well, for the sake of cross-examination?
If there's one thing I've learned about children of nobility, it's that there's very high expectation on your military career, not just from your parents, but your dynasty as a whole.

Since you're a member of a noble house, I would presume that the expectations for you are quite high, even more so compared to soldiers from the common populace. After all, you must uphold your family name.
A maid wearing medieval armor? Is this a roleplay sort of business? I can't quite wrap my head around your costume.
Why exactly would you be wearing a pair of gauntlets and bracers with your maid uniform? I might be pointing out the obvious, but your unusual fashion sense is something that was worth pointing out.
That's a quite an old-fashion outfit, but it's not something I've not seen before. Quite a few people wear that everyday back home in Celestic Town. The past indeed lives on in that sleepy town.

I've remember wearing a hakama and obi like yours for ceremonial functions when I was younger, but some denizens from Celestic Town use it as their everyday wear. No wonder it has a reputation of being outdated.

So your moniker is Dark Magician Girl... would you happen to be affiliated with Hex Maniacs? You don't quite look like the Hex Maniacs I've seen, but your outfit fits their idiosyncratic fashion sense.

I've never heard of a class called Dark Magician Girl before, but your mannerisms and taste in outfits leads me to think that you're some sort of a Hex Maniac. Perhaps you're from a different region than the ones I've met before?

My, you're quite a heated little competitor, aren't you? It reminds me a lot of the younger trainers that challenge me from time to time. So much youthful energy, but you need to learn to control it and channel it positively. Being too competitive can have a negative effect.

Well, well, the competitive spirit is every strong in you! Those intense eyes, it reminds me of that trainer I battles several years ago. I've learned that there's such a thing as being too competitive, and you need to learn to contain it before it devours you.

That was an interesting prayer you conducted in your previous strip, Barbara. I take it that you're a religious woman... which very much contrasts with your presence in this game. Care to explain that?
I found it fascinating that you conducted a round of prayer when you lost previously, considering the context we are in. What would a religious woman like you be doing in a sinful setting like this?
I'm curious about which Pokémon you've taken care of in your time. I've heard that daycares can take in all sorts of Pokémon, so I'm assuming the same can be said for your shelter.
If you spend a lot of time taking care of Pokémon, then you must have seen a wide variety of them by now. I was wondering just how many types of Pokémon you've encountered so far.
I've heard you refer to yourself earlier as the Goddess of Lactation, and you also mentioned that you were a patron of gaming and amusements. How much power do you wield in those domains?

I've gathered that you're known as the Goddess of Lactation, while also being an avid participant in various forms of amusement. Is your jurisdiction merely ceremonial in nature, or do you have a say in those matters?

My, you've got the royal air enveloping you, Fischl, if at demeanor rather than appearance. Say, which region are you from specifically? I'm getting the impression that you're somewhere near the border of Kalos.

Well, you've got that unmistakable aristocratic flair emanating from you, Fischl, even if your appearance suggests anything but. If I would take a gander, I would say that you originate not far from the Kalos region.

You know, if you wanted to pass yourself off as a jewel thief, you should have dressed up as a Corvisquire rather than a Crobat, Rouge. After all, Corvisquire are known to have a fascination with shiny objects.

I'm intrigued by this persona you're tying to exhibit, Rouge, but If you wanted to present yourself as a master of jewelry heists, I feel like a Corvisquire would be better evocation for your outfit than a Crobat.
You've mentioned in passing earlier that you have a pet Emboar. How long have you been training your Emboar, and what moves has it learned?
I'm a bit curious about the fact that you own an Emboar... What sort of training do you usually undertake with it, especially when you're tying to teach it a new move?
My, you wouldn't happen to be a Pokémon center nurse, would you? It's very rare I see one of you this far away from a Pokémon center.
I might be mistaken, but you've got that unmistakeable look of a Pokémon center nurse. I'm simply not used to seeing one in a place that's nowhere near a Pokémon center.
You seem like the athletic type, Miki. What sports do you usually play, and how do you compensate for your physical handicap?
One look at you tells me that you're involved in organized sports, Miki. I do wonder what sorts they are... and how you can be proficient with only one hand...
I've heard that you have something akin to psychic powers, Kumatora. What exactly are your powers, and how extensive are they?
I take it that you're a bit of a psychic, Kumatora, in terms of abilities. I'm wondering what exactly does your psychic powers allow you to do?
One look at you tells me a lot about you, and I can clearly tell that you're friendly and bubbly demeanor is masking an interior of pure determination and controlled aggression, Monika.

It's often said not to judge a book by its cover, and I could determine that even though you look very approachable and amicable on the outside, you are hiding a strong-willed and clever personality, Monika.
I've heard that your home were ravaged by dragon-type Pokémon, ~nagamimi~. Are there records which describe which Pokémon in particular was responsible for the devastation?

You've mentioned that dragon-type Pokémon caused wide-spread destruction where you're from, ~nagamimi~. There's quite a lot of dragon-types, and I wonder if you happen to know which ones specifically were responsible?

My, that's a very traditional hakama you're wearing, Reimu. Even though I've met quite a few shrine maidens in my travels, I've yet to see one as traditional as yours... Nor did I expect to meet a shrine maiden here to begin with...

I can tell that you're wearing a traditional version of the hakama, which does look a bit old-fashioned compared to the modern shrine maiden attire. Say, this is the last place I'd expect to meet a shrine maiden.

I've seen pictures of spacesuits before, but I never realized they would look a lot bulkier in real-life. Yours almost looks like full body armor, Samus. I suppose space travel truly is as rigorous as they say.

I must say, I've seen a used spacesuit at a museum before, but it looks very small compared to your suit, Samus. I would suppose yours is an upgraded version, better suited for withstanding the challenges of spaceflight.
My word! You sure look like you've seen better days! It's a wonder of medical science that you're not only alive, but still fully functional... at least physically...
Dear Arceus, I don't even want to imagine whatever it was that caused your scarring. I must be said though, that medicine has advanced so much that you've essentially been brought back to life.
I do remember you mentioning earlier that Silvites can extend their lives in orders of millennia. How would you go about accomplishing such a thing?
Since Silvites has the capability to extend their lifespans, what sort of a process would you have to undertake, if you wanted to live for a thousand years?
I do sense a strong sense of drive and determination emanating from you, Fate... What is it that motivates you to do the things you currently do?

For all your negative qualities, I can't deny that you seem to have an unrelenting power of will, but there must be something pushing you so. What would you say serves as your inspiration to fuel your perseverance?
You've mentioned that you fight ghosts, Stocking. Where do these ghosts originate? Are they the souls of people who has unfinished business, or the manifestation of negative emotions?

Since you claim to fight ghosts, do you have an inkling about their origins, Stocking? Legend say that some ghosts are the souls of people that died after getting lost, while others claim that they are borne out of frustration and hopelessness.
I recognize that outfit. Would you happen to be an agent of the International Police, Leon? Perhaps even a close associate of Looker?
When I first looked at you, I almost thought you were Looker. The resemblance is simply uncanny. Are you an associate of his from the International Police?
Another rule imposed by the Pokémon League is that your gym must be themed around a specific type. Which one have you chosen, ~rosa~?
I wonder which type you've chosen to specialize your gym in, ~rosa~. The Pokémon League regulations requires that you're gym must be specialized to a specific Pokémon type.
If you wouldn't mind sharing details, I'm curious as to where you work, and what's the nature of your research work, Tomoko.
I know that your field of work is classified, but you've piqued my interest, Tomoko. Would you mind giving some details about your study, and who is employing you to conduct such a research?

I'm not really sure your boxer shorts collection would make for an interesting conversation topic, and the less said about your nose hairs, the better, so... what are your plans for your Pokémon team?
Talk of boxer shorts hardly piques my interests, and the same goes for your prehensile nose hairs. In lieu of that, may I ask what are your upcoming plans, in regards to becoming a Pokémon trainer?

I'm curious about this aether that you claim to manipulate, Y'shtola. From my previous readings, aether is this fifth unseen element that envelopes all of existence. How would you go about manipulating that?

Correct me if I'm wrong, but this aether, the element that you study, it's this invisible material which is found all over the universe, am I correct? What kind of process does it take to use such an inert element?
Would it be reasonable for me to assume that you're some sort of scientist or researcher who's been conducting observation and experiments in outer space?
Since you seem to be a veteran of spaceflights, I take it that you've spent a lot of time doing scientific studies related to phenomena in outer space and zero gravity.
I've heard whispers that you're a princess of Galar, Petra. Would that be accurate? Based on your speech cadence, I would even go as far as surmise that you're from the Crown Tundra.

I'm not one to usually dabble in gossips, but I've gathered that you're a Galarian princess, Petra. Gossips are hardly the most reliable source, so I wanted to confirm from you. You're accent is quite reminiscent of the Crown Tundra accent as well.
How do you deal with your fame, and all the attention and expectation that come with it, Miku? Have you ever craved wanting some private time away from all the prying eyes.
Given that you're always in the spotlight, have you ever felt that you need some time off away from all the show business, and just do as you please, even if just temporarily?
How exactly does someone like you end up in a place like this, Erufuda? Did you have to travel far just to get here?
I'm curious as to what mode of travel you took to get to this place, Erufuda. It looks like it was quite the journey.

Since you're an expert in ghosts and the dead in general, there's something I want to ask. Some Pokémon are borne out of the spirits of dead humans, and I've been wondering how come those spirits lingered on rather than moving to the afterlife.

There's something that been bugging me relating to spirits, and I hope you can give a satisfactory answer. I know that some spirits turn into Pokémon, but I don't understand why that happens to only a minority of spirits, while the rest moves on to the afterlife.
My, you look like one of those ancient marble statues! Rather fitting, considering how the statues are meant to present the ideal human form.

Your appearance reminds me of those old marble statues commonly displayed in museums. Given your form, which I would consider to be the physical ideal of fitness, you wouldn't at all look out of place.
So, you're a top student in your class, huh? And a piano prodigy to boot? How do you manage your time between your studies, your extracurriculars, and leisurely activities?

I've heard you're somewhat of a wonder-kid, both inside and outside of a classroom. I can only imagine that you devote a lot of your time maintaining such a lofty standard, so how do you set aside some free time for rest and relaxation?
... Would it be unreasonable of me to assume that you're some sort of a Shiny Morgrem? Cunning little tricksters...
... Given that I cannot for the life of me figure out exactly what you are, I'm going off the assumption that you're a Shiny Morgrem... Not exactly a trustworthy bunch...
If you were to assess yourself, ~mikan~, how good of a nurse would you say you are? In what aspect are you better than most?
How proficient of a nurse are you really, ~mikan~? Do you have any abilities or attributes that sets you apart from the other nurses?
You might have the appearance of a Lass, but I sense that you have some sort of power emanating from you, ~misaka~. You wouldn't happen to be hiding some secret, would you?
I've heard the expression of silk hiding steel, and I feel like it applies to you, ~misaka~, even if I couldn't figure out why. It's as if you're radiating some sort of mysterious energy.
I hope you're not annoyed about my persistent questioning, but the concept of boars have piqued my interest. What kind of abilities can a boar learn?
You wouldn't mind if we kept talking about your pet boar, ~kyou~? I have a lot of questions about their nature. For one thing, what moves does your boar know, or just boars in general?
I'm curious about your home region, ~fluttershy~. Aside from your so-called animals, what notable things can you tell me about it?
All this talk about animals, and I don't even know yet which region this fauna you've been describing are endemic in. Any interesting trivia to share about your home region, ~fluttershy~?

I'm interested in your ability to play the piano, ~mari~. Pianos can bring out a wide range of emotions, from relaxation to fear. Do you know a piece that can strike fear into the hearts of everyone around you?
Given that you're a prodigious with the piano, I presume you can play all sorts of pieces. I've heard that some pieces were intended to intimidate, so I wonder if you're knowledgeable about them.
I've heard through the grapevine that you're something of an Ice-type specialist, ~ganyu~. Tell me, what kind of strategy do you prefer in battles?
You specialize in ice-types, ~ganyu~? Usually, ice-types either go for the glass cannon strategy, or the hulking glacier approach? Which one do you usually use in your battles?
Aren't you something of a professional card player, ~yuno_uno~? I suspect you would have a hefty advantage in this game specifically, but that doesn't mean I'll let it dash my hopes of winning.

If the rumors are true, then you play card games for a living, ~yuno_uno~, and you're quite an elite player too. I fully accept the challenge you would bring to this game! Don't expect any letup from me!
These servants that you're planning to get, I presume that they wouldn't be undead servants, right?
I seem to recall that you're trying to get some new servants, and I just wanted some assurance that they wouldn't be even more undead creatures.
I forgot to ask, but what is it that you specialized in for your research, ~colress~? I feel I should know more about your research first before proceeding.
Before we talk more, we should discuss about your field of study first, ~colress~. I would like to know more about the details and specifics of your research.
I do wonder what could be causing these Grimm to lash out against humans, ~pyrrha~. Ghost-type Pokémon can be mischievous, but not usually violent, especially not to this extent.
There has to be a reason why ghost-type Pokémon would suddenly become feral en masse, ~pyrrha~... if these Grimm are even Pokémon to begin with. This is very unusual behavior from them.
I'm curious about what exactly prompted your research for long-lasting energy generators, ~heris~. Is this simply a means to protect against mechanical unreliability, or is there more to it?
I feel like there's a more pressing reason for your research than merely for the sake of research itself, ~heris~? Is there an event that necessitated this research into energy generation?
What would you say is the most dangerous extraterrestrial that you've encountered, ~samus_aran~? Any one in particular that has consistently been a thorn to your side?

If you were to peg one extraterrestrial entity as the most hostile you've come across in your exploration, which would you choose, ~samus_aran~? Especially if you've encountered it more than once before.
You're... not actually human, are you? If anything, I would guess that you're a Lucario, that somehow has gained the ability of speech.
It doesn't take a close examination to determine that you're not quite human, but what exactly are you? A talking Lucario perhaps?
If memory serves right, didn't you make an appearance at a movie or TV show when you were younger, ~rosa~? I can already see your old legion of fans flocking to your gym just to see their idol again.

I remember watching either a TV show or a movie where you were a cast member a few years back, Rosa... If Elesa's gym would be any indication, you can expect a crowd of your fans to rush in at the opening day of your gym.
Speaking of your movies, why did you not pursue being a full-time actress? Did you simply lose interest, and decide to be a gym leader instead, ~rosa~?

I've been thinking about your movies, ~rosa~, and I wondering why your stint at Pokéstar Studios did not lead to anything permanent. I would have thought being an actress would be more glamorous rather than becoming a gym leader.
Have you fully given up on your acting career, ~rosa~? I think you mentioned earlier something about a TV show...
You were telling me something earlier about a small TV role, ~rosa~. I have a feeling you have more to tell about that...
It's amazing how much you've accomplished in your career given your age, ~rosa~. I can feel the strong fighting spirit within you, and you wouldn't let a predicament like this get your hopes down.

Given how much you've accomplished both on and off the battle floor, I have to say that I've been very impressed by your passion and resolve, ~rosa~. A situation like this is nothing more than a small hurdle for you.
Cupil is such a fascinating machine, ~fina~. I do wonder what his original purpose was. You did say that artificial lifeforms where you're from can pose a serious threat.
I must say that Cupil looks very adorable, but he must have some form of a utility, ~fina~. Gathering from what you said earlier, I take it that he's an artificial guardian of some form.
Aside from sports, would it be incorrect for me to think that you also excel in your studies, ~miki_miura~? What would you say is your favorite subject at school?
I'm curious about your studies, ~miki_miura~. One must excel in both mind and body after all. Which field of study do you prefer the most?
The easiest way to resolve the identity of your boar is to show her to me, ~kyou~. I would very much be intrigued to see her.
With all this confusion about your boar, it would be a good idea to just show her to me, ~kyou~. That way, I can identify what she actually is.
Since you mentioned that you participate in battles, I'm curious about your particular role. Are you more than just a foot soldier, ~ganyu~? You don't quite have the appearance of one.
I would have never thought that you were something of a soldier if you hadn't mentioned it earlier. If you were to describe your role in the battlefield, what would it be, ~ganyu~?
It doesn't take two guesses to figure out that you're an electric-type gym leader, ~kora~, just looking at your appearance. I do wonder which region and city is your gym located in?
Just one look at your outfit is all I need to know that you're the leader of an electric-type gym, ~kora~. Now, where exactly is your gym located, in terms of city and region?
Has there been any unexplained phenomena that you've observed in your power plants, ~heris~? Such known unknowns must be fascinating for you.
There must be a thing or two about your local volcanic hotspot that has not been adequately explained, ~heris~. We can never truly know everything in the world.
All this talk about your nursing abilities has been fascinating, but I'm also interested in knowing about other facets of your life, ~mikan~. What do you usually do in your off times?
As much as I would like to talk more about your aptitude as a nurse, I think it's also worth talking about your hobbies as well, ~mikan~. I would like to hear about them.
The intermingling between this world and Equestria - what kind of large-scale impact has this event produced in this world and the other, ~fluttershy~?
Would you be privy as to what the major implications are of the dimensional rift that has connected our world with the world of Equestria, ~fluttershy~? There has to be more to this event.
I've heard that you're an archeologist, ~nico_robin~. What field do you specialize in, if I may ask? I'm an archaeologist myself, and I primarily study how cultures perceive the world's creation.

I never would have thought that I would meet another archaeologist in a setting like this. Is there a specific topic that you primarily focus on, ~nico_robin~? In my case, I hold a special interest in creation stories and myths.

So let me get this straight, Reimu. This Gensokyo where you came from is a different dimension from this one we're in? And the Great Hakurei Barrier is the only thing preventing the two from having a cross over?

If I'm understanding things correctly, the Great Hakurei Barrier serves as a metaphysical wall to prevent the dimension of Gensokyo from influencing this one. And you say, that you came from the other side, Reimu?
I take it that you're a warrior of some sort, ~laevatein~. Can you tell me about that aspect?
One look at you tells me that you're a hardened fighter, ~laevatein~, and not just for fun either. A career warrior if you will. Am I correct about that assessment?
Given that you have all the power and relatively none of the responsibilities of a noble, what do you usually do for fun, ~hilda~.
Since you're of noble birth but aren't the head of your house, you must have a lot of time and opportunity to pursue any hobbies you might have, ~hilda~. Speaking of which, what are your hobbies?

state.text: I've seen that you have the potential to be a formidable trainer, ~bobobo~. In order to get to know each other better as Pokémon Trainers, I would like our Pokémon to have a match. Would you care to be my opponent?
Since you've proven yourself to be a capable trainer, I'd like to know just how strong your team is, ~bobobo~. I do want our Pokémon to have a match... Are you prepared to be my opponent?

case.state: You know, I'm still curious about your sovereignty, ~fischl~. I'd like to hear your description of it, and don't be thrifty with the details.
I still haven't what region you're a monarch of, ~fischl~. Perhaps if you described your region to me, I'll be able to figure it out for myself.
Ah, an adventurer. I remember when I used to go to adventures when I was a kid. Filling up my Pokédex was hard work, but very fulfilling.
So do you explore caves and such, ~name~? I used to explore those for fun when I was a kid, but now I do it as part of my archaeological studies.
I suddenly recall that I used to go on trips to other regions just to fill up my Pokédex. Ah, to be a kid again!
Ah, another Sinnoh native! I didn't expect to meet you here, ~name~. And I thought I was far away from home.
It's always nice to think of home when you're so far away, and you're helping in that regard, ~name~. I never would have thought I'd ran into another Sinnohlian here.
Nice to meet you, ~name~. Are you familiar with Undella Town? I have a villa there that I hang out in during the summer months. I plan to return there for the upcoming summer. Care to visit?
Long time no see, ~name~. You know me, don't you? Anyhow, I'm planning to stay at my summer villa at Undella Town this upcoming summer, and every trainer in Unova is invited to hang out.
You're from Alola, ~name~? I've been to Alola once, to participate in the Battle Tree. Ended up taking a rather lengthy vacation there. I just loved the tropical weather.
Did you really flew all the way from Alola just to play here, ~name~? I remember flying non-stop from Sinnoh to Alola way back, and the flight felt like an eternity.
How has Alola been doing recently, ~name~? Last I've heard, it was being plagued by creatures known as "Ultra Beasts", but the matter had been resolved.
What a messy hair that is, ~name~! You'd look better if you fix it up, you know. Hair hygiene is always a top priority.
Your hair is quite ruffled, ~name~. Do find some time to fix it up when you can.
Is that a... half-man, half-Pokémon hybrid?!
~Name~?! You... that look... are you half-Pokémon?!
Hold on, you're not quite human. Just what are you, ~name~?... Or is that just an outfit?
Well, what an interesting outfit... Or is it an outfit at all...?
That's quite the unusual complexion you have, ~name~. I don't think I've seen anyone with that skin color before.
I must say, you're skin color is of a shade I've never seen on humans before. Feels very surreal looking at it.
Are my eyes deceiving me, or is that the most unnatural looking color I've seen on a human?
Did you know that there are some cultures in the island chains surrounding Alola that have been practicing tattoo markings since before recorded history?
Those ink markings on your skin are certainly very impressive, ~name~. I presume you had them done using modern methods? Traditional methods can be quite a painful process.
I haven't seen a ink marking like that outside of this game since my last visit at Alola. The traditional way of making skin markings is quite an intricate and time-consuming process.
Oh, is that a tail plug you're wearing, ~name~? I remember seeing one of those in the online store once, heh...
I remember receiving a tail plug as an anonymous gift once. I still haven't tried putting it on.
I can't really tell if you're a man and a woman... We'll just have to wait for you to get naked to find out.
You have the facial and physical features of both man and woman. It would be interesting to find out your true gender, because I can't figure it out for myself yet.
A gun... I can't say I've seen guns that often, even in museums. Aside from the national regulation on guns, people usually just use Pokémon for self-defense.
Be careful where you point that gun, ~name~. If you point it at someone one too many times, you might get banned like that safari ranger.
You might be a tad overdressed for a game like this, ~name~, even if you intended to increase your layer count. No matter, there's no guaranteed victory in a game like this.
Well, well, well. I can see you took quite an interesting path with your attire choice. We'll have to wait and see if it pays off.
Between the two of us, we are making this place look more like a formal gathering than a strip poker game.
You do realize that the goal of this game is to not end up naked, right? You're not really helping your chance of winning by picking that outfit.
Well, that's quite an interesting choice of clothes for this setting... You must be very confident to put yourself in a hefty handicap like that.
I suppose you have a well-thought plan for this, ~name~... I don't see the point of wearing such skimpy outfit to a strip poker game.
I do hope you're of the proper age, ~name~. This could potentially lead to a scandal that would end my career.
I do trust that this establishment would do an age check on its players. Still, I can't get the thought out of my mind...
You don't look that much older than some of the trainers that have battled me. Some them are just kids...
You... you don't have the personality of someone that I'd expect to play a game like this.
You're shy, yet you chose to play a strip poker game... Trying to get out of your comfort zone, I would presume. This is quite an extreme way of doing it, though.
You don't look like the type to go willingly to a game like this. I do know a couple of people who are quite demure in public, but very wild in private.
You were aware that this was a strip poker game, right? Why would you even join this if you're afraid of being naked?
You do know the consequences of losing at strip poker, right? I'm just checking that you know what you're getting yourself into, ~name~.
I sense that you're not quite comfortable at the possibility of you having to strip naked in front of us, ~name~...
I get the feeling that you'd faint if you end up going naked in front of everyone here...
You're clearly not fazed by the possibility of going nude in front of strangers, ~name~. I always say that this game is half-mental, so that attitude will suit you well.
No hint of fear in body language at all, ~name~. You're exactly the type of opponent I came to expect in a game like this.
I'd say that the most difficult part of strip poker is keeping a cool head, while the possibility of losing is looming over your head. I can see that's not going to be an issue for you, ~name~.
Something about the way you act is... off...
You give me all the wrong vibes, ~name~... I'm keeping a close watch on you.
One look at you tells me many things about you. You're obviously intelligent and cunning. I wouldn't be surprised if you have a trick up your sleeve, ~name~.
You know the saying that intelligent people can recognize other intelligent people? I can only speculate at your strategy for this game. Surely someone of your intellect formulated a plan.
I can tell just by the way you coordinate yourself that you have a strategy for this game. Well then, let's see how your strategy fares against mine, ~name~.
You seem to be quite obsessed with ~player~, ~name~. I dare say to an unhealthy degree... (Strip poker might not be the only competition in this table if this keeps up.)
You can't seem to take your attention away from ~player~, ~name~. You're not even trying to be subtle with it, either. (I wish I was that confident around ~player~.)
With the way you talk up ~player~, I would suppose you would react rather negatively to anyone who dare grab his attention, ~name~. (How am I supposed to approach ~player~ now?)

I don't know if you eat out alone all the time like Alder, but I can fix that problem if that is the case.
Juri? This is no time to be fooling around...
Ha! What's wrong, Florina? Can't take the heat?
Ha! Can't take the heat, Florina? I figured someone would try to bail on me.
Ha! What's the matter, Florina? Chickening out? Heh; I figured there'd be some who weren't up to my challenge!
What's the matter, scared? Heh; your instinct to flee doesn't surprise me.
What's the matter, scared? Don't worry, most challengers who face me get the instinct to flee.
I don't like the look of her, Jura. I would take her threats seriously if I were you. I've seen enough of magic users to know an untrustworthy one.
If you want me to look away, May, just say the word. I'm certain that fear and embarrassment would curtail your arousal for the moment.
Oh, this is the perfect time to ask you some questions, Pit! Who is Hades? Is he an important mythological figure in Skyworld?
Oh, this is the perfect time to ask you some questions, Pit! Who is Hades? Is he a figure in the folklore of Skyworld?
This might be a good time to ask you some questions, Pit! Can you tell me a little bit about this Hades?
Oh, Pit, you might prove useful for my research! Can you tell me more about this Hades? What is he like?
Oh, Pit, you might prove useful for my research! Can you tell me more about this Hades? What is his importance to Skyworld?
Come on, Tharja, let's let the angel do his thing.
Horseplay? During our game? ... Can't we be just a little serious?
Well, yes, Pit... My inquisitive demeanor aside, I joined tonight's game to see some guys show some skin.
Well, to be honest, Pit, seeing some naked men is... it's precisely why I joined tonight's game.
Well, yes, Pit... My inquisitive demeanor aside, I joined today's game to see some guys show some skin.
Well, to be honest, Pit, seeing some naked men is... it's precisely why I joined today's game.
What, is that so hard to imagine, Pit? You're a bit short to be my type, but a topless guy is still a topless guy!
Come on, Pit, is that so hard to imagine? Just like I'm sure you want to see me topless, I want to see you topless; it's the reason we're here, after all.
Oh, we do celebrate Valentine's day here, Meia, and we also use Cupid as a symbol... But Cupid originated from the Pokémon Clefable, right? Does your space fleet have native Clefables?
This is a misunderstanding, Meia. Valentine's and Cupid are also tradition just like in your space fleet, but I'm baffled that you didn't know what Clefable is, as it inspired Cupid's design.

Oh right. Pokémon are these creatures that live symbiotically with humans. Humans take care of them, and in return, they help assist in everyday life. They commonly have powers, such as elemental, and psychic.

Pokémon are creatures that have coexisted with humans since recorded history. Humans feed and groom them, and they usually serve as companions. Most of them have fantastical powers such as water, fire, earth, and even psychic.
Fire/Fighting types seem to be the most popular combination choice for starter Pokémon. Anyhow, how many badges have you obtained, May?
Choosing a Fire/Fighting type as your starter seems to have a bit of an advantage, and I wonder if you've been expanding your gym badges collection, May.
I haven't been keeping up with the latest goings of the Hoenn League. Does this mean that Steven retained his status as Champion? I don't know what the protocol would be in your case.
I believe what you did is unprecedented as far as the Pokémon Leagues go, and the protocol for such a scenario escapes my mind. Is Steven still the Hoenn League champion?
Hmm, I suppose you've got a point. Still, there's a lot of considerations to take when switching between disciplines. That must have taken some time to fully sort out.
There is indeed a significant overlap, but the differences cannot be cast aside. I'm curious what adjustments you had to make during that transition.

Oh, you know those type of trainers! Aside from them, there are those trainers that are simply unpleasant to be around and is just confrontational in general. Would you say they're as prevalent in the coordinating scene?
Oh, I know exactly that feeling! I've traveled into many regions and met so many interesting people, but it wouldn't be feasible for me to visit all of them again, given my limited free time.

I'm in the same boat as you, but I haven't have had as much free time as I did when I was your age. Such a shame too, since I've met a lot of people during my travels whom I would love to visit again.

I know it was a question that came from absolutely nowhere. I was just thinking that this would be as good as a place as any to practice some intimate stripping, given that it would be overshadowed later on anyway.
This would be a good place to do a dry run for such a scenario, given that everyone's bound to do it at some point. At the very least, this is a good way of removing inhibitions regarding nudity.
Oh, you don't have to apologize! I don't mind taking in the view... I mean, it's certainly not distracting me from anything! And it wouldn't hurt to admire your... choice in underwear...
It certainly doesn't, not that I would want it any other way... Well, since you're conscious about your fashion sense, I thought the least I can do is... appreciate it...?
Well, when your dignity is at stake, there's no room for error. I hope the pressure of ending up naked in front of everyone doesn't get to you. The last thing you want is to lose your composure.

Being confident about yourself is key in a game like this. If you worry too much about possibly ending up naked, it will start a negative feedback loop and you're more likely to end up naked as a result.

Well, I actually have 3 outfits, but I get your point. Speaking of which, I wouldn't mind if you picked out an outfit for me. Fashion is hardly wasted money, considering it can from people's first impression of a person.

I have 2 other outfits besides this one, but it wouldn't hurt to add a couple more choices. This outfit is nice and all, but it looks out of place in certain scenarios, you know. I wouldn't mind splurging a bit on new clothes.
I'll keep that in mind when I meet your Pokémon. Given that you have a Blaziken, I presume that you raised it from a Torchic, which was a gift from your father.

Whenever I get the chance to visit your hometown, I'll make sure I won't tell your Pokémon. Anyhow, the fact that you have a Blaziken suggests that your father, the professor, gave it to you as a Torchic. Is that right?

So you had a fear that bug-types would hurt you... It's easy to see how exposure to Pokémon helped you get over your fears. People tend to be intimidated by their rather unusual appearance on the other hand.
