Finding out by yourself that Pokémon are not hostile does wonders in allaying your fear of them. Although, I know some people who are simply frightened by their mere appearance, and can't be persuaded otherwise.

I suppose people who are afraid to show off their bodies wouldn't have been participating in this game to begin with. Although, I came here for the new experience, rather than to explicitly see you naked, May.

Not wanting to strip completely misses the point of this game, May, but I do feel the need to point out that it's not that I came to see someone like you end up naked, but rather to simply experience something new.

I just think that since we're all having fun here, we might end up staying up very late. Rather than risk going home while tired, we can just stay over for the night. I suppose we can rent a two-bed room to save on money.

Well, I just think that since you're going home alone, having you do that while you're in an exhausted state might not be the smartest of ideas. Besides, if you're worried about money, they do have rooms with two beds, which is a cheaper deal.
It sure would be nice being able spend my time prancing around eating cake without having to worry about my waistline. We should do that soon... But enough of that! Let's see what you've got!
Well, there's a lot of foreign cuisine I'd love to try if I wasn't so self-conscious about my weight. I bet you'd love them if we ever went out together... But, the task at hand.

Sounds like you had a grand time in that royal ball. It wouldn't hurt at all if you invite me to any future balls you go to, right? I'm not one for fancy dresses, but I wouldn't mind dressing up once in a while.

If you were invited to one of those in the future, who better to bring along than a League Champion? I might not be able to match your elegance, but I like to think I would look great in a poofy dress.

I see the point you're trying to make, but practice only makes perfect if the practice itself is done correctly. Tell you what, if we can find the time, I should come and watch you train your Pokémon. I might pick up a technique or two.

It wouldn't hurt to make tweaks to my training strategy if it means my Pokémon will be a touch more elegant. If you'd allow me, I would like to watch one of your training sessions, so that I may observe the difference in our training methods.
Why, those shoes are pretty cute, Elesa!
Now those are what I call headphones!
Those are rather cute! It's the little things that really pull an outfit together.
You certainly put a lot of effort into every last detail of your outfit! I just... stick to black.
I would suppose it would get lonely up there in space, and holding costume parties would be a good way of coping with the feeling of isolation.
Perhaps, this is a emotional defense mechanism for dealing with the feeling of insignificance within the vastness of space.
You're right, Pit, it's not so bad right now; we could both be doing much worse...
You're right, Pit, it's not so bad right now; we're a little ways in and you're only now taking off your first item!
You're right, Pit, it's not so bad right now; taking off your first layer this far into the game isn't easy.
What's the matter, are you embarrassed? I don't think the boys here will judge you.
What's the matter, are you embarrassed? I don't think ~male~ will judge you.
What's the matter, are you embarrassed? Come on, let loose a little; we're all women here!
What, are you embarrassed or something? It's just us girls here.
Oh? Have you been through a lot of firefights with it?
You've been through that much, huh? How many firefights does that include?
First your armbands, and now your sash? Can you not dress yourself, Pit?
First your armbands, and now your sash? How complicated is your uniform, Pit?
You're struggling with your sash too? Pit, how do you get dressed in the morning?
You're struggling with you sash now too? Come on, Pit, you're uniform couldn't be that complicated.
You said you were struggling with your armbands as well, Pit... What's so difficult about taking off your clothing?
You said you were struggling with your armbands as well, Pit... How can this be that complicated?
You said you were struggling with your armbands as well, Pit... I guess I never realized there would be a technical barrier to this game.
Gunslinger? It's quite rare nowadays for a person to be referred to as such. As a matter of fact, guns in general are rare nowadays, at least where I'm from.
A gunslinger? I should have figured as much. To be fair, gunslingers have been obsolete for quite a while now. Same can be said for firearms.
A sheriff? Is that just the term you use for a Police Officer, or an entirely different position altogether?
I've read about sheriffs before, but people usually just call them officers nowadays... unless you were talking about something distinct...
I see. And I would presume that this defeat mean that Lord Moria will never be able to raise another army of the undead for the foreseeable future?
If this defeat is truly comprehensive, I would expect that no more threat will come from Lord Moria in the near future, am I correct?
Tapping the thermal energy generated by the crust... It's a clean and renewable power source, right? In layman's terms, what is your research focusing on?
As far as energy production goes, the carbon footprint of that seems low, and natural too. If I may ask, what kind of research are you undertaking in geothermal energy production?
Ha, that makes one of us, Pit!
Hee hee, and I hope they do, Pit!
Oh? And what if they do, Pit?
Oh? And what if they do fall down? Then what, Pit?
You say that like having them fall down is a bad thing, Pit.
You say that like having them fall down is a bad thing, Pit; I was kind of hoping they would fall down!
Oh, really? Have you had it for that long?
Oh? You need to tell me all about it, Pit! What have you gone through with that sash?
Oh? What have you been through with that sash? Tell me all the details!
Oh, are you struggling? I can help out if you need me too!
Will your sash not come off? I can help you with that!
Is it stuck? If you want, I can help you!
Oh, like a Magnezone? Yeah, yeah I can see it...
Why, I suppose they do remind me of Magnezones...
I've seen some Magnezones at Mt. Coronet, and you're right! Those do resemble a Magnezone.
Oh? Are you embarrassed about your taste in music?
No, in fact, I am not jealous, Guzma. For all I know, you've stolen those as well! Hell, you're entire outfit could be stolen...
Get a grip, Guzma; I've helped out homeless folks with better-looking shoes...
Get a grip, Guzma; I've encountered seasoned hikers with shoes in better condition...
Please, Guzma; my grandmother in Celestic Town has shoes more stylish than those...
Ha, as if, Guzma; I wouldn't be caught dead in shoes like those.
Don't be so foolish, Guzma; my heels are much more suitable for me than those.
Your sandals? Are those some sort of special angel sandals, or are they what I would be familiar with here on Earth?
Oh, are those... Do those sandals have some sort of heavenly powers in them? What makes them different from regular footwear? I must study them...
Oh, sandals from the heavens? I have to ask: is there anything special about those?
Those sandals... What kind of shoemaker made those? Is shoemaking a well-respected profession in Skyworld?
Well, if they're worn down, would you mind if I keep them, Pit? I think an angel's sandals would make a fascinating addition to my personal collection of mythological artifacts!
Well, if they're worn down, would you mind if I keep them, Pit? I could make important advancements in the field of mythology if only I could study those...
How do your sandals get so worn down, Pit? Don't angels usually... fly everywhere?
Oh, so they do have socks in Skyworld? I would have thought angels only used sandals for navigating tough terrain, but otherwise had no need for footwear.
Why don't you wear socks, Pit? Isn't it rather cold up in Skyworld?
Oh, so you do have socks up in Skyworld... Are crew cut socks more popular, or do angels prefer something more low cut?
Embarrassingly enough, I can't recall what your moniker is, Elesa.
They call you... the Shining Star, right? Elesa the... Shining Star, was it?
I think you're the Eternal Beauty, right?... No, that doesn't seem right.
Oh, so you keep in shape? Does flying burn off a lot of calories or something?
Oh, so you keep in shape then, Pit? Does Lady Palutena feed you healthy, then?
Oh, is she in charge of your fitness regimen, Pit? Are angels normally out of shape or something?
Speaking of fitness, Pit, what kinds of proteins do you eat? What fruits grow in Skyworld? I'm trying to build a picture... for my research, of course.
Oh, Wii Fit Trainer? Did you meet her in Smash, or does she frequent Skyworld?
Oh, Wii Fit Trainer? Did you meet her in Smash?
So you keep in shape then, Pit? What does the diet of a typical angel look like? Understanding this might prove vital in my research.
Oh, you're just gonna throw the game now, Pit? Why, I would have enjoyed a challenge...
Ha, you're going to short yourself a layer, Pit? Well, I at least appreciate your eagerness to show me something nice.
Really, a hassle? Do they not have clasps or something?
Oh, why I can help out if you need me to, Pit.
If you're having trouble, Pit, I could lend a hand!
Why, those don't look that tricky, Pit... Don't you just undo the clasps?
Why, those don't look that tricky, Pit... Aren't there just clasps you have to undo?
Ha, I don't doubt that, Pit; accessories usually require the most work to take on and off.
Ha, I know the feeling! You wouldn't believe how difficult it is to get these things in my hair.
A firefight? You mean... Like an Infernape?
A firefight? You mean... Like a Blaziken?
A firefight? Like... a fire and fighting type?
Oh, a firefight! Pit, I had no idea you put your life on the line for Skyworld...
Oh, Pit, I had no idea you engaged in firefights; why, aren't you a trooper!
A firefight? Heavens, Pit, I had no idea you did such things.
A... Menger Sponge? Is that like a Pokémon from Unova?
A... Menger Sponge? Is... Is that a Pokémon I'm not familiar with?
A... Menger Sponge? Is that like a Pokémon from your homeland?
Menger... Sponge? Is that a Pokémon? I've never heard of a sponge Pokémon before?
Menger Sponge! Y-eah, I know that Pokémon, totally! I wouldn't be the Sinnoh League champion if I didn't know about the Mengers Sponge.
Ha! I like the way you think, N! We're all trying to win first and foremost; must give ourselves every advantage possible while staying within the rules.
Ha! I like the way you think, N; I had thought you a villain before, but clearly you've more honor that I expected.
Yep! Those are the rules, N!
You would be correct, N.
How astute, N!
Yes, N. That's why it's called strip poker!
Ahhh, Red; now there's a name I haven't heard in a while. I wonder if he's finally ready for a rematch!
Red; now there's a name I haven't heard in a long while. I wonder how he's doing these days...
Ah, Red; now there's a name I haven't heard in while... We go way back, you see, and we've both studied alongside under Professor Oak.
Ah, your swag. Tell me, did you steal that from a jewelry store, or some poor girl?
Detective Looker will be happy to confiscate your swag for you once you've been apprehended.
Your bracelets? If you've stolen those from a jewelry store, Detective Looker will find out about it and you will pay for your crimes!
Ah, your swag. Tell me, did you steal that from a jewelry store, or some poor teenager?
Ha, custom-made? Don't lie to me; you stole those, didn't you...
That's ridiculous; you got a professional to make those glasses just for you and still turned out like that?
Ha, custom-made? I bet you stole those from a thrift store...
Be serious, you stole those, didn't you? Or did you have your grunts do it for you.
Ha, "not so bad"... That's easy for you to say, Pit.
Huh? Oh, right... I suppose someone still one their first item would say something like that...
That's easy for you to say, Pit!
That's easy for you to say, Pit! Some of us are about to... expose ourselves...
Oh, do you feel tough, Pit? Some of us are, er... doing much worse...
Pit... I'm already showing cleavage, how is it "not so bad"?
Pit... I'm... I'm indecent
Surely you don't expect me to agree with you, do you Pit?
Pit... I'm already exposing some cleavage, this is certainlybad...
Pit... Really? How bold of you to say that...
Pit? ... You really are clueless, aren't you?
It seems books aren't the only thing you can't read, Pit... Social cues could be added to that list...
I know you can't read books, Pit, but I would have at least thought you could read social cues...
Really Pit? ... Not bad? Just... just shut up, okay?
Perhaps I should have introduced my grandma first. She's the Head of the Celestic Town Historical Research Center, and she'd probably advocate for the preservation of abandoned colonies.
Oh, right, I need to introduce grandma first. She's one of the most well-respected archaeologists and historians in the Sinnoh , and she'd be ecstatic to preserve the colonies for future study.
Grandma is also an archaeologist and historian, and the main reason why I took up interest as well. Knowing her, I bet she'd request for the old colonies to become heritage sites.
I suppose that could be the case. I'm just surprised that I can't really remember women being mentioned much in regards to space travel, but perhaps I should read more.
It might be my lack of knowledge in that area of history, but I don't seem to recall any names of female space travelers. At the very least, they're more obscure than their male counterparts.
You called yourself a pirate, Meia? Like a maritime pirate, but in space? History really is repeating itself... In any case, I have Garchomp with me, so don't even consider robbing me.
You're a pirate, Meia?! All this time I've been keeping my guard down! Well, if your intention was to rob all of us, then my Garchomp will have some business with you.
Did you just say you're a pirate, Meia? Regardless, I have Garchomp to protect me if anything unsavory happens here, so I would suggest against... whatever you're planning.
At the very least, it's a more desirable way of relieving stress than shooting anything with your guns. Less noisy as well.
I don't know what your intention is with your guns, but it's good that you're not using them as a way of releasing your anger.

Well, that would explain it. She has that fiery competitiveness as well, but she's not the type to hurl death threats to other people. Besides, being your younger sister would probably have stunted her growth.

I figured as much. She's pretty genteel for someone from Southeastern Unova, not like you at all. Not to mention she probably would have developed differently if she had you for a sister during her formative years.
Fascinating. And have you noticed if your crew have picked up some of your traditional cultures and vice versa?
I see. Do you and your crew celebrate each other's holidays and traditions?
Indeed, with that much diversity among our crew, you bound to pickup up each other's traditions. Am I correct in that assumption?
I am aware that cartography was a common pastime among sailors. But, you mentioned a friend of yours, Nami. What's his condition?
Yes, that corroborates my findings that map-making was how seamen keep themselves occupied. But you mentioned that your friend has an issue of sorts. Can you elaborate on that?
That does explain the abundance of naval maps in the museum. By the way, what is your friend going through, Nami? You mentioned that something was wrong with him.
You're not that kind of pirate... Oh, you must be one of those government-employed privateers then, tasked with attacking the ships of other nations.

If you don't attack innocent ships, then you must be a privateer then. It must be interesting being employed by the government to attack other nation's ships without actually being part of the naval power.
... What type of crisis could cause such a large-scale evacuation?
... There has to be more to the story than that. That many people cannot be displaced so easily.
Oh... Well, that's more of a reason to not trust you then. If you think this would be an easy job for you, then you would be badly mistaken.
This game might end in a violent manner, and I wouldn't be so sure that you would come out on top if I were you.
Thanks for informing ahead of time. Usually, assassins like you don't warn people, but it's good that you did, so that I won't get caught out by surprise.
I'm not sure if this is another bluff, but it would be a good idea to keep in mind that I won't let you get away easily should you try anything violent around here.
Oh, I see... Moving to Earth, wouldn't be out of question, would it? You can do a good job of blending in here as long as you don't pirate ships.
Since you're already here and you've not been attacked yet, perhaps Earth can be the site of your crew's relocation instead. You look very much an Earth human still.
If you don't have any other options, you should consider moving back to Earth. It doesn't look like you will have too much difficulty getting used to the way of living here.
... You're definitely not a Hex Maniac, then... I was just wondering because you greatly resembled their average member...
... Oh, it was just an honest mistake... I mentioned it because I was very sure you were a Hex Maniac. The resemblance was just too uncanny to ignore.
That does make sense, Jura... Say, how often are you piloting ships? Is it a regular thing that you do?
Well, that explains a lot... But I do wonder if you have to wear your spacesuits often. Is piloting just something you expect to do on a daily basis?

condition.saying: If I were to venture a guess: divine influence

case.state: Hold on, was that serious, Galatea? Under what manner does an ancient marble statue gain sentience and animation?
It couldn't possibly be... but it has, in front of my own eyes... But I don't understand... how does marble begat a living and talking statue?
Of course! Natural pregnancy would be a notable event in a planet with no men!... That does beg the question of how you maintained your population without men.
A planet with no men is a planet with no pregnancy... Why didn't I think of that?... If you had no men to impregnate your population, how has your planet not died out yet?
Oh, pardon me then, Neptune. It's just that ghost-type trainers have a very similar sense of fashion as you. Very easy mistake to make.
Well, I should have known better than jumping to conclusions based on appearances. That assumption is correct most of the time, but still...

Emerging from a portal, and having the codename "Supernova"... there are no doubts in my mind you're a member of Team Galactic. You might not be in your uniform, but you weren't going to fool me that easily!
Oh, give it up! That little performance isn't enough to sway me, "Supernova". Based on your choice of alias and previous actions, I have already figured out that you're a Team Galactic grunt.

Arceus gave you life... while you were still being carved by your artist? How bizarre... I have read stories of Arceus punishing those who betrayed it... Perhaps you did so, in another life, and this was your punishment.

It almost sounds like Arceus was torturing you by putting you on that fate... Perhaps that was the exact intention. You might have wronged Arceus in your past life, and your punishment was being entombed in a block of marble, and your artist saved you.

Why would Arceus purposely trap you in uncarved marble?... Unless... Yes, it sounds familiar... Arceus does not suffer fools, inflicting agony for perceived wrongs... and for you, the sentence was life as a living block of marble...
Do you mean... you're a real goddess?! A deity living in the mortal world?! I've never heard of an actual goddess that looks like a human before! Which pantheon do you even belong to?
It can't be! An actual living goddess standing in front of me! Especially one that looks so human-like! I don't recall reading about you in any of the pantheons I've studied!

Why? Well, if you were someone who considers emotions to be pitifully useless, illogical and irrational, and all sentimentality to be vacuous, then this plan makes perfect sense from your point of view.

Are you really going to make me explain? If you are of the mindset that emotions are mere illusion, and you've abandoned all forms of emotions as useless sentimentality, then this would the logical conclusion.
Well, if you're an actual goddess, and not just another delusional Team Galactic grunt, prove it.

A real goddess would have the power to prove their status as a deity. Well then, the burden of proof lies on you, and the only way you can prove you're not a Team Galactic member is to show me your powers.
You must have been quite busy, if you couldn't find the time to ride your bike recently. What have you been up to?
I'm assuming that you meant that you've been rather preoccupied, hence you were not able to go biking recently, Jim. Would you mind sharing what you've been busy with?
Really?... And what sort of event are you referring to, Chara?
Are you alluding to some event in particular, Chara? I'll be interested in hearing about it, if you don't mind.
I'm all ears if you're planning to tell a story, Chara.

If you're still curious, a Toucannon is a flying-type Pokémon native to Alola. Like your outfit, it is full of dark feathers with red embellishments. If you've eaten Froot Loops, you would have seen a Toucannon mascot on the box.

You're not familiar with Alolan Pokémon, Laevatein? Anyway, Toucannon is a flying-type winged Pokémon, and your outfit reminded me of its black feathers with a red tail. The box mascot of Froot Loops is a Toucannon, if you've seen one.
Nevada? I've never heard of such a place before, but judging from your earlier descriptions, it seems to be a place torn by violence. What happened to cause that current situation?
I'm not familiar with this "Nevada", but it seems to be experiencing war right now, if my inference is correct. Do you know what caused it to descend to that condition?

I was trying to learn the sacrificial rituals of an ancient kingdom, Jason. By learning more about that kingdom's pantheon, I can perhaps decipher their creation story, and contrast them with the creation stories of surrounding regions.

I was there to learn more about their sacrificial rituals, and how it ties up with their creation story. They were not the only kingdom to do such sacrifices, so I was hoping to see if they have the same origins as the others.
A big... mouth?! I don't have a big mouth, do I?!
And what was that supposed to mean?!
I... I don't know either. I've never been one for unhealthy diet.
Maybe... I wouldn't know. I don't think I've ever indulged in an unhealthy diet.
... And what exactly is your reason for abandoning the... previous organization you were working for?
... Something must have caused you to switch allegiances, because I doubt you would have done simply of your own accord... What is it?
When you say "monsters", what precisely are you referring to? And how are you sure you and ~player~ didn't kill anyone beyond that?
I need some clarification on what you are referring to as a "monster", and if you're sure that you didn't kill anyone else beyond these "monsters"...

That's how they always begin: things will look better in the short-term, only for things to take a turn for the worse once the government begins to crave power, continuing the cycle. Oh, sorry, that was a bit cynical.

Time and time again, a revolution succeeds in overthrowing a tyranny, only for a new tyranny to take over in its wake. A never ending oppression... Oh! I was thinking out loud again! Never mind all of that.
A lumberjack, I see... So what kind of creatures do you encounter in the forest when you are looking for a tree to cut? Surely, the forest would have an impressive biodiversity.
If you go to the forest often, then you must be familiar with the wildlife living there, which I expect would be a lot. What do you usually encounter in there?
You're not here to hurt anybody, yet you dare bring a weapon to a card game... Not exactly the most convincing excuse...
And how exactly is that supposed to excuse you bringing a high-powered weapon in an event like this?!
The good time spent here is with cards, not high-powered weapons! You've got no excuse for bringing that thing here!
Just because your idea of a good time is blowing up this place, doesn't mean I will condone such an action! Not to mention the potential for hurting people with an activity like that!
With the way you are brandishing that thing in a threatening manner, I would have no choice but to neutralize you with my Pokémon.
Your needless aggression leaves me with no options but to summon my Pokémon to my aid, in stopping you.
I can't believe it! The cultural influence really is shining through you! I'm curious though, do you wield your javelin as a weapon, or for sport?
My, you're essentially a foot soldier of the Ancient Western Empire in all but name! Although, what use do you have for a javelin? Is it for sport, or for warfare?
Oh, a Pokédex is a device that records all the creatures you encounter in your adventures and exploration. Think of it as similar to a live journal of everything you've encountered.

A Pokédex is essentially a record of all the creatures you've met. It not only records the name and appearance of those creatures, but also includes a small snippet of info. It's popular among children that travels a lot.
A disturbed spirit... in a place like this?! I didn't know this place had blood spilled on its ~background.surface~?!
I had no idea this place was haunted?! For a spirit like you to wander... you must have met a tragic end here!
You... destroyed your world?! Are you joking, or are you insinuating that you're capable of such a feat?!
What did you mean by destroyed your world? Are you saying... that you erased your world from existing?! You couldn't possibly be capable of that?!
Oh, I can see that now. I'm just curious as to what kind of reputation you have. When they mention your pseudonym, what would be the first thought that spring to their mind?
Would Twisted Fate happen to be your stage name? And what type of performances do you give out in that case? I can't quite put my finger on it.
I know that pirates attack were more common in the past but... A paper just fell out of your pocket, Nami.
The Golden Age of Piracy might be a distant memory by now... Oh, you might want to pick up that piece of paper, Nami.
The struggle never seems to end, doesn't it? There is some truth that being a revolutionary leader is an occupation that will last for the rest of your life...
This reminds me of a common saying among historians: Once you become a revolutionary leader, you will remain as one until the end of your life...
I see. Still, the ability to carry objects non-physically seems to be a common ability among psychics, even more so than the ability to talk with spirits.
I do know a psychic or two who can't communicate with spirits and what-not, but it seems to be common for psychics to be able to manipulate objects using only their mind...
Ever since that incident at Mt. Coronet, I've always wondered what goes on in the minds of people like you. Thinking that they can just play around with the mechanisms of the universe...

Just what is it that compels people to fall under the false belief that they can just change the structure of the universe based simply on their whims alone...? You're not the first person I've met like this...
The psychological process that leads a person to think of themselves as deities is beyond my understanding, but to meet a second person with such a delusion? This must be more common than I thought!
... That's quite the discomforting thought... I wonder how many of the people I met en route to this place were spies... What if there were spies in Sinnoh...?
... If that is true, then we can never let our guard down... I wonder who in this table could be a spy... How about in Sinnoh? Who are the spies there...?
A mercenary...? As in a professional soldier? What kind of training are you receiving? I've read that there are multiple types of mercenaries.
I've read about mercenaries throughout history, and apparently the term "mercenary" is an umbrella term, and there exists different subtypes of mercenaries. Which one are you in particular?
Oh, I see. Do you explore these planets in order to record qualities, Jim? Similar as to how Pokémon are recorded in Pokédex for information keeping?
Do you do any sort of record keeping for the entities living on the different planets, Jim? Do you have something similar to the Pokédex to facilitate this record keeping?
I do wonder if this is more than just a mere coincidence. I've noted that some people... are a little too eager to see professionally dressed women stripping naked...
Our presence here could be by design, you know. There seems to be an interest in professionally-dressed women partaking in... less than professionally-condoned activities.
It would depend on what you consider as magic, Lux... I've simply never heard of people who could manipulate light. Even psychics couldn't accomplish that as far as I know.
If you consider psychic powers as magic... but either way, this is the first time I've met a person who can manipulate light at will.
So you are a bounty hunter? I don't dislike violence, you know. And now it seems it will have to come to that.
You've pretty much confirmed my suspicious! Now, choose your next moves wisely. Make a mistake, and I will make the hunter the hunted!
You transformed into a human? Transformed from what? You're not some sort of divine apparition, are you?
If you're not a Pokémon, and you weren't originally a human, then you must be a manifestation of a god!
A bounty? Are you some sort of detective, or a ranger perhaps? I must say, you don't look like either...
You can't possible be a detective, could you? You don't have some... intrinsic qualities I've come to expect from detectives...
Well, it sounds like the pair of you are doing relatively well in your crew. At the very least, you didn't feel the need to disguise yourselves as men to your crew mates.
It seems that you have some degree of independence within your crew, and they respect your gender. So much so without having to pass yourself off as a man.
This Lord Moria of yours is a necromancer?! And based on your description, not a particularly peaceful one at that!
Zombies?! Then your Lord must be a necromancer! An evil one, I must add!
Only four members? That's quite small for a band, let alone a legion. I don't suppose you would mind discussing the tasks that your team undertake.
I was expecting you be a member of a legion, but four members is a lot lower than I had expected. What exactly is it that your team is responsible for?
Hardly the first time I've heard of a megalomaniac attempting to take over the world... Has anything been done to try to stop him though?
Another day, another egotist trying to claim the world as their property... Since you know of his machinations, I would presume that efforts have been made to stop him.
Ah, so you're a Pokémon ranger, Lyralei... Your outfit is vastly different from what I usually see from rangers, but I suppose you can perform your job just the same.
This is hardly the place I would expect to find a Pokémon ranger, but I suppose your profession requires some break away from the forest and the wild Pokémon living in it.
I've heard being a Pokémon ranger is somewhat of a thankless job, but I must admire that you help protect both wild Pokémon, and people strolling though the forests and what not.
I haven't heard of the Silver Civilization before, so let's start with that. Which region are they the closest to? Kalos perhaps, or even Galar?
I'm familiar with neither the Silvites or the Silver Civilization, so I must ask where in the would are they located? I wouldn't suppose they're far off from either Alola or Unova.
Well, from the sound of things, you seem to go on adventures often. It's still not clear to me what exactly your powers are, though.
I'm getting a slightly better picture of what your powers are, but it's still not clear enough for my liking... Perhaps you can explain your powers a little bit.
A... Grimm? Is that the name of a hostile neighboring country? That's the most common reason for a country to have conscripts.
If it's a matter of security concern, then I would presume that the Grimm is a hostile neighboring country....
I see. Where exactly is this hotel of yours, Charlie? I wouldn't mind visiting it some time, if I happen to come across it during my travels.
A hotel would be good as a family business... but I don't think you've mentioned the name or location of your hotel, Charlie. You never know, I might have stayed in it in the past.
You pilot a giant mechanical robot? What use would you have for such a thing? Doesn't seem particularly practical, or safe.
For what purpose would a giant mecha be useful for? Surely, there are better ways of transport... or safer options too...
Well... that's not quite right, Hilda. I'm a Pokémon trainer rather than a tactician. I'm not a member of the military to begin with.
I'd say that your analysis was spot on, Hilda, but you came to the wrong conclusion unfortunately. I'm a Pokémon trainer, rather than a military personnel.
I understand now. And how often do you get called upon to make medicines and remedies and such? Have you ever felt that they interfere with your research activities?
I take it that you have experience when it comes to concocting medicines and creating remedies, but is the demand for you enough that they take time away from your research?

Pyrrha Nikos? Why, you must trace your ancestry from the Ancient Western Empire, don't you!? It's amazing that the culture of such a glorious empire have survived for more than two and a half millennia! Your outfit is a testament to this fact.

Well, if I haven't heard of a name more befitting the Ancient Western Empire than "Pyrrha Nikos"... Is that the clothes you normally wear? It's quite remarkable that their cultural legacy survives to this day!

If I had read the name "Pyrrha Nikos" from an old census of the Ancient Western Empire, I wouldn't have thought it to be out of place...The mark of a great empire is a lasting cultural legacy, and I can see the cultural legacy in your attire.

state.text: ... Oh, I see what's happening here. If you know Morse code, Yuna, then use your blinking to send a coded message to me if you want me to separateyou from these spirits.
... I've seen how this plays out... Yuna, you can give me a nonverbal signal if you feel you need some assistance with this little emergency you have now.

case.state: So what have you been up to this past couple of years, Rosa? I must admit, I haven't been following the Unova League as much as I used to in the previous couple of years.
Now that we've cleared that part up, I'm anxious to know how your career has progressed since we last met, Rosa. I've been out of touch with the Unova League recently.
Grass-types are not a bad choice at all, but I find them to be a bit too vulnerable compared to other types. Anyway, what would you say is your signature Pokémon?
Grass-types can have quite a list of weaknesses, but they can be easily overcome by having a well-balanced team. On that note, which Pokémon is your main choice?
Humans with Pokémon-like features... Fascinating... Does your kind have any abilities that humans don't possess?
I must admit that I've never contemplated the existence of your kind before... Out of curiosity, since you seem to be aware of humans, how would you say you differ from a regular human?
Not only would you harm both men and Pokemon, but vastly changing the ecosystem in such a short time span ought to cause some severe changes to the climate.
You have yet to fully grasp the extent of damage your plan would cause. The climate itself could get disturbed if you go on with this foolishness. And I'm talking severe effects.

Do what exactly? Evaporate the water? You do realize that the water will just come back down as rain? At worst, you'll end up causing severe floods. The exact opposite of a solution for your "problem".
If you simply cause the water to evaporate, then it will condense and turn into precipitation. In other words, heavy rain, which then results in flooding, rendering your efforts futile.
A big group, huh? A large group like Team Magma must have a handful of Admins. Say, when's the last time an Admin acknowledged you directly?
If Team Magma is as big as you claim it to be, then I would presume that you would have Admins that are running the operations. Have you ever interacted with a Team Magma Admin?
Well, I'm not familiar with the Red Orb, but this is not the first time I've heard of such an attempt. It would be useful for you to know that Groudon cannot be contained with the Red Orb.
My knowledge of the Red Orb is scant, but I do recall reading that the Red Orb cannot fully contain the power and might of Groudon, as some people found out the hard way.
There's a difference between devotion and stubbornness, and you seem to fall into the latter. You and your Team Magma are like a colony of Durant following each other to a certain doom.

It's not the first time that a group of devotees have allowed their leaders to lead them to guaranteed destruction. There's such a thing as being too devoted, and your whole team qualifies under that banner.
Steven wouldn't downplay this threat... I was planning to visit Rustboro City soon, and this wouldn't be the first time I would have to thwart a scheme like this. My Garchomp and I will be ready.
Steven is not the person to underestimate a formidable threat like Team Magma. Coincidentally, I was headed for Rustboro City, so I'll be there once Team Magma's plan is set in motion.
Oh, you settled down and got married! That's great news! I hate to admit it, but I feel slightly jealous of your predicament.
Nobody is too old to get married and start a family, and I'm happy you accomplished that! I wish it was as easy for me as it was for you.
You were... summoned? By whom, and for what purpose? Was it a psychic, or even a Hex Maniac?
Now, why would someone summon a ghost? I'm guessing it's either a psychic, or a particularly deranged Hex Maniac... but for what reason?
Do you mean to say you're blind? I'm astonished! How would one go about even learning to gain the sense of sight using magic?
You can't see without the use of your magic? I can't imagine how it must be like, being born blind and learning to give yourself artificial sight using magic.
I see... Sounds like animism with a bit of fatalism mixed in. Say, if Silvites had no fear of death, how is the concept of death depicted in the arts?
A somewhat pessimistic fatalist belief, perhaps with traces of an animistic belief thrown in the mix. How is death regarded in the popular consciousness, if it was not feared?
That's fascinating! I didn't even know such a thing was possible for a human, or for light to act like that even. I can't wrap my head around the concept of hard light.
Using light like a solid object... Sounds very simple, but the physics of it all eludes me. And to think that a human could do it naturally... It's such a fascinating discovery!
You're collecting something more valuable than a gym badge? What would that be exactly?
I haven't got the faintest clue as to what you're collecting that could be worth more than a gym badge.
I suppose you're right. I should look for your owner first. It would be disrespectful for me to catch someone else's Pokémon. Would you happen to know who your owner is?
The fact that you're clothed and groomed is a giveaway that you're not a wild Pokémon... Now, would you happen to know where your owner is? You need to be returned before you cause any trouble.
Hmm... If you're not Galarian, then you must be for Unova... or am I still off the mark with that guess?
Are you a Unovan then? Their accents can be a bit alike. Was I correct this time around?
Curious... I've never heard of those Pokémon before. I wonder if they're endemic to your home region, or if it's just the regional names for commonly-known Pokémon.
None of those Pokémon you mentioned rings a bell for me. If those are the local names in your region, perhaps I know those Pokémon under a different name...
Hmm, is that so? That throws a wrench at all those folktales. You must have originated from an egg, then? Do you still remember where the egg that bore you originated from?
That's all those folktales debunked then... I would suppose you were born out of an egg instead? Do you have any idea of who or what was responsible for your egg's creation?
Oh, what a silly mistake from my part! Still, you're involved in the video game industry, while also being a warrior? I do wonder what kind of monsters you fight in particular?
A laughable but honest mistake, really. Anyway, you're a staff member of a video game company, but also a monster hunter of some kind? Can you describe to me what exactly it is that you battle?
Artificial ghosts, you say? Are they like Golett who are created for a specific purpose, or like Banette, who are artificially borne out of pure hatred?
And under what manner are these artificial ghosts created? Are they specially-crafted guardians like the Golett line, or an unintentional by-product of human activity just like the Banette line?
I see. Is it true that nurses can have hectic work schedules? Working long hours in a stressful environment, no wonder you needed a break from things.

If my knowledge of hospitals are correct, then work must be very tiring. Work hours tend to be unforgiving, in a job that is already unforgiving to start with. I can easily understand why you needed to clear out all your stress.
Oh, I do apologize for the confusion. Not all magic users are called Hex Maniacs, only the quirkier ones. There's not really much stigma surrounding Hex Maniacs, aside from their weirdness.
I see there's been a misunderstanding. Hex Maniac is nothing more than a subset of magic users that behave weirdly and seem to be a part of a hive mind. Aside from their quirkiness, they're harmless.

It truly is a magnificent piece of technology, but from the looks of things, it might require a lot of time and effort to remove that entire suit. I take it that you'll be removing it one component at a time, and will be doing so for the duration of this game?

I have no doubts that your suit is a complex masterpiece of engineering, which makes me worry that taking it off will be a cumbersome exercise. I can only presume that it can be removed piece by piece, and such is your stripping strategy.
A religion that allows this much sexual freedom is quite rare indeed. But, there must be some sort of threshold of what is allowed and what is considered excessively sinful.

That's quite... liberal, especially compared to most religions I've heard of. Regardless, there must be some sexual activities that even your church will not tolerate. Ones that cannot be forgiven by a simple prayer.
I must admit I didn't quite get any of those names, but it does sound like your kingdom neighbors the Kalos region... Anyhow, wouldn't your presence here potentially cause a diplomatic incident?
Those names you prattled is a beyond my knowledge, but I'll continue presuming that you are the neighbor of Kalos. Speaking of which, your participation in a game like this can cause a scandal, no?
I see... Your Botan is actually a Swinub rather than an Emboar. Swinub is a common house pet back home in Sinnoh.
Based on your description, it seems your Botan is actually a Swinub rather than an Emboar as I initially thought. I should have known, given that Swinub is popular among Sinnohlian children.
You mostly respond to the threats of Pokémon then? Speaking of Pokémon threats, I don't remember your organization being present during that nasty business at Mount Coronet quite a while back.

I suppose having separate divisions to deal with human threat and Pokémon threat is more efficient. Although, I don't remember encountering any of your agents during the Mount Coronet crisis some time ago.

I take it that you're the younger child between the two of you then. You might have the luxury and family name, but you don't have the actual power that comes with the name... Or at least, that's what I've read up on.

So you're the younger child, I suppose. History hasn't really been kind to younger children. They do get all the luxuries, decadence, and what not, but with the older child wielding all the real power.
Is there no way that knowledge can be recovered? If such a process were to be rediscovered, it would be quite a revolution to the field of medicine!

Just by the phrasing of your answer, it's safe to assume that the technique has been lost to history... Although, is there some form of inscription that might reveal clues to the mechanisms of the process?

That indeed makes sense. I've not well-versed in sport myself, and I'm definitely not well-versed in partaking in one. If you challenge me in any sport, you'd probably win easily... Except maybe cycling...

I'm showing my lack of sports knowledge asking such a silly question like that. I can't recall the last time I participated in any form of organized sport, and I would perform horribly in any sport regardless, expect cycling perhaps...
How fascinating! Up to what extent can you manipulate electricity? Can you use it as a power source, or perhaps even as a weapon?
An incredible ability! What type of utilities does your ability have? Can you use it to power an electric grid? On a smaller scale, can it be used for self-defense?

state.text: Before they die? I don't know what that's supposed to entail, but I'm not taking any chances with you! If you're here to claim our souls, then you've come at the wrong time!
At this point, you've not made you intentions sufficiently clear, and I have no choice but to take drastic measures against you! I'm not going to let you take any of us to hell.

case.state: That's an interesting ability, but it seems to be a passive one. Does your boar have any active attack?
I can see the utility of that passive move, but I'm curious about the active attack moves a boar can learn.
I've not heard of this Canterlot before, but I'm more interested in the Equestrian magic that you mentioned in passing. What can you tell me about that?
Canterlot and Camp Everfree are not places that are familiar to me, but what's piqued my interest is this Equestrian magic... I would like to know more about it.
I figured that would be the most sensible approach. Having a ninth gym wouldn't hurt at all. More gyms for trainers to challenge is always a net positive.

Well, best of luck to you then. Setting up a gym in a new city might be a bit challenging, but at the end of the day, it would be very convenient for the locals. No longer do they have to travel to a different town just to get a gym badge.
Would you say that the extraterrestrial fauna are more dangerous than those found in Earth? The extraterrestrial entities I've encountered seem to be quite docile.
Just how dangerous are the creatures that you've encountered on other planets? My experience with extraterrestrials are somewhat limited, but they're not notably difficult to befriend.
I see that you're not a Pokémon trainer, but rather some sort of a soldier, and you participate in a different type of battle than I anticipated. Would that conclusion be correct?
I must have misinterpreted what battles meant in your context. I take it that you're a soldier, and a veteran one at that, for you to be experienced with a bow and arrow.

Grass-types are a tricky thing to pull off. Strong against Ground, Rock, and Water-types, but weak against almost everything else. I know you have the tactical acumen to pull it off, and this will serve a great lesson to young trainers about type strategy.

Among all the Pokémon types, grass-types requires a bit more know-how to utilize properly. Having a lot of weaknesses, you would need to utilize to full extent of your knowledge if you are to provide a challenge to young trainers.

Right, that would be cause for concern. On the other hand, it should attract the attention of new trainers to your gym. I would expect the first handful of weeks or so to be quite a busy time for you.

On one hand, a great crowd like that can be disruptive. On the other hand, among that crowd would be prospective trainers who would be very keen on battling their idol. You'll get quite a huge turnout of trainer for your first months in the gym.

I see. You couldn't stay away from Pokémon battles for long. I do get that sensation from time to time, the nagging feeling beckoning you to participate in a battle. Hopefully, becoming a gym leader should fulfill that need.

Your lust for battle was too much to ignore. When I go on extended breaks from battling, I also begin to feel empty, with my heart longing for another glorious battle. As a gym leader, you're hoping your duties would satiate you.

That's a quite the dilemma, isn't it? Go for a career path that you love, or choose one that will be more financially beneficial... Or go for a third option and go for both. Have you made a decision on the matter yet?

On one hand, you're heart says that becoming a gym leader is the right thing for you. On the contrary, your head is saying that becoming an actress is the better option. Unless you decide to do both simultaneously, you would have to make a choice.

If you've been feeling quite stressed lately, I would suggest taking a break every now and then. You're free to visit me in my villa whenever I'm there during the summer. Many of the other gym leaders also visit often too.

There's no shame in taking an extended leave from time to time. Tell you what, if you ever need a place to relax, you should visit me again in Undella Town during the summer. The other gym leaders will also be there.
That would entirely depend on whether you use your inner drive for good or bad. Tell me, what's the furthest you've gone to get something you wanted?
People can channel their inner drive for a specific cause, and you have a rather strong one. Can you think of a specific occasion where your drive to obtain something was at its strongest?
These true dragons that you speak of, would they be the same dragons that ravaged and destroyed the Unova region in the far past? It is said that they have powers over lightning and ice.

Legends spoke that two Legendary Dragons waged war against each other: one an electric-type, the other a fire-type. Their battles were so violent that it destroyed the Unova region. Could these be the same dragons you speak of?
Volcanic wasteland... Are volcanic eruptions a frequent issue where you are? Has there been a relatively recent eruptive event?
If your region is surrounded by volcanic wasteland, then it must be very active volcanically. Has it been an issue in your region's recent history?
No need to be humble, since that does sound quite the amazing ability. Can you give me an example where that ability of yours came into play?
That's a very impressive ability! I wouldn't be at all surprised if there's been more than one occasion where your ability proved to be vital. I would be interested in hearing that story.
Diversifying your Pokémon team! Sounds like a great plan! What comes after that? Breeding for desirable traits and attributes? Teaching your Pokémon a varied move pool?
A varied and diverse team is a step on the right direction, as I can attest to. After that, I presume that you'll be participating in more battles to make your team more powerful and experienced.
I'm not really one for collecting gems... but I was actually talking about gyms, not gems. I was wondering if you were running a Pokémon gym.
Not gem leader, but gym leader, as in Pokémon gyms. Although, to answer your question, I don't really have any gems in my possession. I'm not one for collecting them.
Ah, so it's a natural talent rather than a learned skill. Not only that, but it's also a manipulation of matter by the mind... How did you realize that you possessed such skill?
An example of mind over matter, one which is gained at birth rather than studied... How fascinating! In your case, how did you find out that you had the ability to manipulate aether?
He sounds very skittish. Does he normally run off like that, or is there something in this table that spooked him away?
What would you say is the general temperament of your pet? For the moment, it seems that something in this table was undesirable for him, or it might just be his sense of exploration.
What kind of literature have you taken a liking to? i bet there's a piece or two that you would consider as your favorite.
There are plenty of literary pieces worth analyzing, and due to the breadth of the field, there's something to appeal to everyone. What genre of literature appealed to you?
What an incredible machine! In terms of scope, how many capabilities does Cupil have for battle, both offensively and defensively?

I'm starting to get a good grasp on the technological capabilities of the Silvites. I suppose it wouldn't be unreasonable for me to expect that Cupil has quite the breadth when it comes to utilities for battle.
I don't believe I've ventured to that region before. If I were to visit your region, what location would you say is a good place to start?
Your region seems fascinating, even if I haven't visited it before. On that note, what would you consider to be a must-visit location for someone looking to know more about the local culture?
That sounds horrible! has anything been done to close those portals? If left unchecked, this inter-dimensional entities could overrun this world!
Something must be done about this! We can't let hostile creatures from another dimension overrun ours. Even worse, this situation might even deteriorate even further!
Horror novels, huh? I haven't had much exposure to the horror genre in the past, so what would you recommend?
Although I've read plenty of books, I haven't touched up at horror novels at all. Is there a particular book or theme that you would recommend?
Hmm... a sensor issue perhaps? Or we could look at this positively and just think that your generator exceeded your own expectations.
You would know what's possible and what isn't, so perhaps it was nothing more than a defect on your generator. It could also be a particularly effective generator on the other hand.
So, how exactly did you get into painting, Rin? Were you already into painting before you lost your arms?
It's quite unusual for someone with your condition to pick up painting as your hobby. I'm guessing that you were already a painter before you lost your arms.
Wait, what? B-but... That's not how this game is meant to be played!
What's this...? What sort of a strategy are you employing, Moon?! This is utterly baffling!
This is... a bit of an alternate strategy that I didn't think to be practical... That's the polite way of putting it, at least...
Taking off even your legs to go just one more round? That's the fighting spirit, Emi!
Your determination is remarkable, Emi! Staying in the fight at all costs is what makes a champion
T-this is quite a transformation! What unseen forces are at play here?
T-this is quite a transformation! What sort of powers are at play here?
Huh?! What is this? Is this... the dark powers of the mythical Shadow Realm?! (This is fascinating!)
Huh?! What is this? Is this... the dark powers of the mythical Shadow Realm?! Q-quick, someone take notes!
Huh?! What is this? Is this... the dark powers of the mythical Shadow Realm?! This must be documented! Where's my notepad?!
Ha, what's the matter, Guzma? Trying to hype us up for something? Please, I'm sure it'll be as underwhelming as Team Skull.
Ha, what's the matter, Guzma? Trying to hype us up for something? Please, I'm sure it'll be as underwhelming as your little criminal organization.
What's the matter, Guzma? Trying to overcompensate for something you're about to show us?
Are you trying to hype this up or something Guzma? Come on, I'm sure it's as small as we're all thinking.
You're the big bad leader of Team Skull? Or are you a small leader...
You may be the big bad leader, but I'm sure you also have a small member.
You may be the big bad leader, but I'm sure you also have a small member, if you catch my drift.
Misato... Even if I'm only catching a glimpse of your panties, I'm still finding the visual aid helpful...
Misato... Even if I'm only catching a glimpse of your panties, I'm still finding the view helpful...
Misato... think you can, u-uh... spread your knees a little?
Misato... think you can, u-uh... spread your knees for me?
Misato, you might want to close up a little; we can see your...
Misato, you might want to close up a little; your, uh...
Misato, you might want to close up a little; you're showing us a little more than I suspect you intended...
Misato, you might want to close up a little; you're showing us a little more than I suspect you intended...
Misato, you might want to close up a little; you're showing us a little more than I suspect you meant to...
Misato, you might want to close up a little; you're showing us a little more than I suspect you meant to...
Those are some cute panties you got there, Misato! Hahaha, oops...
Pink, Misato? Hahaha, they look good.
Those are some cute panties you're wearing, Misato! Hahaha, oops...
Pink, Misato? Don't worry, they look good.
Pink, Misato? I would have guessed purple, or maybe a dark red.
Pink, Misato? I would have guessed something a little more red.
Pink, Misato? I would have guessed something closer to a nice purple.
Pink, Misato? Aren't we a little old for those?
Pink, Misato? Aren't we a little old for that?
Haha, you're never too old to wear pink. Right, Misato?
You're showing us your panties when you do that, Misato... Unless... that was intentional?
You're showing us your panties when you do that, Misato... Oh, but I don't think anyone minds...
Pink, Misato? I stopped wearing that color years ago...
Pink? Is that your favorite color, Misato?
Pink? I would have thought that a woman your age would be wearing something a little more mature...
From Arceus, there came two powerful beings: Dialga, the Temporal Pokémon, and Palkia, the Spatial Pokémon...
Take them off Guzma, and admit defeat!
Looks like it's obvious who the winner will be between the two of us, Guzma; your boasts will have been for naught.
Ugh... To think that I'm about tied with him is... Well, I suppose that says a lot about my skill level at this game...
Ugh... To think that I'm about tied with him is... I really must have gotten ahead of myself with this whole thing...
(Ugh... And to think he still had his pants on... I really let this whole thing slip away from me...)
(Ugh; how is he only removing his pants? I suppose we're both coming down to the wire...)
As regrettable as it is to think about, at least this will... offer me some visual stimulation...
Arrgh, don't look at me while you do that, you rotten punk.
My my, N, you sure have an impressive head of hair! Quite like myself, if I must say.
Well, N, that's quite the head of hair; what kind of conditioner do you use?
I see that you too keep your hair well kept, N; kudos!
Well, you certainly have your hair-care down to a science!
I too take good care of my hair. Want to know the secret? My conditioner is made with honey from a Vespiquen hive!
I know they say that the best trainers wear hats, N, but I hope I'm proof enough that that's just a myth!
Oh, just take it off, silly. Your hair looks fine, N! Hee hee.
Come on, N, relax a little bit and let your hair down!
That cheap thing? Please, I bet you bought that from a children's accessory shop... Or stole it from one.
Why would you associate with the likes of Team Skull? Don't you have standards or something?
Ugh, just looking at thing is... unsettling... Do you have any idea what that symbol stands for?
Ugh, just looking at thing is... unsettling... That symbol represents thievery and arrogance.
No one can possibly take you seriously with that thing around your neck anyway, Guzma.
So, it all began with Arceus, or as the ancient texts call, The Original One! Let's see if I can't recite this correctly...
So, it all began with Arceus, or as the ancient texts call, The Original One! Now the texts form a sort of poem here, but they say...
After Dialga and Palkia created all matter, Arceus created Three Lake Spirits, known as Uxie, Azelf, and Mesprit.
I did notice that the clothes store had a male... Hey, what was that flash?!
You know, my taste of clothes had caught on in Sinnoh... Did anyone else see a flash?!
There's that disembodied flash again! What in the world is going on here, Jotaro?!
That flash is definitely originating from you, Jotaro! Please, explain yourself.
I can imagine that in the future, space stations and colonies will be treated the same way as ancient ruins are today: valuable sources of artifacts, and the sites of significant developments.
It's safe to presume that abandoned space colonies would be protected, in the same way that cities and settlements of civilizations past have become important historical heritage sites.
I'm a fan of cycling myself. I travel on my bike when I have the time, but due to my busy schedule, it can be difficult to find time even for that.
I would love to have a more exercise-heavy routine, but I'm quite busy most of the time. I ride my bike from time to time, but that's the most I can manage.
Huh? Chihiro? Are you running away from the fight?
Huh? Chihiro? You can't run from your fears; you gotta stand up and confront them!
Huh? Chihiro? Are you... quitting? Right when we're getting to the fun part too...
Oh, it's evolving! This is always a exciting moment to watch.
Well, what a pleasant surprise. I didn't know Butterfree could evolve still...
On that note, do you publish your programs, Chihiro? That's what programmers do, right? Publish their programs?
Have you ever tried releasing your programs for public use, Chihiro? They might prove quite useful, you know.
The best way of conquering your fear is to face them directly. It's easier said than done, and it's amazing that you're accomplishing it.
We have nothing to fear but fear itself. The only way to conquer fear is by conquering it ourselves, and this is exactly the way to do it.
I'm not saying that you should go naked in front of strangers more often, but doing this would help you conquer your fear of nudity. Desensitizing yourself always helps.
Yet on the contrary, I know a runway celebrity, and she seems to have all the free time in the world. I know, not the same profession, but still...
Or perhaps your schedule might not be constraining at all. It might depend on the time of year, for example, and similar other seasonal factors...
What... What kind of illusion trick is this?!
Is that... There has to be some sort of explanation for this... Optical illusion perhaps?
That's interesting... A ghost! Stay back, Miko, I'll let Spiritomb handle this situation.
How intriguing... Don't panic, Miko. My Spiritomb is very effective in dealing with ghosts.
That's stirs up a lot of... Where did that ghost even come from? No matter, my Spiritomb shall make quick work of her!

I am well aware that I'm not getting as much sleep as I need due to my devotion to my work, but your eyes... I dare say that you spend more time doing academic work than sleeping. Yes... it has to be!

With how little sleep you must be getting, I can only estimate how much academic work you are doing up during the middle of the night. It must have taken months... no, years to accumulate eye bags that large.
Ah! What did you shoot at, Aimee?!
Be careful with that thing, Aimee?! What were you even aiming at?!
Oh, not this entire ordeal again!
What possessed you to think that repeating this stunt is a good idea?!
Didn't I already told you to not do this again?!
This can't go on for the entire game! This must be stopped before the situation gets worse!
This is getting out of hand! Something must be done about this!
You do realize that you can't do this for the entire game, Aimee? Your targets are getting smaller and smaller.
How is it taking this long for those bullets to fall?... Did you hit something?!
Where did the bullets go?! Did you make a mistake in aiming?!
The amount of time the bullets have been in the air... It's highly irregular... unless...
... I suppose nothing is impossible if you have a complete disregard for self-preservation...
... I should have known better than to expect common sense from someone like you...

Coffin? Who mentioned anything about a coffin? Anyway, like I was saying, if you don't put your knife down and disperse, I would have no choice but to bring out my Pokémon, and my Spiritomb will do easy work of you.

I don't know if this coffin conversation is meant to be a diversion, but nothing can take my focus away from scattering you, ghost! Luckily, I've brought all my Pokémon with me, and Spiritomb is the perfect match for a violent spirit like you!

There's no point in attempting to talk your way out of this, you disturbed soul. I have all my Pokémon with me, not that it would matter, since my Spiritomb should be able to banish you out of the mortal world.
... A Varimorph? So you're a Pokémon then? One that can walk and talk... What region are you from? I don't think I've ever seen your kind before?

... I've never heard of a Varimorph before, but I'm guessing you're a Pokémon from a faraway region... I must say, meeting a Pokémon that is capable of both Bipedalism and Human speech is a bit... surreal.
I see. What kind of applications do you have for a syringe of that size, if I may ask?
It truly is an impressive feat of manufacturing, but what kind of situations would necessitate the use of a syringe that large?
I see what you mean. How many Pokémon do you take care of then? Seems like you're capable of taking care of quite a handful.
It must have been a bit premature calling you a Pokémon trainer, but I still wonder how many of them you take care of.
Ah, but you're not entirely without purpose, Galatea. Arceus chose this fate for you to act as a warning to anybody who would dare challenge its authority. A living warning, if you will.

It wouldn't be the first time I've read the story of a deity turning a human into a monster as punishment. Deities seem to be fond of using insolent humans to set an example. You're quite the example to set, I must say.

Kill a human and their name will soon be forgotten. Turn a human into an undying monster, and you have a lesson every human will never forget. I suppose this is now the purpose Arceus have given you in this life.
Abstract Expressionism? Is that a recent art movement, Yusuke? It's the first time I would have heard of it.
I'm not knowledgeable at all about this Abstract Expressionism movement, nor am I aware of any works of art that falls under this movement...
I take it that you're not from Kalos. Anyhow, where is this Atlas, and what can you tell me about it?
I hardly know of a place called Atlas, so I doubt that's in Kalos. I am curious about that place though, now that you mentioned it.
Well, that's enough talk about your appearance, I suppose. Although, based on your physique, I would guess that you're a boxer, or perhaps even a fighting-type trainer.
I'm sorry, I shouldn't be judging a stranger based on their appearance, but I must say that your physique wouldn't look out of place for a boxer, or a psychic-type trainer.
If you're not a psychic, then you must be a Hex Maniac then. I must say, you're a lot more affable than most Hex Maniacs I've seen.
Magic attacks, but you're not a psychic? Could you be a Hex Maniac? I wouldn't have been able to figure out otherwise, since you're nothing like them. For one thing, you actually talk to people.

Oh, was my comment too awkward? Well, it's just that your eyes stood out a lot, and it reminded me of some prodigious trainers I met. It also reminds me of some violent fanatics I fought years ago, come to think of it.

Was my observation too direct? I can't help but remember the piercing gaze of that young trainer, but at the same time, it reminds me of the crazed stare of a power-hungry lunatic, the type I took down many years ago...
A doctor, then. I must say, I've seen all types of medical professionals, but I don't believe I've seen that type of suit before. What exactly does your suit do?
Bright red outfit, a hoodie with horns, a pair of gloves... Very suspicious indeed...
Any outfit that includes a pair of horns and gloves ought to be viewed as suspicious... There truly is something off about you...
From what I can recall, genies have the same biological needs and functions as humans, but are also capable of magic, such as teleportation and transformation.
Despite being physiologically and biologically the similar to humans, genies have supernatural abilities. Among those are teleportation and transformation.
Oh, a character modeler... So do you create the character design, or simply create the model using an existing design?
A character modeler, not a fashion model, got it. Anyway, when you say character modeler, do you create the design too? Or just the model itself?
Your staff has healing properties, Angela? Just how effective is it in curing diseases and injuries?
Did you mention that you use your staff for healing? As to what extent can it be used effectively?
I was indeed wondering why I've never met a trainer from the Orre province before. It's not particularly far from Sinnoh either, so the lack of gyms would be a good explanation.
I've heard that some provinces are too desolate or remote for Pokémon gyms to make practical sense. I suppose Orre is sparsely populated as well, so it all makes sense.
So, what exactly do you do in this Fairy Tale Guild of yours, Lucy? Do you simply tell fairy tales to the other members, or do you do literary analysis as well?
I do find the concept of a Fairy Tale Guild intriguing, Lucy. What type of fairy tales do the members read? I'm interested in the diversity of sources and time periods for the pieces.
Oh, I didn't mean that as an insult... or a compliment... Anyway, since you were allowed here, you must be of age... What exactly do you study, Natsuki?
It seems you took my comments the wrong way... I have no doubts you're old enough to be in a game like this... I just wonder what it is that you are currently studying, Natsuki...
So, you're a hologram then? That's how I interpreted what you just said...
A "digital voicebank" represented by a hologram seems like an apt way of describing you... That's my interpretation anyway...
If you're interested, I can take you around in Unova, as I'm planning to take a vacation there shortly... Have you been to Unova before, Janet?
I'm sure you will find Unova to be a fascinating place, Janet... That is assuming you've been there before. Have you, or have you not?
"Animals"? Is that another term for Pokémon? Anyhow, what kind of animals do you train?
Are "animals" the local term for Pokémon where you're from? Either way, I'm curious which animals you have in your team.
The tenets of alchemy was found to be flawed, and acceptance of it slowly died out. It has been replaced by chemistry, which is verifiable and replicable using the scientific method.
It's been said that a field of study is only as useful as the result it creates, and for the case of alchemy, there appeared to be none. Nowadays, chemistry is seen to be the more logical field.
I see. Are you going to be studying evolutions too, like Professor Rowan did? I've heard that a new type of evolution was discovered in Kalos. It might be of interest to you.
Evolution is quite a fascinating subject indeed. It's amazing how much we still don't know about it. I've heard that there's been a breakthrough in Kalos, and you should check it out.
If you ever go to Kalos, I've heard that Lumiose City is a good place to go. It is the City of Love after all. Just don't get too distracted in there.
There are a lot of cities and towns worth visiting in Kalos, but Lumiose City is the highlight. People there are very passionate, but do take care to keep your passion in check.
Team Magma? Pardon me, but I don't think I've heard of any organization with that name before. Would you mind explaining what the goals of this organization are?
That's an unfamiliar entity for me, I'm afraid. I'm still curious what exactly it is that your Team Magma does.
Indeed, it would be quite a sad sight to see someone walking alone in a place like that. If I were to go there, I wouldn't have anyone to accompany me either...
That makes the two of us, then... I have plans to go to Kalos, but I don't have anyone coming with me. I'll be walking the streets alone in that case.
I heard they serve Poke Puffs instead of Poffins in Kalosian cafes... Come to think of it, if we eat together in cafes, we might get mistaken for a romantic couple...
Instead of Poffins, they sell Poke Puffs, with each cafe having a different twist. Can you imagine if we ate out at a cafe together? People might assume we're on a date.
I don't see the harm if we pretend that we are girlfriends... After all, we don't have genuine feelings for each other... We're only pretending.
There's nothing wrong if we did an act like that... As long as we're not actually harboring romantic affections for each other, then nothing would come out of it.
You do present some valid concerns, but you are on the verge of being a professor, so that should lessen the impact of it. Our age gap isn't that large, if that's what you're concerned about...

Rumors are something that we should always watch out for, but in this day and age, rumors will be spread regardless of what happens. Though if it's the age gap you're worried of, I don't think we'll be in trouble...
I knew that a romantic relationship with you is just a pipe dream, but I wanted to get it off of my chest. I probably should have kept it to myself...
I expected that you wouldn't take my revelation kindly, but I had deluded myself into thinking that things might go differently... In hindsight, I was better off not admitting it to you, Dawn...
Well, that sure does sound like a noble cause, but whom in particular are you avenging?
As long as you're upholding the law, then I suppose you can't really do wrong. Just out of curiosity, but who are you currently avenging?
That place does sound grim. It's almost like a time capsule to the dark side of coastal communities. There must be something in the water to make everything in that place hostile.
Pirates, Sea Monsters... In this day and age? No wonder that place sounds like a complete dump to live in. If the pasts suggests anything, the water in that place might be contaminated.

My, that sounds a lot like my experience when I was your age. My advice is that you need to find a balance between your studies and your relaxation. Once you burn yourself out, it's quite difficult to recover.

Well, that's very relatable, especially when I was your age. As tantalizing as it might sound, you need to take a break every now and then. All work and no play can actually decrease your productivity, you know.
Excuse me, but you want my XP? What would... That's not a vulgar euphemism, is it?
What did you mean by my XP? I dearly hope that wasn't a code word for something obscene!

state.text: A goblin, huh... If the folktales are to be trusted, then my assessment was right... somewhat. You goblin are mischievous little troublemakers.
There's more than a handful of oral traditions regarding goblins, and they all claim that your kind cannot be trusted in any circumstances.

case.state: That's a fair enough explanation, even though I still deem it a bit unorthodox. Have you mentioned yet where your temple is located? It might be an interesting place to visit soon.
That does make sense, even if your motivation is a bit odd... Nevertheless, I'm curious as to where exactly your temple is located. I might learn a thing or two should I visit it in the future.
It would be a shame if your technology is used exclusively for wartime usage, and sequestered from use of the general public. Worse yet, it even ended up being used as a weapon...

It seems unethical to withhold such a groundbreaking medical device from public medical use, for the benefit of the military complex. If such a device is perverted to something harmful, then that would be a tragedy.
Is there a reason you insist on wearing that box, ~myriam~? It does not look practical at all - it limits your field of vision and restricts your upper body movement.

I would suppose you have a perfectly logical explanation as to why you're wearing a cardboard box like that, ~myriam~. Whatever the benefit is, it has to offset the fact that it's limiting your range of motion.
I can't say I've ever heard of Uno before. How similar is Uno to poker and other commonly-played card games?
Uno? Is that at all similar to Poker? I'm not that knowledgeable with card games as a whole.
... I do recall meeting a Meowth that can walk and talk like a human once... Team Rocket, was it?
... Come to think of it, this is not the first time I've met a bipedal Pokémon capable of human speech... Like that Meowth that tried to steal the lustrous orb...
I wonder if you hail from a region I haven't heard of, ~name~. It seems every year, they keep discovering a new inhabited region.
Are you the human version of a shiny Pokémon, ~name~? Or are there other people with the same complexion as you?
Are you wearing fake color, ~name~? That can't be it...
Ah, so you were deceived, Catria? I'd allow you to leave if it were up to me, but you should really conduct due diligence next time.
Ah, so you were deceived, Catria? I'd allow you to leave if it were up to me, but you should be more careful next time.
Ah, so you were deceived, Catria? I'd allow you to leave if it were up to me, but you should really ask questions first next time.
Wait, Catria, are you saying somebody by the name of Palla lied to you? That's... that's low... You can tell this Palla that she's hereby suspended from Pokémon League battles until further notice.
Wait, Catria, are you saying somebody by the name of Palla lied to you? That's... that's low... Liars make the worst Pokémon trainers.
Reserved for future Neptune Interaction. Report this bug if you see this message.
This reminds me of the time a youngster told me that his shorts were too tight. I was in the process of helping him when his mother suddenly arrived and told me to stay away from her son...
Hu-hu-Huh?! What did you just do? You meant all of that? I-I-I'll leave ~player~ alone! I'll leave him alone, I promise!
Hu-hu-Huh?! What did you just do? You meant all of that? I-I-I'll leave ~player~ alone! I'll leave her alone, I promise!
You're a porn star? Please tell me you're not recording any part of this game.
I see, so there's some truth on that story... Hold on, did I mistakenly walk into one of your movie shoots?
Oh, that's horrible, Jessie! I'm regretting asking about that now.
I'm sorry I asked about that, Jessie. I wouldn't have asked you to talk about it had I known!
... I'd rather not... slow down the game by telling a long story like that... Besides, the next hand is about to start...
