... I think... I'd rather have the next round start immediately... We have some ways to go in this game... and my story would delay it...
... I... I was expecting... tips on how I can get men to date... how I can be more approachable to men, Jessie, and not that...
... I thought you would be discussing the... emotional part of relationship-building, Jessie...
(Are people really misinterpreting my staring at them as a sign of attraction? How long has this been the case?)
(How am I supposed to keep watch of the other players without them thinking that I'm attracted to them?)
(These sensations I'm feeling right now... Am I really attracted to women, or is it because of Jessie's figure?)
(Seeing Jessie's body like this... My body is reacting differently than I would expect...)
Oh, Jessie... This sight... is much better than I had imagined...
You're shaved as well... It looks so good without hair...
I can't believe I lived my whole life without seeing this...
(I'm feeling tingly again... I should wait when I get home before masturbating again...)
(Should I admit to Jessie that I'm enjoying this view?)
A fight?! Why, this is very unbecoming from both of you!
Ladies, you can't fight here. This is the ~background~!
When I said I wanted a competitive game, I meant in poker, not in fistfights.
Well... this is a bit out of nowhere... and possibly inappropriate...
(This sight... is stirring something in me. I don't understand... why am I feeling slippery down there while watching this?
(Sweet Arceus, that looks amazing! I wish that was me!)
Someone who wanted their own image of the universe, of course! If you craved that much power, then why let that hurdle stop you!
If you're really determined to replace this universe with another universe molded by your own hands, then not even the creation trio can scare you away from your ambitions!

{big}When this world was made, Dialga and Palkia appeared. Apparently, there was one more Pokémon that appeared at the same time. A Pokémon with as much power as Dialga and Palkia... But also one whose name was never to be spoken--Giratina! It's said to lurk in another world... A world on the opposite side of ours... According to an ancient document, time, space, and antimatter, or what combined we call the world, shall be born when Arceus stands on the Mystri Stage. This is where one might say, "The lead enters the Mystri Stage at last." All my study of ruins and Pokémon mythology in Sinnoh may have been to bring you up on this stage here today... Depicted on the Mystri Stage are the Pokémon that shaped this world. The circle in the middle is Arceus, the origin of it all... {!reset}

This cave painting...It's always been described this way. The light in the center represents either Dialga or Palkia appearing at the Spear Pillar. The three lights around it were thought to be Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf. May I continue? But, then, I realized that there may be another way of interpreting this. Could this triangle of lights actually represent a different trio? Could they be Dialga, Palkia, and Giratina instead? And the large light at their center. Does it represent something else? Could it be what created this world of ours? May I continue for a little bit longer? Thank you for listening to my theory. Do you know of the ancient Plates they find all over Sinnoh? One of them had this engraved on it. Two beings of time and space set free from the Original One. I think this quote, too, points to the presence of another Pokémon. A Pokémon even more powerful than Dialga or Palkia. Does that sound plausible to you? I'm not quite sure how Giratina fits into this scheme of things, but... It's said that in the Distortion World, neither time nor space were stable. I think that tells us something about Giratina, the only Pokémon there. It must have been as powerful as Dialga and Palkia, the rulers of time and space. In some way, though, Giratina has to have a power opposite of theirs. I'm sorry this is so long. May I say one last bit? A long time ago, I wonder what sort of person painted this? Dialga's Roar of Time...Palkia's Spacial Rend...To the people back then, those Pokémon really must have appeared to rule over time and space. Seeing them must have shaken the people to their very core. This painting represents those feelings of awe, wonder, and everything else. It passed that memory to countless people, eventually becoming a myth...That's what I believe as a researcher of myths. I think I let myself get carried away and talked for far too long. I'm sorry, and thank you.
Oh, you were describing a mother ship. That's certainly interesting... Was this ship headed to any particular destination, or was it just sailing aimlessly across the seas?
If your description is accurate, then that ship must be one of the largest in human history! I just wonder, what was the destination of a ship that massive?
I suppose if you're curious just to read the theory itself, there's a summary that stretches three or so pages... That should be easy simple enough for a lay person to comprehend...

If the supporting literature isn't an interest to you... Ah, I just remembered that the journal had a chapter for the summary of the creation story. I don't know about you, but three pages should be easy to digest.
Regardless of how you view that conflict, defiling the dead for the sake of warfare is morally wrong. You can't argue to be doing the right thing in a situation like that!
Men have done all sorts of barbarity during times of war, but raising an army of the dead to do your bidding has to be the most unethical I've heard yet!
Metaphors are a great tool to express emotions that you wouldn't otherwise say directly. Like confessing your love, or calling out for help...
Everything can be expressed in metaphors, which is why they're so commonly used in classical literature. Everything from romance to suicide can be the topic of metaphors.
If you're interested, Roxie holds a concert at Virbank City every summer. I must warn you though, Unova is quite a long way from here.
Roxie holds an annual concert at the Virbank Summer Festival, so you might want to check that out if you want to listen to her greatest hits. It's a bit far away, though.
I wouldn't consider it to be particularly tragic, but I guess that would depend on whose point of view is being discussed here.
I would say majority of people wouldn't mind if things stayed the way they currently are... but it's all a matter of perspective...
I believe I've got the message of the poem figured out! It's about your desire for rest and relaxation!
The message is now clear to me! You are longing for a little bit of rest and relaxation!
That's fascinating. How would you differentiate between a high-quality knife, and a low-quality one? Could you easily figure out which category a knife would fall under?
I see you have quite the discerning taste in knives. I must ask, how exactly can you tell if a knife can be considered high-quality or not?
My, now isn't this quite the excitement? Just to hear the unfiltered sexual desires of another woman while in the throes of ecstasy... It would be quite an unbelievable experience!

I know that people your age can be quite... imaginative when it comes to sexual fantasies, so getting to hear yours while your hormones are all the way up... These has all the makings of an exhilarating memory!
And you got stiffed from your payment? It's obscene how much academics can be abused like that!
And he didn't pay you in the end? Unbelievable how common it is for the scientific community to be exploited like this!
Are you having a nervous breakdown, Amy? Just control your breathing, Amy. Hyperventilating will make things worst.
Are you having a nervous breakdown, Amy? Think happy thoughts. This is just a psychological attack, so taking your mind out of it should calm you down.
I see. So you're like one of those Pokémon daycare then? It's such a noble cause you've undertaken, taking care of abandoned Pokémon.
Not everyone has the dedication and the perseverance to run a Pokémon daycare on their own, and your efforts are commendable. Even owner-less Pokémon deserve to be taken care of too.
Oh, there I am musing to myself again! But to sum it up, we're not siblings, and we just happen to look alike. By the way, nice to meet you, ~player~!
My, I got lost in my thoughts again! I hope you understood what I just said, ~player~. Now, let's just enjoy this game from now on.
There we are, statistical proof that this isn't already weirder than it already is! We can just sit back and watch this game unfold.
Oh, look at that! I've been monologuing again! But to end my story, Team Galactic is not a threat anymore, and the world is safe again.
Just look at me rambling on and on! Anyhow, that's the end of that story. No need to dwell too much in the past.
Oh, sorry about talking non-stop there. I almost forgot we were playing a game here. Anyway, let's start the next round then.
Shaved, eh? Is it for hygienic purposes, or did you have other things in mind when you decided to shave?
Quite smooth and well shaven... Are there other factors aside from hygiene that led to your decision to shave?
Not that I'm telling you to ask me out, but I wouldn't oppose the idea either.
I'm not forcing you to ask me out or anything like that. It's still up to your discretion.
Well, I'll just let you process all of that... and the fact that you just lost.
Wasn't there a terrorist group that advocated for separation between humans and Pokémon quite a while ago?... N, would you happen to remember that incident?
The details are a bit hazy for me, but I distinctly remember a terrorist group who's goal was to free Pokémon away from humans... I'm sure you would have a better recollection of it than I do, N.
Come on now, don't blame ~player~... He's not into guys, so surely he's not dying to have you around.
Come on now, don't blame ~player~... He's not into guys; I'm sure he'd allow you to leave if he could.
I know that this game might be making you feel a bit warm inside, but it would be in everyone's best interest if we keep our hands to ourselves, at least until the game ends.
Oh, dear. I should have known this was coming! Hold it right there, witch! You'll be meeting with my Garchomp should you try anything funny with me!
(Ah, but of course! Angel's must be able to provide for their family by offering rides to those less able...)
(Ah, but of course! Angel's have surely put their wings to use by offering rides to those less able...)
Looking at it now, I'm sure you'd get plenty of attention, since you've certainly grabbed mine... Not in a lustful way, of course... It's just... out of curiosity...
I've never been to a nudist beach either, but I would like to think you can capture my attention... I mean, in a inquisitive manner... not out of desire or anything...
... I don't really think this is the proper place for that, you two. I can clearly see what you two are up to, and so does ~player~.
... Right here? In full view of me, as well as ~player~? I figured you would need a bit more privacy for that kind of activity.
Well, I'm not interested, Elesa, but I think ~male~ over here might be!
Well, I'm not interested, Elesa, but I think ~male~ over here might be trying to see more of you!
Well, I'm not interested, Elesa, but I bet ~male~ came here tonight because he knew you'd be here!
Well, I'm not interested, Elesa, but I think ~male~ over here might be!
Well, I'm not interested, Elesa, but I think ~male~ over here might be trying to see more of you!
Well, I'm not interested, Elesa, but I bet ~male~ came here today because he knew you'd be here!
Ah, and this is only part one of my reward tonight.
It's a good thing I decided to play tonight, Pit; even if you're the only guy here, I can tell that it will have been worth it.
Ah, and this is only part one of my reward today.
It's a good thing I decided to play today, Pit; even if you're the only guy here, I can tell that it will have been worth it.
Pit, you wouldn't happen to be talking to ~player~, would you? Ten loses to ~player~? Why, I don't object!
Tenfold? That's... that would mean ten times ~player~ loses! Hee hee, I don't object!
Tenfold? That's... that would mean ten times ~player~ loses! Hee hee, I wouldn't mind seeing that!
Tenfold? That's... that would mean ten times ~player~ loses! Hee hee, there'll be no complaints from me!
Tenfold? That's... that would mean ten times ~player~ loses! Ha, count me in!
Clefable is a fairy-type Pokémon, Meia. I don't have a Clefable among my group, but I can assure you your costume pretty much looks like one.
Clefable is a pink and roundish Pokémon, Meia. I don't have one with me, but the resemblance is truly uncanny.
Hmm, I wonder... I wonder if it has something to do with that terrorist group that wanted to separate men and Pokémon... Last I've heard, they were beaten though...
This is just a wild guess... but there was a terrorist group that wanted to free Pokémon from humans, through somewhat violent means... Perhaps they succeeded in some regions...
You... became the Hoenn League Champion..? And... turned down the title?
... You gave up the opportunity to become the Champion of Hoenn?
This reminds me: I don't think I've ever battled the Hoenn League Champion since the World Tournament. Requesting an exhibition match against Steven would be high in my to-do list.
If Steven is still currently the Hoenn League Champion, then challenging him to an exhibition match should be a priority of mine. I do hope he wouldn't mind.
Indeed! I can't deny that I've been tempted from time to time to dress up for my battles. It's wonderful that you can do so as part of the competition.
I know that it would have no bearing in the results of my battles, but I would love to dress up at some battle in the future.
I can see why now. Beauty is such a subjective metric, so arguments are bound to happen. On the contrary, a battle can silence any arguments regarding strength and technique.
I'm presuming that it stems from the fact that there's no one-size-fits-all measurement for a Pokémon's beauty, at least not the same barometer that a battle can provide.
I've heard that some far away regions have managed to develop portable video phones. I do hope they make it to Sinnoh some time soon. That would make it much easier to make contact with my friends.
Well, good thing portable video phone have been invented and is expected to roll out soon. It would allow me to talk with my friends wherever I am, whenever we can.
Hmm, what's that? I must be hearing things, but I thought you said something about wetting yourself? I hope not. The last thing we need now is someone losing their bladder control.
I'm sorry, I didn't quite get that. I know the going is getting tough, but it's not bad enough for you to become incontinent all of a sudden... That's what you said, right?
We'll have to wait and see about that. Some things are easier said than done, and being thrust into an unfamiliar situation like this is bound to spring up some unexpected reactions.
Saying it is one thing, but putting it into action is another battle entirely. In situations like this, there's no way of really knowing how you'll react once the going gets tough.
I suppose you're right. I've gotten greedy before and bought a white swimsuit and black swimsuit, but a little bit more color in my wardrobe wouldn't hurt.
I do own a pair of black swimsuit and white swimsuit, but a handful more options wouldn't hurt. I wouldn't be a good look if I wore the same two pairs every time.
Sounds like quite the grand Blaziken. No wonder you consider him to be the ace of your team. Such a close bond with your Pokémon takes quite some time to fully develop, but the benefits are immense.

I can clearly see why you hold your Blaziken in such high regard. For you to be by its side its entire life, you've develop a level of trust that's made you inseparable. Such a partnership is quite formidable indeed.
As far as this game is concerned, you're still in good shape at the moment. If you lose again, then the real test of will begins.
Keeping yourself calm and composed is key when attempting to conquer your fears. It must be said, the next time you lose, your ability to stay focused will undergo a mighty challenge.
I know you're joking, but I must admit that I find your figure admirable... in a non-sexual way of course...
I do find you body shape attractive, but not that attractive. It's not like that's a particularly believable story anyhow.
I have to admit that I did forget about ~player~ while pondering over that. What do you think, ~player~? Perhaps it might be easier to think about it once we've eaten a full meal after this.

Hmm, I completely left out ~player~ when I was thinking about our room plans. Don't be sad, ~player~. I'm sure May and I can think of an arrangement with you. It might be best to talk about when we're eating at the diner after this.
Hmm, that's an enticing way of putting it. Might be more of an acquired taste though.
In a way, you can say that it's very exotic. I doubt many people have tasted it, even if there any at all.
Well, the purpose if a ball is to socialize, after all. I know my way around a ball or two, so I wouldn't look too out of place there. Perhaps, I could even teach you proper etiquette.
Mingling with strangers is nice, but it's always comforting to have a friendly face at a gathering like that. Besides, I feel like we would have a good chemistry while attending formal functions.

Even if I don't get the answers I seek, watching your team show the perfect harmony of power and style is worth the time. Additionally, with you being an expert in both battling and coordinating, I have quite a few questions I would ask of you, if you don't mind.

My knowledge in Pokémon contests is quite limited, and I have no doubt that you know something that I don't, even if you're unaware of it. I wouldn't mind learning more about contests in general, as a contrast to the battling scene.
Costume or not, ensuring emotional stability is always paramount, and we must always find time for rest and relaxation... Oh, pardon my rambling. Did you say something, Meia?
Everybody has different ways of dealing with stress, and it is very important that we keep our stress levels low and keep a healthy mentality. By the way, did you say something, Meia?
After all, I came here specifically to see some guys show some skin, ha ha!
After all, knowing is just half the battle. If you could create this power generator, it could power your city for centuries to come. What a momentous victory for science that would be!
A generator that could last for generations. Your name will forever be part of the local history if you could pull that feat off!
Ha, sacrifice! Spoken like a true warrior, Pit!
Sacrifice? Is there some mythology about angels and sacrificing their clothing?
Sacrifice? Pit, is there some sort of folklore about this that I'm not familiar with?
Sacrifice? Do angels normally sacrifice their clothing? Is that like... a ritual for good luck or something?
Sacrifice? Do angels normally sacrifice their clothing? Is that... done for good luck or something?
Sacrifice? Wait, do angels have some sort of ancient practice I'm not familiar with where they sacrifice their clothing?
Sacrifice? What else do angels sacrifice, Pit? This is important for my research!
Sacrifice? What else do angels sacrifice, Pit? I must know the answer.
Weapons? Pit, you must tell me all about the weapons from your civilization!
Weapons? Ah, Pit, you have no idea how much I look forward to examining the weapons from another civilization!
Weapons are such a fascinating thing to study from other cultures, Pit. Please, you must tell me more!
Weapons? Ah, I missed out too, then; I would have loved to look at tools from another culture.
I don't think I've read anything about angelic weapons, Pit; that subject didn't come up in the books...
I don't think I've read anything about angelic weapons, Pit; that's something I have little background on.
I don't think I've read anything about angelic weapons, Pit; I would love to know more about how Skyworld defends itself.
Weapons? Speaking of, Pit, what exactly does Skyworld need to defend itself from? Who are your invaders?
Weapons? Tell me, what predators hunt angels, Pit?
Weapons? What predators do angels protect themselves from, Pit?
Weapons? Pit, we must meet after tonight's game; I've always wanted to study weapons from the mythical Skyworld.
Weapons? Pit, we must meet after tonight's game; I've always wanted to study weapons from the mythical Skyworld.
Why, I'm flattered that you enjoy being around me, Elesa! Truly, those are kind words!
Oh? You... enjoy my company, Elesa?!
Ha! Well, I must admit, there's a certain glamor about you that I find quite charming. But I wouldn't say I'm interested.
Sorry Elesa, but I'm only interested in men...
Sorry Elesa, but I'm only interested in men... A-are you interested?
You needn't worry, Guzma; I wouldn't want to touch those nasty things anyway...
You needn't worry, Guzma; you couldn't pay me to come near those things...
I couldn't, with good conscience, come near those things anyway; if someone saw me next to stolen merchandise, they might get the wrong idea.
Wow, Pit, you have a nice looking canvas...
Ha, Pit, your canvas looks incredible.
This is the kind of thing I was looking froward to tonight!
What's the matter Pit, staring at my cleavage? Ha, I don't mind or anything.
Are you saying that... you're staring at my cleavage, Pit? I don't mind or anything as long as you help me with my mythology research...
What's the matter Pit, staring at my boobs? I don't mind or anything; we're even now
Are you saying that... you're staring at my chest, Pit? I don't mind or anything as long as you help me with my mythology research...
I can see that, Pit... My eyes are up here...
I can tell, Pit... Instead, it seems your eyes would rather explore my hills.
I can see that, Pit; it seems your gaze is locked downstairs...
You're staring a bit intently there, Pit... I don't mind or anything as long as you help me with my mythology research...
I can tell, Pit... Instead, it seems your eyes would rather explore my cave...
It's only natural for a guy your age to be nervous, Pit...
Are you that nervous, Pit?
Are angels normally this nervous, Pit?
You're only shirtless, Pit; is that considered lewd in Skyworld?
You're only shirtless, Pit; is that considered lewd in Skyworld? It's normal to see a man shirtless where I come from.
Huh? Men aren't supposed to feel embarrassed simply by being shirtless... Are social norms different in Skyworld?
Have social norms evolved differently in Skyworld, Pit? A guy shouldn't normally be that embarrassed by simply exposing his chest.
Looking good, Pit!
You have nothing to be ashamed of, Pit!
Not bad, Pit!
Hmmm, don't take this the wrong way, N, but I wouldn't call your look stylish... It's more like... an intentional mess.
Hmmm, don't take this the wrong way, N, but you could learn a thing or two about style; your look is kind of just a drab collage of colors.
You're seriously willing to rep for those guys? Their childish crimes and petty thievery make them the laughing stock of Alola.
Team Skull's childish crimes and petty thievery is known even in Sinnoh; your organization is laughed about so widely and you're still willing to associate with them?
Are you proud of what your organization has become? I'd rip that thing off in a heart beat if I found it across my neck.
Are you proud of what your organization has become? I'd die of humiliation if I found that thing across my neck.
Don't get complacent, Pit! If you let your guard down, you'll be open to attack.
Things may start out easy, Pit, but they'll get harder! Stay in there!
Things may start off easy, but they always have a way of getting tougher; stay vigilant, Pit.
Yeah, huu huuh... easy...
Things start out easy, Pit... but they get tougher once you remove your shirt, heeeh...
Oh, trust me, Pit... They get tougher, as evidenced by, well... my condition...
Things start out easy, Pit... but they get tougher once you take off your pants, heeeh...
Ha, tenfold? I like your spirit, Pit.
Tenfold? Quite the ambitious angel, aren't you?
Tenfold? That's quite ambitious of you, Pit; I like that.
Tenfold? Why, with the fires igniting in your eyes, anything is possible!
That's right, Pit, don't give up!
I know you can do it, Pit! Get back in there!
Tenfold? I appreciate your enthusiasm, Pit, but with me around, I don't think that's possible!
I like your enthusiasm, Pit; show me what you're capable of!
This was your first loss, Pit, but don't expect it to be your last!
Even if you're knocked down, Pit, you can always get back up!
You're not down for the count yet, Pit. Get back in there!
You're just getting started, and I'm about finishing up...
It's... I'm ashamed to be this far down, Pit... To think that you're only getting started while I'm almost out...
Weapons? Pit, we must meet after today's game; I've always wanted to study weapons from the mythical Skyworld.
Don't worry, Pit, I won't say anything.
Are you sure, Pit? I don't suspect things will stay fine for that much longer, all things considered...
Well, that was very rude. Still, it's better that you are spending your time playing poker than using your guns.
Despite your rather crass way of speaking to others, this would be a more preferable situation than having you go on a rampage with your guns.

I suppose now is as good of a time as any to begin learning about women's role in spaceflight. I wouldn't want to fall too far behind on current developments, especially about this all-women planetary colony you mentioned.
If anything, this would be a good reason for me to study more about female space travelers. I wasn't even aware that an entire planetary colony of them existed.
That might be true to some extent, but I'm just going to keep a close eye on you just to be absolutely sure.
Pirate or not, it would be in everybody's best interest if I keep up my guard in case something untoward happens.
I'm not sure how much of that is true, which is as good of a reason as any to focus my attention on you.
You're bluffing, right? I thought you would be better at something like that.
Quite an interesting way to steer the conversation away from your inadequacies, but ultimately not effective.
The picture is clear to me now... That's also why pirates existed in the past. History really is repeating itself.
So your pirate crew are part of an oppressed minority... Like the pirates centuries ago that I studied about... History is just a unending loop, it seems.
I don't anyone that would bring a gun to a courier errand, so I'll assume this is just part of your cover.
Your cover story might have been convincing, it it weren't for the fact that couriers don't bring guns while delivering packages.
Yes, a package delivery person that's armed to the teeth... I don't think you've planned your alibi thoroughly enough.
Do you expect me to believe that a courier would be bringing not one, but two guns during a delivery run?
That's quite the predicament... No wonder you look depressed all the time...
That's a very difficult situation indeed... I finally understand why you've been melancholic throughout this game...
I'd also spiral into a deep depression like you if I was also in a situation like that...
Scrambling... What exactly has been attacking your ship to force you to hurry that much?
Sounds like these attacks are a rather common occurrence... Who are targeting your ship in the first place?

condition.saying: In truth, I'm as uncertain of my purpose as you are.

case.state: I suppose Arceus has performed grander acts of creation, dwarfing that of a simple living statue... but why? What does creating a living statue accomplish?
Bringing a statue to life would be a relatively simple act for an all-powerful being like Arceus, but what purpose does a living statue have? What's the justification for the existence of one?
There's no way for me to prove or disprove your explanation... so I'm going to keep a close eye on you. Just be aware that I'll take immediate action should you do anything out of line.
That may be true... but there's no way for me to know for certain. I'm keeping you under a close eye for the meantime, and I would suggest against doing anything drastic.
Let's do this all over again, shall we? If you're not a trainer, then what exactly is it that you do, Neptune?
That conversation didn't exactly go the way I expected... Anyway, if you're not a trainer, then what are you then?
... "CPU"? Like the computer chips? Did I mishear that?
... Did you say "CPU"? As in "Central Processing Unit"? That doesn't quite make sense...

Are you insinuating that you're a clone? I remember a Mareep named Dolly that was produced through cloning by combining an egg cell with the DNA of another Mareep. How does a planet of clones even function?

An artificial pregnancy? I can't remember the precise details, but I remember Dolly being cloned using an egg cell, and a mammary cell, from two Mareep. Does that mean you're a clone of your DNA donor, Jura?

Two eggs and a machine? That sounds exactly like the process used to create Dolly, the cloned Mareep. Now, if you're a clone, were you a clone of the egg cell donor, or the DNA donor? I can't remember which one.
Shadow Cat? Is that another Team Galactic grunt like you?
And who is this Shadow Cat person, hmm? Another of your accomplice from Team Galactic?

condition.saying: I find it strange then, that I have no memory of this betrayal.

case.state: Based on the legends I've read about Arceus, you most likely received a gift from Arceus, but you had failed to fulfill your end of the deal. Hence, Arceus punished in the way it deemed fit.

Arceus could have punished for a lot of reasons... The most common trigger of Arceus's wrath seems to be betrayal. Perhaps, you double-crossed Arceus in the past, and this was deemed as the appropriate punishment for your transgression.

This reminds me of the time I confronted a fraudulent antiquities dealer to show me proof of an artifact he allegedly had, and he told me that it was in his other pants. You're guilty until you can prove otherwise, "Neptune".
Well, isn't that just convenient. For you. "Oh, I have so and so powers, but I can't show it to you. No, I can't provide evidence either."
You must be a relatively new member of Team Galactic then, since you don't have the same prowess as your predecessors, "Neptune".
What?! ~human.ifMale(He|She)~ really did all of those?! ~Player~!
Is all of that true, Chara?! ~Player~, how could you?!
Improbability Drive? Sounds quite ominous. What is it?
I've never heard of an "Improbability Drive" before. Would you mind describing what it is?
A.A.H.W? Sounds like a significant organization... What are their goals?
Who are the A.A.H.W, and what exactly have they been trying to do?
Yes, I do believe that we're talking about the same Pokémon, just with different names. There's a lot of examples of that actually, of Pokémon having different names between regions.
A "Raven" is what you call a Toucannon in your region? The same Pokémon can have a variety of differing names between regions, it can be difficult to keep track sometimes.
Oh, "Froot Loop" is a breakfast cereal that children commonly eat. Oddly enough, I don't think Froot Loops even have any fruits at all. They're just made to taste like fruits.
I'm not entirely convinced that Froot Loops has actual fruits in it. Rather, it's just cereal with artificial fruit flavors. I suppose it isn't a big thing in your region then.
... You're the leader of a revolutionary war? What pushed to rise up against the government?
... Surely, you must have a valid cause for initiating a revolutionary war...

I'm not a teacher, Jason, but rather an archaeologist, and by extension, a historian. I've made it my mission to learn about as many historical cultures as I can, particularly concerning creation stories.
Well, I'm not a teacher in the typical sense, but I'm an archaeologist, Jason. You can say I'm quite fond in sharing my knowledge to anyone who would listen.
Monsters sealed in caverns? Who sealed them there, and why?
And how did these monsters come to be sealed in such a manner?
It must have been a bad situation, if you were forced to chose between the lesser of two evils. How did you determine that one was worse than the other?
I'm getting the gut feeling that the reason you left must have been quite severe for you to make that switch. Can you elaborate what exactly that would be?
Well, either way, establishing a new nation isn't easy, which is why having a head-strong leader is very important.

Every revolution needs a strong and capable leader to be successful, and it's not difficult to see why. The struggles of creating a new government isn't simply contained within the revolutionary period itself.
I suppose not, but that raises the question of why you were in possession of a weapon like that in the first place. That's hardly the proper weapon for self-defense.
The only reason that became a problem in the first place is your ownership of that weapon, which you still haven't explained in a satisfactorily convincing manner.
I'm not exactly convinced having it in your hands instead is a better scenario, with the way you were strutting about with it...
The way you were handling that thing, I think someone else is better off holding it than you.
Way too many times I've seen someone lie about things like that... Just remember that I'm keeping my eye on you.
I've already seen the damage a reckless bomber can do... I'd rather not see anything like that ever again.
Why else would someone lug that thing around without harboring any intent of using it? It's not the type of thing you would just mindlessly carry.
Is there anyone else aside from a goon that would not only consider bringing a weapon in a place like this, but also swing it about with reckless abandon?
If you have no intentions of doing anything threatening, then I wouldn't have to bring out my Pokémon. But if you did... well, you've been warned.
I'm just making sure that you're really here to play cards. If that's true, then my Pokémon would be unnecessary.
I wouldn't expect anyone to admit to being a terrorist. Still, you may or may not be a terrorist, but it never hurts to be safe in either scenario.
I can think of two occasions where a seemingly innocuous organization turned out to be a terrorist group... Besides, it doesn't hurt to be ready in case you turn out to be one.
I suppose calling it a journal wouldn't be giving it justice. It also serves as an encyclopedia as well. Except that you don't get to learn about a particular Pokémon until you've met one.
It's not the type of journal that you would write into, but rather it's more like an encyclopedia in which the page of a particular Pokémon can only be viewed after encountering said Pokémon.
Indeed, Arceus created this universe and everything within it, but he's the one and only creator! You cannot possibly have powers that equals his!
Arceus used his extraordinary power to create all life and matter. Nothing can equal his power, not even you!
I do believe that Arceus created the universe, and he alone can possess such incomprehensible power! A mere mortal such as you can only aspire to be as powerful!
You're a pirate yourself... I was starting to wonder why you weren't wearing a uniform fitting for a crew member.
Well, this explains a lot. I was confused about your outfit, but I had operated under the assumption that you're a licensed ship crew member.
Was that a ceremonial scepter you were holding earlier? Was that from your culture, or one of your crewmates?
Hmm, I don't think I've ever seen anything like that scepter you had earlier. Whose culture was that object from?
So, if I'm getting this correctly, this Luffy isn't comfortable being on a ship despite being a ship captain? He doesn't seem qualified for his position.
Your captain is the least disciplined member of your ship's crew? Have you considered replacing him with someone more competent for the position?
Sounds like you have negative experiences with this World Government. Can you care to elaborate on what exactly went down?
It seems you have an enlightening story to tell about the World Government. This might not be the best time to talk about it, but I'm genuinely interested about it.
With that self-proclaimed description, I can't tell if you're a psychic, or a con man... possibly both, given your demeanor.
I've seen my fair share of psychics, charlatans, megalomaniacs, and megalomaniac psychic charlatans, and I can't shake the feeling you're at least two of those.
... Well, if it comes to that point, my Pokémon should have no difficulties dispatching you. It will take more than just a kitchen knife to subdue them.
I'm keeping a close eye on you. Just keep in mind that my Pokémon are among the most powerful in the Sinnoh Region, and your knife will give them nothing more than a flesh wound.
Regardless of what your ultimate intentions are, my Pokémon will take quick work of you. I've had to fight an entire team the previous time, a knife maniac will be no match for them.
You seem like a powerful mage. My close friend's ability is limited to controlling her hair, and even then, the effort is very draining for her.

You're undoubtedly more powerful than the psychics I personally know. The only thing my close friend can control with her mind is her hair, and she have to sleep all the time just to keep them under her control.
Ah, a jack of all trades, I figure. Proficient at everything, but master of none. Makes you more flexible in terms of assignment in battle, I would presume.
Going for an all-around style with that training? That's ideal for when you're in a battle, as you should be capable of adapting to any scenario and situations.
... Your breasts? Oh, I was so fixated on the possibilities of spies that I didn't even notice that you've removed your top! Well, what can I say? They look motherly.
... What breasts? Oh, your breasts are out? I hardly noticed because I was deep in thought. Hmm, looking at them, it looks like you're ready for motherhood, Nami.
Unless you consider psychic powers as magical, then I would suppose magic is a bit of an anomaly where I'm from. Although, there are some mystical phenomena that remains unexplained...
Based on your description of magic, those would be very rare indeed where I'm from. Well, there are some things I've heard of that may or may not be magical, but there are no consensus.
I have heard of legends of deities turning humans into Pokémon, but never the other way around. I also have a feeling that this Dr. Eggman isn't a god either.
There are many tales of humans being turned into Pokémon, but I've never heard it be the opposite way around, and to be the result of an action by a human...
I figured as much. That armor of yours was a dead giveaway that you're a foot soldier.
You definitely look the part, so it comes as no surprise that you're a foot soldier.
Oh, I see now... Well, if you're here to cause any trouble, just remember that I have my Pokémon with me, and they are ready to fight you on short notice.
That's how you want to do things then. I suppose my Pokémon wouldn't mind if I have them fight another law-breaking grunt. All I have to do is to give them the command...
Oh, so you're still a student? That does put things into context. You wouldn't entrust significant missions to inexperienced members after all.
It's always good for students to get a bit of hands-on for their professions, Get their feet wet, so to speak. Although, you wouldn't want to get them injured either.
Those names do not ring a bell for me either... I wonder if we are using different names for the same locations. That's one difficulty I often encounter when reading old writings.
It's entirely possible that we are thinking of the same locations, but are using endemic names for them. It happens often when deciphering old inscriptions, and also for regional dialects.
I see. It all makes sense now. The typical garb of that time period has been romanticized by painters throughout history due to its aura of power and strength.

You've got to compliment your designer's choice. That outfit has signified female empowerment and independence throughout history. Or at least, art history, if the classicist movement is any indication.

Well, if the descriptions from the manuscripts are accurate, that outfit gives both protection and flexibility, which gave it a superior advantage in the battlefield. I can see why your designer chose to emulate it.
That sounds exactly like a Ghost-type Pokémon... Have you tried catching these Grimm using a Pokéball, or perhaps even use Dark-type Pokémon?
Are you describing a Ghost-type Pokémon? You might not know this, but Ghost-types are weak against Dark-types. You can even try catching them with a Pokéball.
You live in a city called "Hell"? That explains why you chose Princess of Hell as a nickname... Is it common for your city to go with a hellish theme, given the name?
A city named... "Hell"? One of the most bizarre city names I've ever encountered, but it does explain a lot... I would presume that your city has a hellish theme going on...
A Pokémon ranger... The people that keep forest-dwelling Pokémon safe... Are you not familiar with Pokémon?
Pokémon rangers make sure that people don't fall into danger when traversing through the wild... But you don't seem to know what Pokémon are in the first place...
...Well, if you still want to "pretend", I wouldn't object to that, Dawn... Truth be told, I might harbor some feelings toward you... but it might just be fleeting rather than genuine...
... People wouldn't know if our relationship is real or pretend anyway... I've felt that we should be together, and I wouldn't want it any other way...
You're not getting my point! You don't just get rid of ocean climate. Besides, removing the ocean would affect the land climate as well. Have you taken that into consideration?
Even if you succeed in changing the oceans into land, it will have adverse effects with the overland weather and climate. Did you consider what would happen in that case?
I'm getting the impression that you did not think through this plan properly... I wouldn't be surprised if you can't even name the Pokemon you're thinking of.
... That wasn't a particularly convincing argument... Also, what Pokémon are you even describing here? Can you even name it at all?
She's always ordering you, but has she ever allowed you to command anyone? Sounds like you're nothing more than an errand girl, or in other words, a grunt.
If all her interactions with you consist of commanding you, then she must not value your presence much. In her eyes, you're nothing more than a regular Team Magma grunt.
Did you mention that your kind possesses magical abilities? You might not know this, but humans do not have magical abilities, excluding the psychics. Is that what you alluded to?
If most of your kind is competent in utilizing your magical abilities, then you're already better than humans in that regard. Only a handful of humans have psychic powers, you see.

To first control a Pokemon, you should be able to contain it first, no? Additionally, using a Red Orb against Groudon will only make it stronger... Stronger against you and your team, and for any team for that matter...

How do you expect to control a Pokémon without containing it first? And even then, what I do know about the Red Orb is that it makes Groudon more powerful, which does not bode well for your plans to control it.

Having 20 Ludicolo on your team is a tad excessive, but I can see what your game plan is. You get the opposing trainer complacent with your Ludicolo, then surprise them with Probopass as your last ace.
I get it, your Probopass is your surprise team member, since the opposing trainer would expect yet another Ludicolo instead. Quite an intriguing strategy...
There's no shame in settling for a gym leader role. Gym Leaders are the foundation of the League hierarchy, and some Elite Four members used to be gym leaders before moving up.
Some people might not think much of gym leaders, but the Pokémon League wouldn't have existed without them. Besides, some Elite Four members and even Champions started out as gym leaders.

Do you truly know what you signed up for? If your previous answers are any indication, I would dispute that claim. If history repeats itself, you and your fellow grunt would come off worst from this affair.
All you've said so far has raised a lot of red flags for me. It seems, if past events could be used as a good indicator, that you and your fellow grunts would take the brunt of the fall.
That's excellent to hear! There might still be hope for you and your fellow grunts. Still, Hoenn should be kept on high alert. It would be tragic if another malicious organization fancies a look.

Well, that's amazing news then! Perhaps your team aren't as delusional as you appeared to be. Anyway, Hoenn's defenses need shoring up regardless. Better safe than sorry if another team decides to strike.
Peaceful is not really the word I would use. There's trouble here and there with wild Pokémon and irresponsible Pokémon trainers, but gun violence is indeed non-existent.
You are indeed correct that gun violence have largely died out, but there's still a lot of bombardment going on, primarily from wild Pokémon, and unruly Pokémon with weak trainers.
You are indeed correct that gun violence have largely died out, but there's still a lot of bombardment going on, primarily from wild Pokémon, and unruly Pokémon with weak trainers.
I'm basing this assumption on name only, but I can see why guns are a necessity when your domain is called Wild West.
Oh, I spoke too soon then... That sounds like a very miserable life. I suppose you've been looking for a new home for a while now?
Well... that's the exact opposite of what I expected... Would it be safe for me to assume that you've been considering moving out?
It's excellent that someone is taking a notice at this emergency. You would think that the general populace would be a lot more informed, given that it concerns the fate of the world.

It sounds like you've got the measure of him for the meantime, but I'm appalled that this has been mostly kept under the wraps. People deserve to know that this is currently ongoing, and will affect their lives.
Well, when you put it like that... I suppose it's only a debate of semantics. Though, Pokémon can decide on their own sometimes, and can be a lot more difficult to handle than a disciplined army.
Granted, Pokémon can be a bit stubborn sometimes, not to mention hesitant. No quite as disciplined as an army of conscripts, nor are they particularly smart either.
I see that you've not wandered into the more mystical "studies". Perhaps your studies are just a little-known branch of chemistry, rather than the outdated field that I've read about.

If you remained within the bounds of the scientific method, then it's certainly possible that the alchemy you're studying is different from the historical alchemy. Yours is more like a branch of chemistry.
Hold on... Am I being off-kilter or are you not a regular Braixen...? That human-like face... why, you must be a kitsune!
There's something off about you, Braixen... Wait, your face is a little bit too human... unless... you're not just any Braixen, but one that has transformed into a kitsune!
Your home region... doesn't exists anymore? What did you mean by that?
When you say that your home region is no longer around, do you mean figuratively or literally? What would that even entail?
That sounds horrendous! To treat people the same way tools would be, to be discarded once it has outlived its usefulness... it's simply not a healthy way of living.
Every life deserves to reach its full potential and to deprive them the opportunity would be an injustice. And to arbitrarily decide when a life is to be terminated... it simply isn't right.
Well, regardless of what's causing which, I'd say it would do well to stay as far away from Bilgewater as possible, don't you agree?
It could be one of the other, but either way it's hardly a place worth visiting for any reason. I would be doing myself a favor by staying away from that place.
My, classified academic research! You're not just any academic, but a prodigious one, to reach the upper echelons of academia at such a young age.
To be working on top secret projects, you must be among the cream of the crop of a academia, and to do so at such an age too. You're truly an outstanding genius.
Are your nose hairs prehensile? What an odd talent... and mildly disgusting as well for them to be stiff enough to cut your clothes...
Nose hairs that are as sharp as blades and as malleable as gloves. A notable talent, sure, but hardly one that I would keep an interest on.
Quite the serendipitous circumstances indeed. Well, I suppose that removes all handicaps from this game from your perspective.
Tragic circumstances aside, I'm just glad that we're playing on equal footing. Fair is fair, after all.

Well, I see that you have the passion for the job, but don't you think that's bad for your mental well-being, being stressed like that for extended periods? Although, that goes without saying for a nurse like you.

I understand that you love what you do, but you also have to look after your mental health. Pushing yourself beyond the reasonable limit will have negative effects on you. I suppose you would know that already.
What a fascinating sequence! I never would have thought that the person under that suit would look so... approachable and dashing, given the strength needed to operate such a grand machine.
Absolutely beautiful! Not just what you just did, but... I would say it applies to you also... Never would have thought that would apply to whoever was manning such a hulking suit.
A boar? I've heard of an Emboar, but never just a boar... What is a boar, ~kyou~?
I must admit, I'm unfamiliar with this boar creature, ~kyou~. You claim that it's distinct from an Emboar though... Can you tell me more about boars?
Indeed! This is the reason why traveling all over the world is vital! There's a lot of things that can't be learned simply from books.
If there are regions that call their Pokémon differently, then more so the reason to travel there! Field research trumps book readings for this situation!
It's not that I'm uncoordinated, I simply haven't devoted myself to competitive sports. If we were to play baseball together, you will still outperform me.

I'm not good at throwing either, or at baseball in general. It's not that I lack the physical attributes, but I simply have never played them. I wouldn't be at all surprised if you can still play better baseball than I could.
I understand. I wonder if Sinnoh can benefit from a division specializing in preventing misuse of Legendary Pokémon. That much power in the wrong hand... it's quite concerning.
Well, that makes sense. Still, the next time someone tries to use a Legendary Pokémon for their own agenda, it would be preferable if the matter is resolved by an elite specialist group.

Indeed, it might seem counter-intuitive at first, but intentionally sandbagging yourself to the level of your opponent is the best way of helping them progress. It is a journey of improvement, after all.

It might run contrary to the maxim that we always have to be the best we can be, but if we allowed the gym leaders to curb stomp every young trainer that comes their way, it would discourage them from continuing further.
I'm glad that most of the extraterrestrial Pokémon that have landed on Earth had been relatively docile then, at least as far as I know. I don't know if Earth can handle the threat of a violent one.
Earth must have been very lucky then, given that the few extraterrestrial Pokémon that has made its way there has turned out to be docile. A violent Pokémon can wreak unmitigated havoc otherwise.

Better to teach them early about the so-called hidden side of battles. We wouldn't want them to fall into the trap of simply spamming fire-type moves on their path to victory. I can see that Unova's grass-type gym is in a capable pair of hands.

Bringing status effects and hazards to the forefront is an effective way of teaching trainers to actually take strategy into consideration, rather than being lulled into an effective but inefficient style of battle. I could already see that the Unova grass-type gym will be a successful venture.
From my talk with the other Unova gym leaders, the first week is always the most unnerving. All things going well, you should comfortably fall into the role soon enough.

If you ask the other gym leaders, anxiety does occur when opening your gym for the first time. Although, should nothing catastrophic happen, your anxiety should abate eventually, and your role will start to feel like second nature.
Battling is more than just the battles themselves, and being a movie actress is a vastly different experience, so I can understand choosing to forgo an acting career in this case...

There's so many facets when it comes to training Pokémon for battling that the actual battles are but a small part of it. Given how much different the skillset being an actress needs, I can see why you wanted to return to battling instead.

I can imagine that your gym would become one of the most popular in the entire Unova region if you do so. Trainers will be flocking specifically to take you on. It's all about finding the perfect balance between your two duties from that point onwards.

That would be a good way of cultivating a dedicated legion of fans, which would be vital in keeping your gym in business for a long time. If you can find the time for both, then I can see your gym becoming popular in the entire region.
There's a lot of fun activities that we do back at my villa. You never know... I might just float the possibility of a private strip poker session...
We are always looking for new activities to do in our social circle, and you're more than welcome to join in. I wouldn't count out the possibility of a strip poker game among the gym leaders...
Wouldn't be the first time a ruin is discovered to be filled with booby traps, but... Oh, it's a small robot! Cupil is the name you mentioned, right?
Well, ruins tends to carry an inherent danger due to crumbling infrastructure... Hmm, what's that sound? A small floating robot named Cupil?
I see... boars must be normal-type Pokémon then! Based on your descriptions, I'm confident that your pet is a Furret!
With your boar being a normal-type, combined with his physical description, I know without a doubt that he's a Furret!
One world seeping into another... The results of such a crossover event has got to be catastrophic!
If two world are starting to merge towards each other like that... I can only presume how damaging such an event must be for both sides.

A decadent younger sibling, then. If anything, they have a tendency of living longer, as long as they don't come into conflict with the elder sibling. As a segue, that means you'll be next in line. Are you ready to fill such a role?

Depending on the situation, having less duties and responsibilities means that you're less likely to end up at odds with your sibling and other people of power. Do you think you can step up to your brother's role if the situation requires it?
Sounds like you have quite the eye for small details! I do wonder if you can apply your ability to other fields. Being very observant can open up a lot of possibilities for you.
My, you sound very discerning to see details that others can't! Having such a sharp attention to detail can be helpful not just as a nurse, but in life in general.
I'm a Pokémon trainer, which is why I initially thought you were talking about Pokémon battles earlier. Additionally, I'm an archaeologist, with a particular affinity for creation stories.
My main interest is archaeology, especially concerning the traditions surrounding creation stories. However, most people know me as a Pokémon trainer, especially in Pokémon battles.
A series of fires? What did you mean by that, ~yshtola~?
Did you say small fires? Can you elaborate on what that means?

It does make sense that your power plant would not be built on a precarious location... I presume that part of your modernization program is to ready the plant should the situation deteriorate in the future.
It's a given that a power plant would be built as far away from a potential explosion as possible... Still, it wouldn't hurt to add extra safeguards in case an eruption happens.
Well, when he does come back, I'll be glad to show him one of my Pokémon. My Pokémon would be very glad to make a new friend too.
If your pet wants a playmate, I know one of my Pokémon that would suffice for the job. She knows how to befriend all sort of creatures, you know.
Even if the land itself is barren, there must be something of note anywhere in the region. Can't you think of anything?
Well, you know what they say, "A bowl is most useful when it is empty.". Surely, there must be something even of minor note in that region of yours.

Ah, besting your local town's trainers! A crucial step for anyone wanting to rise their way to the top of the League hierarchy. You seem to know what you're doing, so I can see you becoming successful.
Battling the trainers in your area is definitely the right call in this situation. Every trainer has to start at the local level before eventually working up the ranks of the Pokémon League.
It would be a shame if you were disgraced simply for participating here. Even royalty deserve to let loose and have fun from time to time too. Rest assured that your secret is safe with me, princess.
I can guarantee you that my lips are sealed regarding your presence here, princess. I myself are trying to keep my attendance a secret.
Oh no, Erufuda... I hope those weren't too expensive...
Oh no, Erufuda... I hope that's repairable...
Oh no... I know a tailor back in Celestic Town who could fix those up for you, Erufuda. What do you say we pay her a visit later?
M-M-Moon... Y-your... indecency knows no bounds, does it...
Moon, I... I must confess... You're the kind of girl that sets the harmful reputations...
Oh, what's the matter, Misato? It's just a scar; wear it like a badge!
Oh, what's the matter, Misato? You needn't fear about a scar; it's proof of your triumph over a challenge.
Don't fret over a scar, Misato; all the great heroes of the ancient past have a scar or two.
I haven't see... white pubic hair before...
Rinkah, you're... that's... haaa, that's a fairly primitive look, Rinkah.
Rinkah, that looks... That looks rather primitive...
Ha, that would be a fat no, Guzma, your defeat is imminent!
Please Guzma, don't flatter yourself; you're the last guy who'd distract me.
(Well, I'll admit... His body does look kind of nice...)
(Well, I'll admit... Living on a tropical island has sure incentivized him to work towards a body like that...)
Okay Guzma, I'll ask the question... How did you manage to get a hold of that kind of body? Because you can't steal a body...
Huh, that's strange... I thought everything of value you have was stolen from other, but it appears you are willing to work towards something...
Oh, uh... Are the... balls supposed to hang lower than the... er, nevermind...
Oh, do you have, uh... micropenis? That looks... that looks nothing like what I've seen in the ancient sketches.
Oh, i uh... I don't mean to question your manliness, but... well, nevermind...
Ha ha, I was only teasing, Guzma.
Okay, okay, so you're not as small as I was hoping...
Okay, okay Guzma; I was hoping you would be smaller.
Ha ha, darn. I was hoping you would have been smaller; it would have been much funnier that way.
Ha ha, okay, okay Guzma. This would have been much more hilarious if it were smaller.
Ha ha, okay, okay Guzma. This would have been much more hilarious if the big bad leader of Team Skull turned out to have a tiny penis.
Still clutching onto strings, are we? Well, I certainly admire your perseverance!
You might be more familiar with Palkia, his... his heads looks a little phallic.
Dialga became the master of time itself, and time started flowing. Palkia controlled space, and so space started to expand...
Ha! Very well then, Shining Beauty Elesa! Let's see how skilled you are at cards!
So we're going to see your beauty, Elesa? Does that mean you intend to throw?
So we're going to see your beauty, Elesa? Does that mean you expect to lose?
Ha, you're already out of your pants, Guzma; you can't possibly expect to beat me now.
Ha, you're already out of your pants, Guzma; surely you realize that facing me in strip poker was perhaps, a mistake?
I'll admit that this game is getting close, Guzma, but I've still a slight lead.
This match is coming down to the wire, Guzma; even if you are but a thug, you've proven yourself a fierce competitor!
This match is coming down to the wire, Guzma; your criminal background aside, you've proven you're not meant to be taken lightly at this game.
You've only a slight lead on me now, Guzma; do would not let it go to waste if you were a true competitor.
You've only a slight lead on me now, Guzma; if you falter now, it will have all been for naught!
My my, N, you sure have an impressive head of hair! Quite like myself, if I must say.
Well, N, that's quite the head of hair; what kind of conditioner do you use?
I see that you too keep your hair well kept, N; kudos!
Well, you certainly have your hair-care down to a science!
I too take good care of my hair. Want to know the secret? My conditioner is made with honey from a Vespiquen hive!
Ah, even if it's just your bracelets, N, I feel a sense of readiness... Let's continue this match, and may the best player win!
That's awfully presumptuous, Guzma; you will admit defeat just like the rest of the criminal scum who've dared challenge me.
You know, it's surprising... You're still the same Guzma as before, but you already look more respectable with that ridiculous chain off your neck.
You know, it's surprising... You're still the same Guzma as before, but you already look more respectable with that cheap trinket off your neck.
You know, it's surprising... Without that chain around you neck, you almost look respectable...
You know, it's surprising... Without that absurd knickknack around you neck, you almost look respectable...
At the heart of chaos, where all things became one, appeared an Egg. Having tumbled from the vortex, the Egg gave rise to the Original One.
These three lake guardians taught humans the ability to feel emotions, gain knowledge, and use willpower!
That flash appeared to have originated from you, Jotaro... Oh, your belt is gone... Perhaps, I was just blinded by reflection from your belt buckle.
Anything that gets left behind can be considered as artifacts, no matter how small. Your ~clothing~, for example, could be considered an artifact by future generations if you lose it.

Everyone seems to think that only significant objects can be classified as artifacts, which is untrue. Something as small and insignificant as your ~clothing~ can count as an artifact, if it lasts that long.
It's... a human girl?! Have Butterfree always been half-human all along?!
It transformed to a human girl?! What is going on here?! This is most unusual!
She left her laptop...? A talking laptop at that... So, this was anticipated by her...
She dropped her laptop in her haste... Wait, the laptop is talking? So, this must be planned, then.
That's Chihiro's laptop, right?... I can hear a voice coming from it... Makes me think that this is part of a plan...
There's no need to take such a drastic step, Tomoko... I'm pretty sure any similarities you have with Hex Maniacs are purely coincidental!
Any resemblance the Hex Maniacs have with you is accidental, Tomoko!... It would be a stupid thing to do otherwise.
It's getting away!... Are you hurt, Miko? I don't what kind of a ghost that was, but thank goodness it didn't attack you!
Arceus damn it, I wasn't able to react quickly enough! Did it do anything to you, Miko? That was a scary encounter indeed!
Giratina be banished, that was almost a dangerous attack by that ghost, Miko. Don't you worry, I'll be more alert next time it shows up.
I can't tell if my memory is failing me... but you seem to be acting ...differently since we last met. I don't remember you being ...like this...
Call it a misjudgment of character or whatever you may... but I didn't think you'd have such an ...interesting personality...
This is quite an ...unorthodox behaviour from a trainer of your status, Moon. You seemed to be more calm and composed during our battle.
What?! That was one of the most irresponsible things I've ever seen! And believe me, I've seen a lot of those!
... That violates so many gun safety regulations, I don't even know where to begin!
Just be thankful nobody was hurt, but never, ever do that again!
Just what are you doing? Playing the odds, seeing how many times you can do this without hitting yourself?!
Sooner than later, someone would get hurt in this little game you're playing, Aimee! I am urging you to stop!
A gun is not a toy! You shouldn't be playing around with one!
I'm pretty sure discharging a gun in these circumstances is illegal... Where's Officer Jenny when you need her?
If you do that one more time, I have no choice but to intervene, Aimee. This is your only warning.
You need to go to therapy, Aimee. So will we, if this keeps up.
This is getting rather uncomfortable now... Even more uncomfortable than it already did...
No wonder Sinnoh has a total gun ban...
... Just when I thought I've seen everything from you, you do something even more absurd...
... Perhaps it would be better if I moved to the Distortion World too...
... I didn't know gun fetishism was this literal...
Well... that's that issue taken care of. I would presume that you're going to be a harmless spirit from now on, so I'll let you stay.
I suppose without the knife, you're just a harmless spirit. I don't need to take any further action against you, then.
Yes, the surrealist movement. Or perhaps the Decadent movement might also apply in this situation.
I suppose this game will really feel surreal when we are near to the end.
... You're an alien?... Say, would you happen to be one of those entities from Ultra Space that I keep hearing about?
You're not from this planet... then that means you're one of those... creatures that originated from Ultra Space... Is that what you are, an inhabitant of Ultra Space?
Raccoons? Deers? Squirrels? I can't say I've heard of those... I suppose given the biodiversity between regions, I shouldn't have been surprised.

Hmm... I suppose there are still a lot I have to learn about other regions, particularly the more obscure regions... Oh, I can't wait to find out what else there are to discover aside from your deer, and squirrel!
Being a Pokémon trainer can be quite the undertaking, what with having to split time training your entire team. Anyway, I am curious about the level of boxing you compete in.
Between all the training and traveling, Pokémon training is essentially a full-time job, so I understand why you chose not to be one. Anyway, you are a boxer, but at what level? I'm just curious.
Really? I'm just shocked that you're a painter at all, and the fact that you've done so despite your disabilities... How remarkable!
A prolific painter born with no arms... That's rare enough throughout history, and to have met one for personally...What are the odds?
I was going to allude to the fact that many revolutionary leaders die early, but I can tell that you're doing quite well for yourself.
Well, revolutionary leaders tend to die before their revolutions come to fruition, but I suppose there's no reason to suspect the same will happen to you.
Well, Hex Maniacs are similar to psychics, but even weirder and more dissonant. They seem to have an obsession with the occult, and body length robes.
The most succinct way I could describe a Hex Maniac is by referring to them as psychics that have lost their mind, and taste in fashion.
You know what they say: "Never judge a book by its cover." Even the most gentle of people can show their true colors from time to time. Not that I'm saying that it applies to you, of course...
Fierceness can come in all shapes and sizes, you know. If you corner a creature, it will show a ferocity that you might not know it has. Of course, it might or might not apply to you also...
My, you must work with massive creatures to necessitate such a device. Most creatures I know would be severely injured by a needle that thick!
And what exactly do you work with? I can't even imagine how large a creature must be to make that thing practical, let alone safe.
You can't even look me in the eye, as if you're frightened of me... I've figured it out! You have anxiety! Who wouldn't in a game like this?
You would tense up every time I looked in your direction... And you have such a strong look of fear in your eyes... You must be worried that I'll beat you in this game! Isn't that it?
That's a lot of features for a single suit. It is way more advanced than what the Poké Center have. I suppose when you're in the middle of combat, you shouldn't compromise safety.
I would assume that your suit already contains all the features and equipment needed for in-combat medical services. I can't say I've seen anything quite like it.
What happened to your clothes?... Anyway, I have indeed read that Orre has no native wild Pokémon, so the presence of a Pokémon gym would be ultimately pointless.
How did your clothes get shredded?... But regarding the topic of Orre, I remember reading that there are no routes connecting their cities, so travel is non-existent.
To be fair, alchemy didn't really die. It was simply incorporated as part of chemistry. Anyhow, I'm still curious as to what you do as a bioalchemist, Sucrose?
If you're wondering, the lessons from alchemy haven't been lost, but was instead used as a precursor of chemistry. Speaking of wondering, I'm still curious about your work, Sucrose.
Ah, a little field research never hurts. I remember Professor Rowan used to do those often, but lately he seems to be suffering from the side effects of being old.
Professor Rowan used to always say that field research is the best type of research, and nothing will stop him from doing so. Well, except old age, it seems.
Indeed, there's so much to see in Lumiose City. I've even heard that the tower at the center of the city is a gym. I imagine the view up there is absolutely breathtaking.
It's said that you can wander around in Lumiose City, and not run out of places to discover. The tower at the city's center also doubles as a gym. The perfect spot for taking pictures.
That's splendid then. I'm sure my friends there will be very pleased to meet you. We are a very close pack, and a friend of a friend is also their friend.
I guarantee that you'll love Unova, and my friends there will love you too. They are very eager to meet new people all the time.
Wouldn't performing a land reclamation project of that scale have a negative impact on the aquatic ecosystem? How do you plan to subdue that?
Your goals have some nobility in them, but have you thought about the impact that would have against aquatic Pokémon? It would be quite severe indeed.
Ah, if you feel that way... I mean this will be just like back then, when you were traveling around Sinnoh. Anyhow, there are a lot of things we can do in Kalos that we couldn't in Sinnoh...
Well, if you don't mind, then I would love to come to Kalos with you, Dawn. This will be just like old times. There are a lot of interesting places to explore in Kalos.

Well, a Champion and a Professor getting into a romantic relationship is a bit unusual, no?... But, I don't think there's anything inherently wrong with that... Not that I'm implying we should be together...
Don't quote me on this, but having a Champion and a Professor in a romantic relationship is a bit taboo, wouldn't it? Personally, I think it shouldn't be... Not that I'm saying we should...
After all, a Champion and a Professor being in a relationship... It somehow feels right, like it's meant to be that way... Hypothetically speaking, of course.
I know some people might consider it a bit of a taboo, but a Champion and a Professor being romantically involved makes logical sense... Not that I'm saying we should do it...
Oh, that's good to know... How would you like if we go on a date after this game is over, Dawn? I would like to explore this in a less compromising environment...
I know this was a lot to take in for you in such a short time, Dawn... but if you like, we should go out after this game just to talk things over. Consider it our first date...

state.text: ... Well, fair enough. Just know that if either of them starts causing trouble, I won't hesitate to use the necessary force.
... I suppose that makes sense. If you ever change your mind, I'll be always happy to help in disposing them. Or perhaps I can make that decision myself if they ever become violent.

case.state: The devil is in the details, isn't it? Granted, given the effectivity of your staff, saving it as a last resort is a worthwhile compromise.
Well, sounds like a good progress, despite the drawbacks. I suppose that you save your staff for only fatal injuries. No need to use it for relatively minor injuries.
Indeed I do, ~mari~! I came here for this exhilarating card game, and the sense of high-stakes competition!
You're correct in that regard, ~mari~! I always love the thrill of competition, and this card game provides just the excitement I was looking for when I joined!
A barrier? Would this barrier be a fence or even a wall? I never would have though such isolationist regions still exist. It must have been quite a risk for you to even venture outside the boundary.
I've heard that Galar is quite restrictive when it comes to border control, but not to the extent of building a physical barrier. Would you be in trouble if people found out you crossed the boundary?
Florina, dear... you're, uhh... (Do I tell her?)
Florina, dear... you're, uhh... you're kind of... (Do I tell her?)
Florina, dear... you're, uhh... you're kind of... (Should I tell her?)
Florina, dear... your... rear is kind of... (Should I say it?)
Florina, dear... your... rear is a bit ex-... (Should I say it?)
Florina, dear... your... butt is... (Should I say it?)
Florina, dear... your... butt is kind of... (Should I say it?)
Florina, dear... your... butt is ... it's...
Florina, dear... your... butt is ... it's on display...
For your sake, Florina, you might want to turn around, but the rear view isn't so bad either.
Florina, dear... your... butt is ... it's on display... Was this maybe intentional?
Catch a glimpse? Of what, your pussy?
Showing off your valuables now? Where was this sort of eye candy a few rounds ago?
Catch a glimpse? Of what, your valuables?
Catch a glimpse? Of what, your breasts?
Mia, I think you're showing off something more precious than your boobs...
Mia, I think you're showing off something more valuable than your boobs...
Mia, I think you're showing off something more valuable than... uhh, well, let's just say I think you got the order wrong...
Mia, I think you're showing off something more valuable than... uhh, well, let's just say I think you got the order wrong... Right?
Anyhow, you must be returned to your trainer, ~name~... Ah, but I can't walk out of this game just like that! I'll look for your trainer, after.
Once this game is over, I'll dutifully return you to your trainer, ~name~, wherever they are. We can't just have stray Pokémon walking about in a place like this.
I wonder how the existence of people with the same complexion as you might have impacted history...
I think I recall a story involving people with your skin color...
I certainly hope your skin color isn't induced by illness, because it looks really bad otherwise. The disease, I mean, not your complexion.
You know, destroying your ~clothing~ like that might not be the most practical of ideas since you still have to travel home after this.
Well then, I'm assuming your ~clothing~ didn't have much value for you if you were going to do something like that.
I have to give you style points for trying out an unconventional stripping routine like that, not that it would do anything to increase your chances of winning.
Well... that's the last we'll see of your ~clothing~ then...
Just because you lost your ~clothing~ didn't mean that you had to destroy it...
I suppose the old fashion way of removing your ~clothing~ was too normal for your tastes...
Huh, I wonder if having someone strip your clothes for you makes it more awkward or less...
There were some cultures where members of the royal family would always have helpers removing their clothes for them. They probably never removed their own clothes in their lives.
Saving some energy, ~name~, or are you just too reluctant to remove your ~clothing~ yourself?
I'm sensing something different here, and I'm not just talking about your partner doing your stripping for you, ~name~...
This is quite an interesting way of mixing things up. I never considered having someone strip my clothes for me.
Is this part of a power play or something?
Let's just hope you get your ~clothing~ back after this game is over.
Reserved for future Neptune Interaction. Report this bug if you see this message.
(Report this line if you see it. This changes her AI to Bad.)
