While we're waiting for everybody to finish, how about I tell a classic child's tale from Sinnoh to pass the time? The title of this story is "The Sentimental Rotom".
This looks like it might take a while to complete, so I thought I should tell everyone of a story that was relayed to me during my stay at Unova. The title of this story is "The Faithful Tepig".
Since everybody has free time while waiting for the forfeit to end, now would be a good time for me to tell the Sinnoh Creation Story. I'm sure some of you had been curious about it.
Once there was a Rotom who lived in an Old Chateau that has long been abandoned. With nobody there, the Rotom passed the time by possessing a television. Every day, this was all the Rotom did.
One day, the Rotom felt sentimental, and decided to leave the Old Chateau. It wanted to explore Sinnoh, and see the sights and sounds it saw in the television with its own eyes.

Its travel eventually brought it to the Celestic Town Cultural Center, where it came across a Lass with no arms. Despite her disabilities, this Lass dreamed to be a painter. The Rotom felt compassionate.
The Rotom's next destination was at Veilstone City, where it met a Rancher that wanted to shoot rockets from his shoulder. Using a homemade contraption, he could point but not shoot.
The Rotom was moved by the Rancher's determination, so he possessed the contraption, which allowed the Rancher to shoot rockets like he aspired. The Rancher found no fault with the new contraption.
The Rotom dispossessed the contraption, but the contraption remained functional as if the Rotom was still fused with it. The Rotom was thanked heartily by the Rancher, before setting off again.
The Rotom next arrived at Veilstone City, where it met a cowardly Ranger. The Ranger had no trust in the handguns issued to him, which had made him cowardly against the danger he might face.
The Rotom approached the cowardly Ranger, and possessed his guns. The guns powered increased tenfold, and continued to do so even after the Rotom had dispossessed it.
Despite having the most powerful guns in all of Sinnoh, the Ranger remained cowardly, and the Rotom had to accept the fact that some people can't be helped.
The armless Lass became a well known painter, the perseverant Rancher became one of the most prominent Ranchers in all of Sinnoh, while the cowardly Ranger became a powerful, cowardly Ranger.
So, how did everyone enjoy "The Sentimental Rotom"? It's such a fascinating story, no wonder it has remained an enduring classic among bedtime stories.

Once there was a young trainer, whose skills in battle can be considered as prodigious. Her dream was the same as every young trainer: to become the Champion. First, she had to collect all 8 of the gym badges.
One by one, she carved through the gyms with relative ease, gaining the badges in quick succession. Despite this, the effort would leaver her physically and emotionally drained after each battle.

Every evening, she would feel empty inside, but she didn't need to worry. Her close relationship with her Pokémon meant that they would fill her up every night, helping her relieve her tension, and leaving her in bliss.
This cycle would go on every day, with her battles leaving her drained, and her Pokémon afterwards would be hard at work, making her feel loved and full inside.
Unfortunately, the young trainer did not love her Tepig as much as she did to her other Pokémon, viewing it as small, weak, and unsatisfying. She hatched a plan to get rid of him once and for all.
The young trainer tricked the Tepig deep into the forest, and told him to stay. For 7 days and 7 nights, the Tepig obeyed. On the 8th day, the Tepig finally realized what had happened.
After yet another tiring day, the young trainer was sleeping with her Pokémon when a disturbance emerged from the forest. Her team was caught by surprise, and was immediately defeated.
The young trainer saw that the aggressor was an Emboar. Not just any Emboar either, but it was the Tepig that she had abandoned in the forest!
The Emboar then showed off his physical prowess to the young trainer, who was left breathless by the sudden display of dominant strength. The Emboar was much larger than her other Pokémon had been.

Completely satisfied by her Emboar, the young trainer brought him back to her team. The Emboar was large and dominant, both during and after battles, and it was everything the young trainer could have asked for.
Well, that's the end of that story. This was only told to me verbally by a colleague from Unova, and I have to confess I haven't heard of the story from other sources. Anyway, did everyone enjoy it?

There was this cave painting inside the Celestic Ruins... It's been said to tell the story of the creation of Sinnoh. It has a large orb in the middle, with three lights forming a triangular perimeter.
It's always been described this way: the light in the center represents either Dialga or Palkia appearing at the Spear Pillar. The three lights around it were thought to be Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf.
But, then, I realized that there may be another way of interpreting this. Could this triangle of lights actually represent a different trio? Could they be Dialga, Palkia, and Giratina instead?
And the large light at their center. Does it represent something else? Could it be what created this world of ours? May I continue for a little bit longer? Thank you for listening.
There are some ancient plates that are being found all over Sinnoh. One of them had this engraved on it: "Two beings of time and space set free from the Original One."

I think this quote, too, points to the presence of another Pokémon. A Pokémon even more powerful than Dialga or Palkia. Could this have been talking about Giratina, the enigmatic member of the Creation Trio?

It's said that in the Distortion World, neither time nor space were stable. I think that tells us something about Giratina, the only Pokémon there. It must have been as powerful as Dialga and Palkia, the rulers of time and space.

In some way, though, Giratina has to have a power opposite of theirs. A long time ago, Dialga's Roar of Time...Palkia's Spacial Rend...To the people back then, those Pokémon really must have appeared to rule over time and space.

Seeing them must have shaken the people to their very core. That painting represents those feelings of awe, wonder, and everything else. It passed that memory to countless people, eventually becoming a myth...

That's what I believe as a researcher of myths. All my studies and research, all those hours of digging and scrolling through old manuscripts... This was the final product. My interpretation of the Sinnoh Creation Story.
I think I let myself get carried away and talked for far too long. I'm sorry, and thank you. I hoped this has piqued your interest in the creation story of not just Sinnoh, but other regions as well.
The Rotom possessed a mannequin, and showed the Lass how to paint on a canvas using only the feet. The Lass was so awestruck by the display that she learned to paint with her feet.
